Reviews.Title: “Hotel and Valet”
Reviews.Author: Tommy L
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at this hotel several times in the past we love it. They have added a new Valet service that is a wonderful plus for the hotel. The staff is wonderful . Everyone is such a pleasure to deal with. Outstanding job , the rooms could use a little tinder loving care updating for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Another Nice Stay at the Best Hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: bluesfanillinois
Reviews.Content: Stayed there from Aug.26th to Sept.2nd and it was great as usual. We always stay here and have for years because it is the best on the beach. The rooms are always nice and clean and the pool and deck area are really nice. You can eat on the deck or inside the restaurant with great views of the ocean.Their is a beach rental on the beach in front of the hotel to rent lounge chairs and umbrella's from. The guy (Tom) always goes way out of his way to get your group set up and is super nice. Would highly recommend staying here if you are in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing labor day stay”
Reviews.Author: Mtucker58
Reviews.Content: The pool area of this hotel was absolutely perfect. After long walks on the beach, Meagan and Lara (pool servers) attended to our every creature comfort. Umbrella's, chairs, beverages, and lunch that was far above typical F and B options at a pool. 4 diamond comfort all around and a clever late holiday checkout (6pm) for a nominal fee. Great to see young people enjoy their job and serve their guests with passion. Nice flavored water at all times was a nice touch after hours in the sun.

Reviews.Title: “Fun Place...Nice People...Great Beach!!!”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I have stayed at many beach resorts around North, Central and South America. Shores Resort & Spa is a lot of fun and a great value. Beach is great!! I'd say it is the best hotel in Daytona. Valet was very accommodating; I especially liked the courtesy bus to take you around to bars and dinner....a great touch that we don't see very often. As far as couples go...the pool area has a lot of families with kids so we found the umbrella rentals on the beach as the better place for us to relax. The Tiki bar is fun and has a great feel with live music and perfect view of the ocean. We had breakfast every morning outside and everything was exceptional. I will return!!

Reviews.Title: “Great experience, wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Eva D
Reviews.Content: We spend a weekend at the Shores. It was my daughters birthday, so we got 2 rooms that were interconnected. Everything was great, the rooms, the view (we got the ocean and river view rooms), the staff. We enjoyed our time, my daughter had a wonderful birthday. I had some ideas on how to surprise my daughter on her birthday starting at 12:01am on her birthday day, and the staff helped me out. I appreciate their help, they were ready to help you. GREAT,GREAT,GREAT!!!!!! I will definitely go back there. I HIGHLY recommend this hotel. The prices were reasonable, the service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: ebcritic
Reviews.Content: My husband and I loved our stay at Shores Resort and Spa. Our room was fantastic with a great view. Everyone did a great job to make our stay perfect. We loved the pool area and the beach. Our dinner at Azure was outstanding. I highly recommend this hotel. I will stay here on all trips to Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back!”
Reviews.Author: Pamela R
Reviews.Content: Great time here. The lobby is large and decorated tastefully with a full bar and dining area. Our room had a desk, couch, chair and the king bed was very comfortable. Plenty of lighting too. Lots of clean hot water in shower and plenty of towels with 2 plush robes. And that room sure was clean! The view from our room was perfect. We were steps from the pool and beach. Loads of clean beach towels poolside. Great poolside and pool bar service. Room service was quick and complete. Didn't miss anything. But it's the staff that makes this Resort above the rest. Everyone from the front desk to the Limo driver, Jimmy were so polite, cheerfull and accomadating. The ladies in the Spa were fantastic and gave us every penny's worth of service! I am so looking forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Watch your valuables!”
Reviews.Author: LTStewart
Reviews.Content: I spent one night for a girls weekend. We had been in the past and for something close (we live in Orlando) and reasonably priced, its not a bad place to stay. The food is good, so we actally never left the property and charged all meals to the room. The problem came when we checked our bags after checking out Sunday to spend the afternoon by the pool. I hesitated to check my purse, but was assured the area was secure. However, when we picked them up, I checked my wallet and discovered that all of my cash was missing. As we had charged everything to the room, I did not use any cash, and my purse was either in the room, or with the front desk. When I reported the missing cash, all four people at the desk looked at me like I had three heads, and only stated that the room has a code an no one could get in. Of course, this leads me to believe it was someone there. My friend asked if we could at least complete some type of report, and no one knew what to do. 20 minutes later, they found a report and took my information, but did not complete it. They gave me a supervisor's card, who I contacted my email, but never recieved a response. While I probably should have been more careful, it is very disappointing to think that you cannot trust the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel on Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: debbieblinkhorn
Reviews.Content: Shores resort and spa, is pure luxury, from the rooms, with the king size beds that are so wonderful and high, you need a step ladder to climb in. The fires around the pool area at night to make s'mores. All ocated on the Atlantic Ocean, on beautiful Daytona Beach. The restaurant is great, and service is also great. Can not wait to go back in 3 weeks.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend Get Away”
Reviews.Author: mrstaiger
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent the weekend at “The Shores”. We never left the whole weekend. With the great, service, food, and beverages there was no need to anywhere else. Cooking smores at sunset on their deck was a great experience and opportunity to meet other folks.

Reviews.Title: “Never Got Past The Lobby”
Reviews.Author: BrynBoston
Reviews.Content: We booked a night at The Shores to visit family nearby. Despite holding a confirmed reservation guaranteed with a credit card, there was no room available for us when we arrived at 11:30 PM. We should have known there was an issue when the bellman declined to take our bags from the car, telling us to wait to be sure our room was ready. My husband replied that it ought to be ready since it was nearly midnight. When we stepped into the seedy lobby we were told that they had overbooked and would "walk" us to a reciprocal hotel down the strip. We declined and located our own alternate hotel. The 10 minutes we spent in the Shores' lobby were unimpressive - I only recognize 2 of the photos on the website. There may be a stunning lobby just around the corner, but it was not the area we stood in listening to sirens on the strip surrounded by what looked like old living room furniture. The whole experience was entirely unlike anything I have experienced at mediocre hotels - let alone 4 star resorts. Unless it gets a lot better once you get past the lobby, and you don't mind a little roulette with your reservation, I'd pass on this one.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay, good value in August”
Reviews.Author: Clare B
Reviews.Content: I was in Daytona Beach for business over the last two weeks and chose The Shores because of it's AAA 4 diamond rating. It is not the luxury beach resort I expected, but it is a lovely property. I was in an ocean view room with balcony, and it was well-appointed. I had no issues that other reviewers have complained about re: cleanliness, my room was fine. The bed was comfortable, the linens were nice, and the room was a nice size. The robe was a nice touch, and perfect for watching the sun rise from my balcony. The room rate was incredibly reasonable, (not much more than the Marriotts by the airport and speedway), perhaps because it's the off-season. I was there on a Thursday night and the happy hour in the lobby was lovely. We had dinner in the hotel restaurant (delicious, and not overpriced) and danced to the live music in the bar afterward. As to those expressing dismay with the resort fee, I've found those things to be standard at most beach resorts and $20 a day is not bad to me. I've been at Marriott Renaissance properties where they were 20% of the room rate. However, I did think that $30 for chairs and an umbrella on the beach is steep given that they do charge this resort fee. I did have some issues with getting copies of my bill-they had my e-mail address incorrectly, and even when it was corrected, I still never got it. Also, it's kind of frustrating that even when you are on the property, you have to call their reservations line to make any changes, and the line is not open 24/7. However, in my mind these are minor issues and are just what you get when you deal with a smaller independent hotel as opposed to a national chain brand. I would stay at The Shores again if I am in Daytona Beach for business or pleasure.

Reviews.Title: “Just Ok”
Reviews.Author: Kelly R
Reviews.Content: I had read the reviews on this hotel and figured we were in for a treat hardly !! This hotel states they are the only 4 star triple diamond on Daytona Beach I would have preferred staying at the Holiday Inn.... The rooms were OK HBO did not work , we found someones old t shirt in the pull out sofa and the bathroom showers stink ! They looked like they were about fall out of the wall and made a awful sound while on. Part of the wall was spackled but never painted ? Parking is across the street forget about it if you forget something in your car it will take you a day to get back and forth. I am still trying to understand why they charge a $20 a day resort fee . The bar and restaurant were very nice and elegant but besides that just ok . We asked for a balcony and had gotten a lovely view of a roof without a balcony then were told to try back tomorrow . When we asked again the folowwing day the Hotel staff rolled her eyes and asked Who told us that ? Because most likely you wont get one ??? If you plan to spend most of your time at the bar restaurant and beach then this is the place for you otherwise I would opt for the Holiday inn !!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area”
Reviews.Author: lwsathome
Reviews.Content: The Shores is a really great hotel in a not so great area of the beach. That's right--the beach isn't all that great. But if you're looking for hotels in Daytona Beach Shores, you already know that. The hotel is really nice for this area, however. I highly recommend the pool lanai rooms which open directly onto the pool deck. For the convenience, they are well worth the extra money. I would also recommend Pure Life Surf School which operates right next to the hotel. They offer kid's surf camps, and kid/adult private lessons throughout the summer. The instructors are fantastic and it was the highlight of our stay!

Reviews.Title: “What a SPLENDID and MEMORABLE stay!”
Reviews.Author: Onegalstreasures
Reviews.Content: The Shores is a new level of luxury- top notch- the premier place to stay if you are coming to Daytona Beach Shores! I was treated with first-class service from the moment I checked in. My boyfriend gave me a bouquet of roses before we arrived at the hotel. Jeanine –the front desk clerk- noticed the roses and asked if I would like a vase. No more than 10 minutes after checking into our room – she personally delivered a vase – plus scissors to cut the stems of the roses – WOW! It speaks very highly of how the staff is trained to provide 5 STAR service to every customer! The room’s décor was vibrant and pristinely clean – from the marble shower to the plush soft linens – this made the stay one that I will never forget. The dining experience was unparallel to what I have experienced at other hotels. The staff was very attentive and Chef Mike personally came out to meet us and invited us to try the fresh sea bass – which was truly delectable. After dinner, we were able to partake in “Shores and S’mores “. What a unique treat – to sit in comfortable adirondack chairs around a fire pit and enjoy s’mores. I was so impressed with the attention to every detail the staff made to make my stay splendid and memorable! If you can reserve a room with a balcony overlooking the ocean – it is definitely worth it!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent vacation by the sea!”
Reviews.Author: James W
Reviews.Content: The Shores is the premium oceanfront hotel in the Daytona Beach area. We were treated to luxurious accommodations and incredible service. The breakfast in the dining room overlooking the ocean is incomparable.

Reviews.Title: “The quiet end of Daytona Beach.”
Reviews.Author: notjustbows63
Reviews.Content: The community of Daytona Beach Shores is several miles away from the heart of Daytona Beach. It is very difficult to stay here unless you have a car because it is far away from everything. The do have free parking across the street from the hotel which is a plus. Apart from the on-site restaurant, there is really no place you can walk to and get a good meal. The breakfast at the restaurant is excellent whether you have the buffet or order from the a-la-carte menu. The French Toast with a Peach Compote is the best I have ever had. We had a balcony room on the 10th floor w/a view of the beach that was very nice. We enjoyed having the balcony in the early mornings as well as the early evenings. The staff is always polite and helpful. Our bathroom was tiny but clean and great water pressure in the shower. The pool is a bit small for the number of people that sit around it and swim in it. It was constantly filled with screaming kids so your best bet is to go to the beach for some quiet time. *Beware*, you are not allowed to take the pool towels to the beach; so you must bring your own beach towels to this hotel which is a problem if you are trying to travel with just a carry-on bag. Daytona Beach allows cars to park on the beach all day; so people drive their personal cars onto the beach and park in front of the hotel on the sand. The hotel does not have beach umbrellas or beach chairs. You can rent them privately in the beach in front of the hotel for 30 USD per day for two chairs and one umbrella. At night they have gas fire pits surrrounded by Adirondack chairs where you can relax or roast marshmallows. It is definitely, a family-oriented hotel.

Reviews.Title: “3 Day stay”
Reviews.Author: Olga C
Reviews.Content: Excellent! Ocean view with a balcony. Very friendly hospitable, caring, and catering to us with sincerity.The food was delicious with great presentation. I would definitely go back for a revisit as the staff were very attentive with their positive attitudes and smiling faces.

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the extra's!”
Reviews.Author: mikecot147
Reviews.Content: My wife and i recently stayed here over the past weekend to get married, and whilst it was nice, we sort of got the feeling we were conned a bit by the extra's which we weren't aware of, for example, when we arrived and booked in, we were informed of charges to park in their parking lot which was over the road from the hotel which was $20 per day! Now im not mean, but with the hotel room costing the best part of $300 per day, you would have thought parking was free. Also, after getting married the following morning, we wanted to celebrate with a couple of bottles of champagne which we had bought ourselves, and have their breakfast buffet in their restaurant which was $15 per head, when we opened the champagne, they told us they have to charge us a "corkage charge" of $20 per bottle, which under the circumstances, was a bit harsh to say the least! We had dinner on the Saturday evening in their restaurant, and we both ordered the steak. After finishing the starters, we had to wait the best part of 40 minutes for our main course, which was strange because the place wasn't busy, and when we enquired what was going on, they tried to make out they were late because i had ordered my steak well-done! Now im not a chef, but even i know it does not take that much longer to cook a well-done steak than a normal steak! Overall, the hotel was nice and clean, staff were helpful, but felt disappointed by the extra's we had to pay, but i guess you live and learn.

Reviews.Title: “nice stay”
Reviews.Author: tn02
Reviews.Content: We stayed here on our way back to GA from Orlando. Our room was a king a riverview room w/ a balcony, but you saw very little river. It's basically a king room w/ a view of the road and parking lot. But, the room is well insulated and you cannot hear the street cars. The bad part about this place is that it costs $ to valet. We didn't valet, so we self-parked across the street and had to walk across a tunnel to the entrance of the hotel. The bathrooms was nice because it had the vanity area outside of the sink/toilet/shower. Our bed was very comfortable, but you can tell that the paint on the bed posts were old and was wearing away. Overall, this was a nice room and stay away from the more tourist, crowded area of Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing..”
Reviews.Author: Penrumer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in the oceanfront room with King bed, perfect view of ocean and pool, the only thing I would recommend is requesting a room above 2nd floor if your going to get ocean front, when setting outside you would have more privacy because of pool. The bed and shower was amazing! I highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: “average at best”
Reviews.Author: captron197
Reviews.Content: Let me start by telling all people reviewing this hotel is that you will notice that the managment only responds to the good reviews. This is sort of typical of the organization of this hotel. We arrived for a work conference in July. As you pull in the covered entry way is chaotic. We headed in to check in and they asked for my keys even though we were not using valet. We tried to check in at 2 but the room was not ready but they did pre check us and said they would call us.........they never did. We finally got into the rooms whcih are nice but need a little attention to detail. The window was open and we were not able to close it and had to call maintenance. The air was not on and the room was extremely hot. The two biggest problems with the room is that the drain in the shower takes forever to drain and you are standing in about 5 inches of water as you shower. The second thing is that the tv is offset from the canopy bed. if you try and watch tv from the bed the post is in the middle of the tv. this hotel was possibly the loudest hotel i have ever stayed in. Doors slam all day and night. The rooms have an outer door that lead to the inner door so you get to hear both doors slam...next to you, across from you and above you. No rest in four days. The room service is good and fast. The staff is a mixed bag. Some are great and others could care less. The location is nice. If you want a poolside chair.....good luck. If you self park you must park across the street and enter a code to enter. Apparently they change the code on Mondays but do you think they tell the guests...........no.....good thing for cell phones because they do not answer the intercom from the parking lot. This property could be great but it appears that managment needs lessons in organization. It seems that this property is one of the nicer properties in Daytona but i dont think i could stay here again based on the noise alone.

Reviews.Title: “Stayed so long, it was like I lived there”
Reviews.Author: hcaines
Reviews.Content: I love love the bed. I am a manly man, but that big comfortable bed was great! You can do work on it, have breakfast and still have room for other stuff. Nice flat panel TV. Good staff. After a while, everyone knew who you were. Plus, I thought it was interesting that you walk through two doors to get to your room, instead of one. Great pool area.

Reviews.Title: “great hotel”
Reviews.Author: Adriana G
Reviews.Content: We stayed there during a beach vacation and had the best time! beautiful location, great rooms, and awesome staff! the beach is amazing and the outside pool area with the bomb fires is amazing!

Reviews.Title: “Best Beach Hotel in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: ParadiseEarth
Reviews.Content: We stayed here about a year ago and are planning to return in a couple of weeks. Great location, rooms are comfortable, well appointed and clean. Lobby, restaurant and outside spaces are inviting. The beach is very nice of course and there are plenty of activities to do in the area (biking, mopeds, walking, shopping etc).

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: Heather H
Reviews.Content: Love this place from the amenities to the service! Excellent BIG rooms, lots of extras from the Tiki Bar, beautiful views, towels at the pool, full service restaurtant/room service/pool service and nightime S'mores. don't bother looking or staying anywhere else this is the BEST place on this section of the East Coastline! Love it and will be back!!

Reviews.Title: “best resorts in daytona beach”
Reviews.Author: Tomahawk207
Reviews.Content: my girlfriend and i spent the weekend in daytona beach at shores resorts and spas. it was like an island getaway without leaving florida and leaving the the 10yr old kid behind, we had a oceanfront room on the second floor and the view was great. we also dined at the Azure the in house fine dining establishment, we both ordered the ribeye steak meduim rare which was perfectly cooked. after dinner it was a rainy weekend, but the rain stopped so we took a moonlight walk down the beach and on our where back there was a firepit with sits around. so, we stopped in for awhile and chatted with the other guest for alittle to get a better feel of the place.we met some very interesting guest who were there for the same reason to getaway for the weekend from the children. the next morning the sun came out and we spent the day laying in one of the many cabana style tents that were setup at one of the three pools. needless to say the pools were a great experiences and to finish off the the we both had a 50 minute swedish massage. if you want a getaway without leaving florida, shores is def the place to visit to escape the kidsand the city life hustle and bustle. all and all we both agreed the trip was well worth the the pricey cost it was. so, if you plan a trip to daytona beach shores resorta and spas is a def stay.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place!!!”
Reviews.Author: Angie319
Reviews.Content: Our experience was wonderful. Everyone on the staff was super friendly. Our room wasn't quite ready when we got there at 1pm but that was OK. We went out to lunch and it was ready when we got back. We got a King size oceanfront room with a pull-out sleeper sofa. The King bed was wonderfully comfy with several fluffy pillows. The sofa bed slept good...wasn't the best, but hey, it's a sofa sleeper. The view was absolutely amazing. The balcony was spacious and had a round table and two chairs. The only complaint about the room was that the in-room fridge was filled with stuff. We had brought some waters and Gatorades to put in the fridge and it was hard to find room. They want you to drink the stuff provided. A can of soda was $2.50 plus 18% service charge. It seemed ridiculous at the time but we ended up drinking 5 of them. It was cheaper than the bar and the beach vendors. I don't mind them charging more for the drinks but I was hoping for more room in the fridge to store our stuff. I guess we could have taken some of their stuff out. But, we didn't. This is my only complaint...and it's only a little complaint. My husband ate conch at the tiki bar outside and he said it was wonderful. Other than that and some beers and sodas, we did not eat or drink at their restaurant. The pool was nice, clean and warm. It wasn't that big though. There were plenty of lounge chairs around the pool. The pool went from 3 (or 3.5) feet to 8.5 feet deep. There was a hot tub and a little kiddie pool but I didn't use them. There are 3 fire pits outside where we could fire up some marshmallows (extra cost) in the evening. This seemed like a nice touch but we didn't do it. There is a beach vendor right outside the hotel on the beach that rents umbrellas and lounge chairs. We got one huge umbrella, small square table and two lounge chairs for $30 for the whole day (they close up at 5pm). This was wonderful. They also sell boogie boards and other water "toys". The boogie boards were $10 for the day. Great price for the enjoyment. There were 4 elevators and they all were quick. No complaints there. We never had to wait more than a minute for an elevator (we were on the 6th floor). You could have your car valet parked for $xx per day but they have a parking lot directly across the street for us to use. You park there and then walk across this cool, covered walkway that goes over the road. It was pretty neat and convenient. The parking lot was well lit and though it wasn't secured, you did have to have an access code to get in. Access to the beach was easy. There are about 14 steps down a staircase from the pool area and you are right on the beach. This is 'gated' and you need a code to get back in...though during the day the gate was never locked due to the activity of people coming and going. Overall, it was an excellent trip. I did a lot of research before booking this hotel. So many of the Daytona hotels are old and I've heard there are 'seedier' places. But, this one was AWESOME. Very well updated and fancy, IMO. It may be pricey but it was worth every penny!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with incredible beach views”
Reviews.Author: designext
Reviews.Content: This was our first time at The Shores and we would stay again. We stayed in a King Ocean View Balcony room and were very happy with it. The room and bathroom were very large with a king bed, large Tv, sitting area with pullout coach and large balcony with 2 chairs and a table. The only negative for us was the mattress comfort. Part of this is that we're spoiled with a great bed at home but it was average comfort for a resort quality hotel. The pool was a good size with easy access to the beach. The hotel has no beach chairs but 2 chairs and an umbrella can be rented ($30/day) from a company on the beach that does a good job with them. The restaurant was great for lunch 2 days and the staff was very friendly. The location is great with plenty of places to eat and shop nearby as needed. Overall we were very happy with our stay and would come again.

Reviews.Title: “amazing”
Reviews.Author: simondsellen
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful resort that is the nicest place on Daytona Beach! First class all the way. The restaurant is superb. I would highly recommend this resort. It also has a amazing spa.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous surprise Father's Day !!! Everything was perfect!!!”
Reviews.Author: travel4uflorida
Reviews.Content: This was our first stay at "The Shores". I purchased a premium package on-line and later upgraded to a wrap around corner room. The corner room had a huge patio sitting area, where we could view the ocean and feel the ocean breezes. All of the kids and some of the grands visited. The adults sat outside, the grands watched TV. The stay was perfect and the view spectacular. Mother nature provided perfect weather. The room had a king bed & a sofa bed, bathroom had a shower & a huge walk-in closet. After the family left we went down to the pool, used the hot tub, & sat around the fire pit. The sunset and sunrise were amazing. We did the self parking and walked through the over the A1A Rd tunnel to the hotel. The lobby is grand the room was all I expected it to be. Thank you:)

Reviews.Title: “Very nice, clean, and hotel staff went over and beyond their duties.”
Reviews.Author: Ssalt0504
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel!! The staff upgraded us at no cost to a ocean front view when we were willing to find out if they had any specials. The service was spectacular and the rooms were super clean! I loved the granite sinks and the hair care products provided. Our Maid even went out of her way to put our drinks on ice:). I will definitely be staying here again with my two children and husband..they loved it! She also put my daughter's stuffed animal on the pillow which made her so happy!!! I also loved the amenities the the beautiful view this hotel has to offer. This is a well rubbed facility and I thank management for making this happen and for all your hotel staff do. :)

Reviews.Title: “Watch out for the fees!”
Reviews.Author: teachseven
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at this hotel expecting to be wowed. We were more than disappointed. Based upon the reputation and cost, we thought we were really getting something special. Instead, we were charged extra fees per night for using the coffee pot in our rooms (whether or not we actually used them), wi-fi, parking, and the available newspaper in the lobby, again whether or not we picked one up. The bathtub drains were extremely slow so when you finished showering, you were standing in 4 inches of water, the drain was broken, paint on the bathroom sinks, dirty walls, broken solar lights on the patio, dirty patio, etc. A little maintenance would improve this property a lot. Another complaint we had is regarding parking. We paid fees to park in the hotel parking lot, but there were not always spots available because of a hearse convention in the parking lot and a wedding in the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place!”
Reviews.Author: beachboundfamily
Reviews.Content: Great rooms (large and clean), excellent dining and room service, and we love the Tiki Bar! Pool area is so nice and oceanfront beach chair and umbrella rental right in front of the hotel. Have always had a great experience with all members of the hotel staff. Can't go wrong here!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in the area.”
Reviews.Author: BCS21
Reviews.Content: I stayed here earlier this month. The staff is great and friendly. The food is great for the money I did not even have to go out and find a restaurant to eat at. The pool and spa is perfect and very clean . The room is great expecialy the in room amenities such as in room mini bar, DVD player, in room movies. The hotel is great all around. I will definitely stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel with Good Amenities”
Reviews.Author: chefeMark
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed here for 5 nights. The Hotel has 6 room types! We wanted a balcony with a sunset! We had a nice well decorated room with a view of the Halifax River and a large balcony. The room had a small refrigerator with a mini bar! This hotel was mostly adults until the weekend. The pool area is great with lots of recliners and a great view of the ocean! The drink service was outstanding! The pool area was always clean and had some nice fire pits! The hotel has a nice bar & restaurant. Their is a restaurant in the Peck Condos next door too! We walked down to the "Cow Licks Ice Cream Parlor" a couple of nights! The one major draw back with this hotel is its 3 miles from the convention center and the cops are thick with busting speeders! Daytona has really cleaned up the town with little or no street people! It was sad to see all the business that had gone out due to the economy! Blocks of empty buildings!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Daytona option”
Reviews.Author: Reaganspopy
Reviews.Content: I took the family down with me on a business trip. It has been years since we have been to Daytona and most of the memories I have from Daytona are not very fond. Most of the time the hotels are really run down or overwhelm with kids away from home for the first time. Not really something I was looking forward to. We decided Shores was far enough south of the action that we would have a pleasant trip. Check in was flawless and they even offered us a room with a better view without us asking. Staff and facilities where top notch with a couple of exceptions. The first beeping the room with a view would have been nice if you could actually se out of the filthy windows. Also we tried the restaurant a couple of time and apparently the incoming phone calls took presidence over actually customers, we never got a table and gave up. But a good time was had by all and we enjoyed our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot in Daytona area”
Reviews.Author: MJD1010
Reviews.Content: Just finished a two night stay at The Shores. I travel often for business and have had difficulty in the past finding a decent option in Daytona as everything seems very worn and outdated. I finally stumbled upon this hotel almost by mistake and I'm glad I did. What a breath of fresh air this place is! There was a good mix of business travelers and families staying for vacation. The Shores manages to cater to both quite effectively. After staying here two nights, I am baffled at its trip advisor ranking, definitely the best option in Daytona in my opinion. The surrounding area is quiet and less congested than the main Daytona Beach area just a few miles north. The beach area is nice, adequate pool and hot tub with a nice tiki bar. There is an upscale restaurant or the option to eat at the tiki bar (which is more like sandwiches/burgers, etc.). I ate both nights at the tiki bar and was pleasantly surprised each time. The bartender Lori has been there 9 years and seems to be well known/well liked by all. Some of the prior negative reviews are really misplaced. The pics of the bed are unfair...the frames have an artistic red coloring which a prior reviewer tried to make look like the bed was dirty or something. The hotel staff could not be more friendly. Lori is fun to talk to and the front desk manager, Jennifer, helped me out of a major scheduling jam with Expedia that was completely my fault. I didn't find any charges excessive or unreasonable. The Rooms are spacious, clean, and best I,ve encountered in Daytona. Each rom has a bag of marshmallows that you can take downstairs to roast in front of a fire pit which I thought was really unique. Love this hotel and will be back for business and perhaps even a family vacation (which says a lot given that my wife and I wrote off Daytona many years ago as being outdated and not really for us). Daytona needs more places like The Shores. Book here, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Needs more attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: tpcaron
Reviews.Content: Let's start with the good things. We love that this hotel is in the quieter area of Daytona Beach. We reserved a room on the 1st floor, facing the beach. This meant we had a semi-private lanai that was very convenient to the entire pool area. The views were beautiful! The rooms look cute at first, but the little details are overlooked. I was not impressed with the front desk staff. When they were friendly, it was in a fake manner. One time, I stood waiting while a female employee finished a personal conversation on the phone. The rooms need more attention to detail. There was peeling paint, tears in the canopy netting, and some stains on the carpet. I still gave them a good rating as they are comparatively better than many of the hotels in the Daytona Beach area. If you are looking to enjoy a nicer than average room, you spend a lot of time at the beach or pool, and do not expect much from hotel staff - this will be fine.

Reviews.Title: “Deceiptful Pricing”
Reviews.Author: Leah1222
Reviews.Content: Do NOT stay here unless you're prepared to spend one and a half TIMES what they tell you the price is going to be. I booked online through Priceline, so I didn't think I'd have to worry about that. When I got there, they charged CRAZY fees!!! I was not prepared to spend NEARLY as much money as they charged me, mostly because the "total cost" that was quoted to me was wrong. Insanely unhappy!! I complained to the hotel and they said to take it up with Priceline. I complained to Priceline and they said to take it up with the hotel. Ultimately, no one is taking responsibility for charging me way to much. DO NOT STAY HERE and DO NOT USE PRICELINE!!

Reviews.Title: “Glad we took the chance!”
Reviews.Author: TheCurvyGirl
Reviews.Content: My husband and I were in town for a beach wedding and most of the party booked at this hotel. I took the chance as well and was not disappointed. The staff were all friendly, the amenities were nice and the guest rooms and common areas were lovely. Neil (front desk) too very good care of us...we will be back!

Reviews.Title: “If you're looking for 4 stat hotel...keep looking.”
Reviews.Author: texans67
Reviews.Content: I'm here now & I'm so unhappy. First we check in at 5 & told the only room they have left is on the 2nd floor. WTF? Really? Can't believe we drove 9 hours to told a lie. Unbelievable. My beach front view that I paid for is actually Florida palm trees & a very busy pool. I would recommend calling to book to insure you get a higher floor. Room feels dirty to me. Im most upset at myself. I search hours before booking anything & can't believe I made a bad decision. The bad is the location, my view, and then the expired drinks in the mini bar. I've only been here an hour. The drinks were from 2008. It's June 1, 2012. I don't know what to say, but this is def not a 4 star resort I thought I booked. The good was my bellman, Angel he cheer me up & was very polite.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely!”
Reviews.Author: KristineO
Reviews.Content: This was our second time staying in this hotel. We chose to stay there because it is right on the ocean. We loved our too With an ocean view and king bed. Service is very good and the food is delicious! You don't even have to look for the outside place to eat, it's so wonderful. Love the pool outside and the bond fires at night. We will definitely be back!

Reviews.Title: “Nice atmosphere good staff but over spriced slightly”
Reviews.Author: Akmarimpietri
Reviews.Content: In the beginning we were having fun and enjoying our stay but could not quite find our niche in Daytona. The second day we had breakfast in azure and our server Sam was grade A not too pushing and really seemed to be genuinily interested in our stay. He told us some great places to relax around town and get into the feel. Altogether it was your great staff and people who seemed to enjoy the place they lived that made our weekend.

Reviews.Title: “So much potential....so little attention to detail”
Reviews.Author: lcostin
Reviews.Content: I had to do an overnight in daytona for business and decided to stay at the Shores. The staff and lobby area are really nice and the rooms are sizeable. Unfortunately if you have an eye for detail and cleanliness then you will likely be dissappointed with this hotel. The self parking is located across the street and you have to go over a walkway to get back to hotel...which wouldn't be a problem if the walkway and attached elevator was clean. The same trash, cigarettes and cans that were on the walkway when I checked-in were there when I checked-out the next morning. The riverview room that I booked (which is actually code word for street view with an obscured view of the HALIFAX RIVER) was noisy and the carpet was increadibly stained. The hotel was nice enough to move me to an ocean view room which was better from a view standpoint but still suffered in the area of cleanliness. There was an empty dole fruit cup on the floor next to the nightstand and a hairball in the shower. I opened the sliding glass door to at least hear the sound of the waves and a swarm of mosquitoes came into the room. Needless to say I had a restless night. The best parts of my stay were the nice staff (Aaron, Bob, Kristin and Christine) and checking out! With a lot more attention to detail and cleanliness this hotel could be great. Carpet and funiture upgrades are needed. Management, Staff and Valet that greeted me on the way in and out were really great. lc

Reviews.Title: “in house food prep. Excellent !”
Reviews.Author: ricoricorico
Reviews.Content: The best grilled cheese sandwich in the world. Many more dishes worthy of the 4 star rating! Wish i could eat there all the time. Ambiance, entertainment, and food all a great value!

Reviews.Title: “It was Ok, Not Sure How It's a 4 Diamond Hotel”
Reviews.Author: racer_chick79
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here in May 2012 with a group of friends for a relaxing/fun weekend. It was ok, but I feel it was overpriced for what you get and the service you receive. I would look at other hotels before returning if I wanted to go to Daytona for the same type of event again. Arrival/Parking - A bit chaotic, was told it was $16 for valet (I had previously been told $10 prior to arrival). I chose to self park across the street. Room - We were in an Executive Ocean Front Lanai (ground floor). There were never enough towels, we had 4 people in the room and they always brought 3, even when I checked they knew there were 4...or reminded them to bring or leave 4. The shower pressure was GREAT, however it drained very, very slowly and it really needs a door or something on it. I'm not sure who thought putting the closest in the shower area was a good idea, but it makes your clothes damp...bad idea. Our sink was leaking from the time we got there, until we left....even though we called to have it fixed, and they said they came to fix it. The light in the area outside the bathroom was out, and was never replaced either. The sliding glass doors to get out to the pool area are HEAVY, I'm sure it's for storm reasons, but it is very hard to open/close them. I did not like the bed/pillows and barely slept because of it, my husband did not have an issue. The rest of the room was ok, nothing special, but nothing bad. Pool/Hot Tub - The pool was nice as it was heated, however there were no towels in the area where they are supposed to be. I even asked an employee if he could get some more please, and he said sure. 20 minutes later, no towels....so I walked around dripping everywhere, oh well. The hot tub was not working when we first got there, but it was fixed later on. We enjoyed sitting in here quite a lot, but the second day it was being used a lot more and got disgustingly dirty so I stopped going in. Food/Drinks - We enjoyed the food we had here, especially breakfast. The portions are large, and tasted great. We had an issue trying to find someone to take our order the first day, the second day was a lot easier as we joined friends already seated. The drinks were great also for the most part, some are over-hyped on their menu, but I'll let you try and figure it out because you may like them. We had multiple staff tell us the initial bag of smores in the room are included with the room, but on checkout we were charged $10. I asked why, and they said the first bag is free, but you have to pay $10 to restock the next bag of them. Nice and tricky wording there people! Staff - I found that about half of the staff were great, and half couldn't wait to get out of the place and go home. This is from myself and the experience of the group of 11 I went with. The ones that were nice went out of their way to make sure we were taken care of. The other ones were incredibly rude, and sometimes insulting. I'd also like to note, which is not included in my rating of the hotel, that I was not that impressed with Daytona Beach. The sand was hard and ugly, to include the water being pretty ugly looking as well. There was some surf good enough for my friends to surf a bit though, so they were able to have some fun. Oh, and it was ICE COLD in the water. I was not expecting it to be like Jamaica or St. Lucia, but with all the hype surrounding Daytona, I thought it would be a bit nicer. I'm sure if you have never been to the beach before, you will be happy, but I live in FL and have been to many other beaches around the world and in the USA. We did rent an umbrella, 4 chairs, and a little table from the guy on the beach for $50....and they were extremely nice and helpful. Our group did have a lot of fun because we were there together and we have fun pretty much anywhere we go! I would have been extremely disappointed if we had stayed here for something extremely important.

Reviews.Title: “Nicest in Daytona, Lots of Extra Charges”
Reviews.Author: Havamama
Reviews.Content: We have family in the Daytona area, so we stay in town several times a year. The Shores Resort and Spa is the nicest of the accommodations we have found (and of course the most expensive). The hotel is clean and well-kept; the beach is pristine; the saltwater pool and jacuzzi were refreshing. We had an oceanfront king room with balcony. The additional services do add up and, since they're happy to charge everything directly to your room, the charges can accumulate quickly. I found the concierge to be singularly unhelpful in this regard. One problem might be that the concierge is also the check-in staff. To get as much info as one might want to be a savvy hotel guest, you would have to be willing to hold up the line (which I should have done). An example: We paid the $17/day resort fee so that we could use the fitness center (also covers shuffleboard, which I never saw, and bocce courts, which I also never saw). We did not know that the fee also covered self-parking. So we were charged an additional $16/day (plus tips) for valet service. Bike rentals cost an additional $18/half day (or $36 for full day), even though the bikes are onsite. Why is this not covered in the resort fee? The in-room information was inaccurate, so it was not a good guide. This is one example of several. If you want to reserve anything that might be in short supply (cabanas, which are only available for full-day rental at $70/pop despite the half-day option listed in the in-room information, or bicycles), call ahead and book the days you would like in advance. That said, we did enjoy our stay here. Waking up to the waves crashing and taking early morning walks on the gorgeous beach made up for the minor annoyances. Now that we know what to look out for, we will consider staying here again. But we will guard our wallets!

Reviews.Title: “Stay here!”
Reviews.Author: UF_Rhonda
Reviews.Content: This property is the hidden gem of the East Coast! My husband and I use any excuse we can find to stay at this property. There is absolutely nothing negative that can be said about it. If you want to be treated like royalty, and play like a spoiled rich kid, this place is for you!!! Fresh linens, pastel walls, and netting around the bed, all combines to give you the feeling of a tropical oasis. The balcony is a favorite spot for morning coffee, or just to feel the ocean breeze. The food is exquisite. All of this at a totally afforable price! Ahh... time to go back... I miss it already!

Reviews.Title: “Nice digs if you must be in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: JAFCH
Reviews.Content: Our large family group went to celebrate an Embry-Riddle Graduation. Daytona beach is one of the most unattractive beach cities I've every visited but if you have to be there The Shores is a nice hotel right on the beach with good service and better than average food. The beds were comfy. I was eaten alive by bugs... no screens on huge sliding glass doors in room. As I said if you must go to daytona The Shores may help make the stay pleasant.

Reviews.Title: “Has gone downhill the past few years”
Reviews.Author: KimAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I had visited The Shores twice in the past and just loved it. It is a really cute property with neat decor. However, my third visit was horrible. I wanted to get an extra pack of coffee for my room and I could not get the front desk to even answer the phone. I went and asked in person and was told it would be sent. It took forever and I again couldn't even call down and inquire becauase nobody would answer. Next, the shower was mildewy and slow to drain. My fave thing to do is have bkfst by the ocean so I was hugely disappointed to be told the restaurant patio was closed for construction. I ordered room service and that turned out fine (great banana pancakes). I was sad to see they no longer had the cute teddy bears on the guest room beds. My departure was not good. My 9-year old daughter and I went to look at the gift shop. I wanted to buy a shirt and maybe something for her. The sales associate said, "We don't have anything for kids in here", which seemed to me like she was asking us to leave. Next I got in line to check out. The manager was treating another customer very, very well, like they were old friends. I was waiting behind that man, and the manager just breezed right past without even saying good morning or inquiring about my stay. I noticed the overall clientele were business travelers dressed in suits, etc. and I felt like we were treated poorly because we were a family dressed in jeans/polo shirts. We happen to be upscale corporate workers but were trying to take some down time at the beach so we are not going to walk around in biz attire. The Shores lost the special place in my heart and I do not plan to go back. The service was infuriating.

Reviews.Title: “We had a great vacation!”
Reviews.Author: sharon h
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Shores Resort and Spa for 6 nights. (May 6-12 ) Because of some of the reviews we hesitated to spend that much if it was going to be an unpleasant experience. The hotel looked very nice, though a lot of the ceilings were a little low as in the inside dining room, but to us, that was minor. We found the staff to be courteous, friendly and well trained. We stayed in the King oceanfront with a sofa and balcony. The room was neat and clean with the poster bed...just like the picture. There was crown molding and chair rail with contrasting paint that gave it a nice touch. We loved to prop our feet up on the large padded gold footstool and could look at the beautiful beach and hear the crashing waves or even watch the large T.V. The large mirror over the sofa was good to use when he was in the bathroom and I was appyling last minute lipstick or a last look before we went out for dinner. We ate at the Azure three different times and found the food to be good and not overpriced. We both had shrimp dishes the first meal there and it was so much food that there was no way to eat it all or store it.......... I would have been happy just to stay there and eat at the Azure, but we wanted to venture out and try some other places. The bathroom was nice the waterfall showerhead was great and the water must have had a softener because my hair behaved really well. The vertical mirror behind the bathroom door was also a plus. We walked the beach at least twice every day and looked forward to the lemon/lime/orange cold water that they had for guests by the pool. We did get the feel of being on a private island with the music by the pool that started around 10am every morning. We were on the 4th floor, so we had a nice view of the water, the pool and the activities going on....i.e. two weddings were performed while we were there. We did eat out every day and thought it was worth the 9 mile drive to Gene's Steakhouse. Genovese's Italian resturant is not far up the street at Port Orange and has wonderful lasagna, etc. at resonable prices. We did use the small refridgerator and just took the things out and put them on the dresser. They will charge a $25. fee if you have them come and remove everything out of it. The few negative things are that the in-room coffee wasn't very good, but the Publix up the street had some coffee that came in pouches that we bought. Also, they could have a little more storage for clothing in the room. The last thing was that they did have some construction repair going on...but that was so minor....the waves and the music covered up the little bit of noise that they made. Overall, we would love to go back in the future and had a good experience and would recommend it to others. Rickshar Apollo Beach, Fl. .

Reviews.Title: “Surprisingly Good”
Reviews.Author: Village1386
Reviews.Content: I must admit I didn't expect much from this hotel based on prior experience at Daytona. This hotel is beautifully decorated, and the staff at all areas were very helpful and friendly. The food was very good, and again the staff were very accommodating to my request for vegan meals. The room was large, bright and comfortable, with beautiful views. One minor issue is that the shampoo was not replaced on the 2nd day. If you want to enjoy a peaceful pool lounge, forget it. They are always in party mode. However, I greatly enjoyed very long walks on the beach. Overall, I would return to this hotel and definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, great outdoor dining”
Reviews.Author: livewell2
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores Resort in early May, and it happened to coincide with the full moon - the view of the moon rise from the deck was spectacular! The food was very good, and the service is great. The rooms and property amenities are very nice; we did not use the spa, but it is very highly regarded. The big thing for us is the oceanfront location, and watching the sunrise from our balcony. The Daytona area is centrally located - we did not go to Orlando, but the parks are only an hour west. We did go to St. Augustine for a day, and it is a must do for anyone who appreciates history. Locally, the Museum of Arts and Sciences is nice, the Ponce Inlet Lighthouse is worth a visit, and the golf at the are courses is great!

Reviews.Title: “Poor Check in”
Reviews.Author: tedgws
Reviews.Content: We arrived at 2PM, the room was not ready and was told to come back at 4PM (normal check-in). Came back at 4:15, room still not ready and had to sit in the lobby for another hour while they cleaned the room. Overall the room and hotel is above average for Daytona Beach. The Room was very clean and roomy with excellent ocean view (Ocean View with balcony). The balconies are not private so if your gonna have a glass of wine while enjoying the ocean plan on enjoying it with your neighbors too.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a 4 star”
Reviews.Author: Tony R
Reviews.Content: Ac not working correctly,very hot in the room,the curtains had moth holes all over the room and in restroom,paint was peeling in the shower.food at resteraunt not good at all and everything came cold,steak and mashed potatoes were cold and pasta was no good either.the staff had no personalities and very stiff.the only good ones there was the bell hop and the valet parking.massages were excellent there.this place needs work and upgrades especially with that ac hotbox,summer is coming now,hate to see what temperature it's going to be in there.balcony had issues also couldn't even open up the sliding glass door to see the ocean view,maintance came and said they have issues here and the sliding glass will have to be replaced but couldnt do this on his own because the door weighs 300 pounds.so didn't even get to use the outside balcony.i over heard some other ppl talking and they were saying the restrooms had issues also faucets weren't working.would not recommend.tripple a needs to rethink this hotel and their star rating,they gave them 4 stars I give them about a 3 and that's being too nice.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but watch your credit card!”
Reviews.Author: Shelly L
Reviews.Content: My daughter won a 5 night stay at this resort. She does not have a credit card of her own so I went down with her to check in. I gave them my credit card and as I was handing it to them I said "this will only be used for any additional charges she may incur right?" I was told yes. I didnt not realize that he immediately put a hold on my card for $1,100. I used that same card several times over the weekend then my husband went to our local Publix and the card was declined, how embarrassing. I told him that was not possible so I looked up my account on line and found this $1,100 hold. This was on a Sunday so I was told that they couldn't do anything until Monday and they only put a hold on the card not a charge, either way I could not use my money they promised wouldn't be charged. When I asked why this was done they said they didn't know the value of the voucher she had given them, what? The voucher was from them. It took 4 phone calls (my calls weren't being returned) and my daughter going to the front desk before my money was released 30 minutes before the bank closed on Monday. I was aware that my daughter had charged room service so was not surprised by that charge however there was a $50.00 charge for he assumes, but wasn't sure, candy from the Mini Bar in the room but the key for the mini bar was never requested. After a couple more phone calls I decided to just take the loss so I didn't have to deal with this man any more. The hotel is nice but they do as they please with your credit card so watch your accounts very closely!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Don S
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a couple of days. The staff was super helpful and freindly. The food in the dinning room very good. Beach patio is fantastic and fire pits a lot of fun. Driving on the sand was a blast. Definitly looking forward to our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Girls Weekend”
Reviews.Author: nrief
Reviews.Content: Our stay at The Shores was a wonderful one. My only complaint really would be the 2 gentleman checking us in...they were not friendly in the least and really had nothing to say that would make us feel welcomed, so I do have to admit that I was a bit concerned when we first got there. Aside from that, our rooms were clean. It is definitely the staff at the Tiki Bar that made up for our check-in experience. Dominic and Brandy waited on us at the pool all 3 days we were there and were superb!! They really made us feel like they cared and wanted to make our stay as wonderful as possible. The pool was warm and clean. It was so nice being right on the ocean...being able to just go through the gate and down some stairs. I would definitely recommend this hotel to friends and anyone looking for a hotel in Daytona. We will definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful beach views, comfy beds, fun firepits”
Reviews.Author: Marilyn V
Reviews.Content: I love the shores, and have stayed there many times with friends and family. We always love the oceanfront rooms, and relaxing atomosphere. There were a few glitches in my most recent visit. Our luggage was put in the wrong room and it took about 45 minutes for us to finally get it. The pull out bed didn't have any bedding on it, and it took a while for us to get sheets and blankets. We left our sliding glass balcony door open to hear the ocean and feel the breeze, but that led to mosquitos and moths getting into the room. They were very nice and moved us promptly so we wouldn't have to deal with all the bugs. We learned our lesson, and didn't leave the sliding glass door open in the next room. We did however smell strong paint fumes from work they were doing on the building, but everything else was so great, we overlooked it. The restaurant is amazing and making smores at the fire pits is so fun. I especially love the beds and the views...they're breathtaking. Aside from a few snafus in this latest trip, the Shores is a great place for a fun relaxing getaway. Oh, and they're pet friendly, my dogs love the Shores!!

Reviews.Title: “NOT HAPPY”
Reviews.Author: Autumn J
Reviews.Content: I am very disappointed with the stay we had on 4/20/12. The room and hotel itself was nice except for the makeup stained bathrobe that was left in the bathroom right on top. So nasty that I took a picture to show my friends! How housekeeping could have left that for guests is beyond me. But that was not my biggest complaint. Before I booked the room for my boyfriends 35th birthday I was told that the customer service at the resort was out of this world. I was very excited to book a room here and enjoy. But before booking I called the resort to find out exactly the difference between the ocean front and ocean view rooms. Being as this was a special occasion we wanted the nicest view possible! So with excitement I booked the ocean front balcony and expected an unobstructed view of the ocean as described to me by the resort staff. Sadly when we checked into our room on the 2nd floor room 217 on the 20th that is not what we found. When we looked to the left all we could see was palm trees. Looking forward we had to look around the palm trees to see the ocean. To the right we again had palm trees. We had wanted to take lots of pictures to send to our friends but they are all blocked by trees. When I called the front desk, a not so friendly female told me that when booking through Jet setter that we are not guaranteed the room we paid for is what we will get. I find that statement very odd. Why pay more when booking a room anticipating something that is offered when we are really just taking a gamble on a room? When I got back to work and checked today, Jet Setter doesn't have any sort of policy like that. However it does have mention something about a king bed Vs. double bed availability. She also told me that the room we asked for WAS the room we requested, an ocean front balcony room. I will agree that it had a balcony and it was facing the ocean but it did NOT have a unobstructed view of the ocean and that was what I had expected and what I paid for! If that is true when was the management or staff last on the 2nd floor looking outside? That floor should be listed as ocean view NOT ocean front. That's just wrong to push it off on guests as anything other than that when your own staff explains the difference quite clearly! She told me the hotel was overbooked and we could not be moved. I can understand that. She also told me that she would talk to the manager and get back to us to see if there wasn't something else they could do. That never happened. It was like we didn't matter, me calling to complain was bothering her, and the view I paid for shouldn't be an issue. Good thing I am from Florida and this wasn't a once in a life time trip. If I was from Ohio and this was my honeymoon we would be livid. I just hope you don't treat everyone that books through a 3rd party this way. I also don't understand why we still have a $60.00 hold on our credit card. We ordered a $35.00 breakfast on the 21st. and already paid the $17.00 resort fee through Jet Setter. Nothing in the room was used or touched. This whole romantic birthday thing really turned out to not be as happy as we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Needs to work on customer service”
Reviews.Author: nanaof2Deland
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a "Girl's 3 Day Weekend" at the beach. First one of our reservations was lost (then found after the confirmation was produced), next the hotel "misplaced" some of the luggage (took 3 hours to find), then hotel staff "forgot" to replace our towels and even after calling the front desk these were never replaced (wound up using threadbare pool towels), lastly two additional charges were added to our bill (took almost an hour to clear that up upon check out). Through this all the staff said the right thing but was slow to act and really didn't seem to care. To say the least we were a somewhat disappointed in this 4 Star hotel's service, but we managed to have an excellent and relaxing weekend getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and interesting rooms”
Reviews.Author: UKSarahAtlanta
Reviews.Content: I only spent one night here as part of a business group so I didn't get to use the pool or any of the other facilities. There's a few things that a little different from the usual franchised chain: there's no long checkin counter just 2 small stand alone desk. One of the check in staff was very friendly the other was just polite. Gene on the valet parking was great though -telling us all of our parking options (self park across the road and walk back via a bridge/walkway or valet at $10) and generally being very welcoming and helpful. The room wasn't what I was expecting. You use your key to go into your room from the corridor only to find you are actually in a small lobby for your room and the one next door, so you have to then unlock another door to access your room. I did hear my neighbors come into the lobby area once but on the upside I heard no noise from the corridor and I was close to the elevators. Rooms themselves weren't the usual bland hotel style - more like faux French antique meets beach. 2 four poster beds with net hangings. All the usual facilities including a real hairdryer and decent glasses. Bathroom was pretty small but perfectly acceptable and the shampoo and conditioner was probably some of the best I've used in a hotel. Terrace area and pool overlooking the beach were a great place to hang out and the staff were great too.

Reviews.Title: “Only went to the spa”
Reviews.Author: VicTasha
Reviews.Content: For our mini moon my new husband and I drove over an hour to go to the spa for a massage. When I booked it over the phone I asked if the $150 per person rate included gratuity and tax. I was assured 2x that it did. After the massages my husband paid and it wasn't until we were on our way back to our hotel in Lake Mary that I realized they charged him $60 more for gratuity, Its not that hotel wasn't nice. Its not that the massages weren't good. I asked for a FINAL price, bottom line on the phone and expected to walk out spending $305. Instead it was almost $370. I would recommend anyone using this spa service to confirm the price BEFORE you get the massage. I thought we had but I guess I should have asked to see it in writing and not take someones word on the matter,

Reviews.Title: “One of the nicest Hotels For Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: Ariacoltadd
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at a few different hotels in Daytona & this is 1 of nicer ones. The food was very good, the service was lacking but friendly. The $17 resort fee was not explained until we saw it on our bill at the very end. The pool area was under construction w changing out fabric on lounge chairs that u could rent for $70 per day. I seem to feel there could have been a better time to do this? Maybe at the end of the day so people can use it during the day. Our overall stay was very nice.

Reviews.Title: “felt like i was on an island vacation”
Reviews.Author: eileen h
Reviews.Content: fabulous resort!!! clean!,,close to everything!! all the amenties u need to have a nice relaxing time...the staff is very helpful...outsanding breakfast buffet...and great cocktails...great tiki bar! love the whole setup of the hotel...cozy ..classy all in one...nothing bad to say about this place..

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointed”
Reviews.Author: FloridaNative12
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful property on a nice stretch of beach and the hotel is very clean. Unfortunately, that is where the positives ended for my family. We booked three rooms 2 months in advance; I booked directly with the property so I could be sure to get accurate answers and all rooms on the same floor. I called three times to verify everything. Although the staff is very nice, I am convinced they are trained to answer the way the guest wants to hear even when that means lying. We were lied to on multiple occasions. The lies got so out of control; I will give management credit in that they gave us two complimentary massages to attempt to make up for all the disasters. However, the issues continued to multiply through the entire trip. The construction was ridiculous and literally ruined our trip. You could not communicate at the pool due to the noise, the parking walkway was closed (while many guests were given complimentary valet for this inconvenience we were not). Our room was not ready at 4pm check in time, we gave our cell number and they said they'd call when it was ready...never called. At 5pm I inquired and it was ready although 4pm is official check in time. The moths in the rooms were out of control, when we complained the staff told us we were "lucky" some rooms have upwards of 100 and we only had about 10! They messed up our bills multiple times, charging wrong rooms, etc. Even after we got it all straightened out and signed off on final bill; they charged my parents credit card for MY bill. The service was awful :(

Reviews.Title: “Best end of Daytona Beach !”
Reviews.Author: guy15
Reviews.Content: To avoid the tattoed crowd of Daytona Beach you want to stay here. Stayed here many times when it was a Hilton and have continued to stay at the Shores on this end of the Beach. Breakfast and Lunch are great by the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Colefam99
Reviews.Content: My family had a wonderful time at this resort. Can't wait to go back next year:)

Reviews.Title: “Awesome surprise!”
Reviews.Author: ayovanovich
Reviews.Content: Leaving home for spring break with absolutely no plans- we drove south. We knew we wanted beach, sun and comfortable. MAN - did we luck into it! Beautiful resort, awsome heated -to --perfection pool, fire pits, wifi, tiki bar, beautiful rooms and awesome beach. Yes, they're doing maintenance right now, yes it's loud and annoying. I got over it and went to the beach. The annoyance was worth the beauty and comfort the rest of the time. I'm looking forward to visiting again!

Reviews.Title: “Quite restful hotel”
Reviews.Author: drsknight86
Reviews.Content: I find this hotel to be more like a true 4 star hotel than others in its class. Much better service than most Marriotts. The restaurant in the lobby is fantastic and I love the fire pits outside to sit around at night and listen to the Ocean or strike up conversations with other guest. I go once a year just to rest, read books and suntan.

Reviews.Title: “Charming resort on the beach”
Reviews.Author: BertDC
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at the Shores Resort. The room and bed were very comfortable, and I liked the decor. I had a great view down the coast, toward the ocean. I was visiting with family, and we would gather outdoors around the fire in the evening (and for fans of s'mores, you could roast them on the fire). My family members all spoke highly of the hotel and their experience there. My only complaint would be that check-in is a bit late (4 p.m.). I'd stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: canuck642011
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three days right after bike week and it was pretty quiet. Daytona Beach Shores is a much quieter spot than Daytona Beach. The hotel is right on the beach and the patio/pool area is a great place to enjoy the sun. The pool and hot tub are large and clean. The restaurant while a bit on the expensive side ( not too bad) was excellent. The staff is very friendly and helpful. Rooms were large and clean we had an oceanview with a large balcony which really was a big plus. The hotel is a bit older but really well maintained and I liked the added character. Why stay on the beach but not be sure if you were at any downtown town hotel? easy drive to any spot in daytona. We ate at the charlie horse which was good. This is a great value in a great location. Can't imagine you could be disappointed here. Very nice and very quiet.

Reviews.Title: “great view”
Reviews.Author: adam p
Reviews.Content: only stayed a night ,as travelling around florida.Wish I had stayed more had a room overlooking the sea with balcony, hearing the sea all night and watching the sunrise from the balcony I will never forget.

Reviews.Title: “Not what you expect from a 4 Diamond Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kax44
Reviews.Content: We booked into this hotel for a 7 night stay along with other family members for a wedding, We didn't want to pay for the Valet Parking so we were directed across the road to park, the connecting bridge was shut off we had to cross 4 lanes to get to the hotel every time we went out in the car!! We requested the turn down service on the 1st night as our son was sharing our room, a large bed plus sofa, when we returned the sofa had not been turned down, as it was late we done it ourselves!! with only 1 pillow in a bag with a broken zip we couldn't open!! We sat round the firepit in the evening to be told if we required drinks from the bar there would be no waiter/waitress service as all the staff were busy serving at a function upstairs!!! Not the type of service I have experienced at any rating of hotel !!! They never informed us of the renovation work being done on the ocean front balconies, this started at 8:00am, scaffolding, drilling, balcony railings removed, workmen on the balconies, scraping off old paint, respraying the balconies, I understand maintenance work has to be done, our reservation was made last July, no one informed us not even at check in!! We never sat at the pool as they were replacing tiles around the pool. The newlyweds never received a Best Wishes card, bottle of champagne or even breakfast to their room the morning after the wedding - come on that is the least you could have done, its the special touches you remember and would make you recommend to friends and family, I'm sorry there will be no recommendation from us.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome - AGAIN!”
Reviews.Author: PBLorraine
Reviews.Content: Second time staying at this hotel and it was actually BETTER then the first time! That alone is pretty amazing, I am rarely impressed twice but the Shores is really, THAT good. We had booked an 'ocean view' room last weekend for the first weekend of Bike Week, March 9 & 10. After riding through a torrential downpour for the last five miles, on a motorcycle, we arrived wet and miserable at the Shores. The valets were super nice, helping us find a covered spot to park in front of the hotel. The front desk was equally friendly and nice (Jeremy could lighten up a bit though. Bikers aren't really bad people....) and we were upgraded to an ocean front room for the price we were quoted online! I don't know if it was because we were wet or maybe because we'd been there before or someone was just feeling really generous but it was fabulous! Dinner at Azure and the breakfast buffet were great (altho the hostesses seating process needed some work), the wait staff was very good as was the food. Each time we arrived at the hotel we were greeted warmly by the valet and front desk. The staff at The Shores and the whole atmosphere truly helped to make an ugly rainy weekend into a pleasant experience and a great stay. Can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “A BIG LET DOWN”
Reviews.Author: Margaret R
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a family wedding and were shocked to find out that there were renovations going on especially as one of the rooms booked was the honeymoon suite and the newlyweds were wakened at 8 15am with the noise. The balcony of the suite was a disgrace lots of plaster missing and the outdoor furniture was dirty, no covers for the pillows on the double sunlounger. You couldnt use the pool deck because of the noise and ended up having to pay for loungers and an umbrella on the beach. Not what you would expect from a 4 diamond resort. Would not recommend this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay despite the mediocre staff”
Reviews.Author: Amanda0721
Reviews.Content: Recently stayed at The Shores with family and friends for our wedding in July at nearby Ponce Inlet. Overall, fantastic experience but be prepared for the staff....they seem to have forgotten the meaning of customer service. I had prepared welcome bags for my guests for their arrival and specifically provided the check-in staff with the names of who the bags should go to. Not one guest was given a bag and in addition to this, my sister and brother-in-law were given a room that had an uncleaned shower...they had to ask twice to get it cleaned properly. Worst of all, the restaurant staff at Azure broke our wedding cake topper and didn't even offer to compensate us! Aside from the staff, we ended up having a wonderful time at the hotel. The ocean view from our room was breathtaking, especially at sunrise and sunset...gorgeous!! The balconey was a little worn and could use some TLC but I really enjoyed the luxurious king bed, it was so comfortable and the bathroom was nice and had a modern feel. We really loved the pool area overlooking the beach. We spent a lot of time there soaking up the beautiful Florida sun enjoying drinks from the tiki bar! The staff outside proved much better than inside thankfully. Evenings were fun with the fire pits...one night we used the s'mores kits, they're expensive but delicious! One thing about The Shores that sets them apart is their restaurant, Azure. They're food is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G! Special thanks to Erin O'Brien for coordinating such a delicious meal for our guests on our wedding day....we still talk about how great it was! I truly believe you cannot have a bad meal there. Overall, The Shores is a great hotel. Not perfect but far from just average. We are coming back to Florida for our friends wedding in October and will probably stay a few nights again. We love Daytona Beach!!

Reviews.Title: “a very pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: Templetons911
Reviews.Content: Recent negative reviews a bit puzzling...we are discriminating travelers used to staying in fine hotels, & we found The Shores very comfortable. No, it's not The Ritz, but I would venture to say it's the best hotel in Daytona. We were visiting strictly for a day @ the Speedway; truthfully, I probably wouldn't pick Daytona otherwise. But the hotel room was clean, spacious, very quiet, food above average (both for lunch & dinner) & the staff friendly & helpful. There were not many cars on the beach, thankfully, as I don't understand the appeal of this practice anyway, & worried that the beach view would resemble a parking lot. The room rates were reasonable. Overall, we thought the experience was just fine.

Reviews.Title: “Check before you go”
Reviews.Author: shweeet
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel directly with hotel reservations. Due to the fact they did not inform me of ongoing renovations our stay at this hotel was less then memorable. Upon arrival we experienced a very strong smell related to the work that was going on at the hotel. We could not smell it in our room,however, we could not leave our balconey door open,or sit there for any length of time.Just when you think it can't get any worse,the second day came with a very offensive sewer odour in the hallway and pool area. My wife suffers from migraines, any strong odours will quickly bring them on. Hence,she experienced them during our stay.I selected this hotel because it appeared to be a perfect retreat to celebrate Valentines day which just happens to be our anniversary also. Had the reservations staff informed me of the construction,I wuold have booked another time.Overall the hotel presents itself very well, it's a good location and has potential.In order to compete in this market there are areas that need improvement. You can't expect to charge top dollar and offer less than you advertise.When I checked out I informed the front desk staff,again, of my concerns. They were totally indifferent.
