This was to be a relaxing getaway at what appeared to be the ideal location,how disappointing. It's the attention that is paid to the "little things" that keep customers coming back. Some people just don't get it!

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: Jenn1115
Reviews.Content: The room was worn - the balcony chairs had not been cleaned or wiped in ages; the railing was chipped; the room initially had a smoking smell to it. We had heard great things, and our expectations just were not met. The front desk staff was very helpful; however, the restaurant hostesses left much to be desired. We waited in front of two hostesses - the only two people in line - before they acknowledged we were there. And they both saw us long before that. The only seat for two available was a table right in front of a door to the patio - and we did not want that since we had sat there at breakfast and watched half the world walk in and walk out. The hostesses were not helpful, and we were not pleased at standing there for several minutes before they noticed us, so we went to the Hilton's restaurant (which is also where we would be staying next time). Our room was handicapped accessible, which fortunately we did not need. Something else - the closet was in the bathroom - makes getting ready a challenge. The fire pits were beautiful - but all the same, we'll pass on this one in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Nice resort, but rooms are a bit worn”
Reviews.Author: bk_t1
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a conference. No doubts that this is a nice resort. The views are nice and it's right off the beach, nice pool area and fire pits at night. Check-in was a bit slow and it took several minutes to "find" my reservation. After that, the front desk agents were pretty good. The rooms were a bit worn. The bed is nice, flat screen tv, smallish bathroom, separate mirror/makeup table. Overall, it seems like the rooms could use some updating. Housekeeping was mediocre. One day I got a paper, one day I didn't - toiletries not replaced either. I had drinks at the bar, and the service was mostly good there, too. The food for the conference was good. Overall rating: This place has a lot of potential, but just seems a bit outdated.

Reviews.Title: “Not a 4 diamond resort”
Reviews.Author: John s
Reviews.Content: Very unhappy with the hotel, this is not a 4 diamond luxury hotel. I have been at better Days Inn. The hotel is dark, old looking, needs a good cleaning and has a funny smell to it. The cost of a room and resort fee are way to high for a maybe 1 diamond hotel. They was sand blashing the balaconys while I was trying to rest at the pool, had to move couple time and the management is no help! I found the cheaper resort down the street for my next trip. John

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Daytona area”
Reviews.Author: SKBubba
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a couple of nights on our way home from a trip to South Florida. Have stayed here before and they continue to impress. This time, there was a mix-up about our room, and they made it right in a huge way. Won't go into details so as not to set expectations too high, but suffice it to say they went above and beyond.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointing”
Reviews.Author: KJK1971
Reviews.Content: I picked this resort to spoil my fiance as a 50th birthday getaway weekend. Their advertised pictures are gorgeous. The only accuracy is the outside pool/deck area, bar and restaurant! Upon our arrival we were checked into a dirty hotel room then taken to another 2 rooms that were not ready or under construction. Overall the staff was friendly short of Mr. Simone who was rude-this is their operations manager! Wow! Needless to say I was very dissappointed to spend $300.00 for a 2 night stay in the off season for a dirty room and $17.00 pots of coffee b/c I was scared of getting sick from their dirty cups in the room and the dirty coffee pot. The walkway to the parking area and steps not clean, elevator not working. I am posting some pictures so you can determine on your own.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!”
Reviews.Author: deerjeff
Reviews.Content: Picked this one based on reviews and used points to book it, use to be the Hilton in Daytona. Very nice hotel overall many little extras to make your stay pleasant, from the restaurant to the pool to the beach, nicely done. The room was clean and spacious and parking is easy and free. Paola and Miranda were great to deal with at the front desk. Had to stay an extra night and they only charged me $99 (it was off season).Be aware you are charged $18.11 per day for a “resort fee” above the room fees and taxes. Two down sides for me was one of the front desk managers, (missed “his” name) was very patronizing when I asked a question regarding the billing, and the internet connection (although free) was VERY slow. Overall I would do it again with no apprehension.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing stay at Shores Resort and Spa!”
Reviews.Author: MichaelSterns
Reviews.Content: From the amazing property, to the incredibly accomodating staff, super fair room rates, incredible pool & bonfire area oceanside, to the delicious and fast room service, my stay at the Shores Resort & Spa could only be described as FANTASTIC! We WILL be returning to stay there as soon as possible! Michael Sterns www.grasshoppperdreams.com

Reviews.Title: “Another great stay here”
Reviews.Author: ann d
Reviews.Content: Had family in for Holidays and what to get someone who has everything??? My husband and I have stayed here numerous times and have always been treated very well. Booked a balcony terrace room, oceanfront balcony, and oceanview room. Front desk person, Neil, was so extremely accomodating and pleasant and Donna, who does double duty of waitstaff and bar tending was so pleasant and friendly. The rooms were all extremely clean and comfortable. The fire pit area is a great gathering spot and relaxing area to unwind. We live in the area, so are familar with amenities and can choose any hotel, especially for last minute get aways and this is the place to go.

Reviews.Title: “Another great vacation at the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: gc-sidelines
Reviews.Content: This was our third trip to the Shores. We are business owners who close our business after Christmas and head to the Shores for the ultimate in relaxation. From the moment I got out of my vehicle and the valet said "Welcome Mrs Roberts" to the end when the bell man helped us with our luggage and said" Safe travels until you come back".... we love this place!

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: dantin06
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best hotels that Daytona Beach has to offer. This resort boasts affordable and updated ocean front rooms. These rooms are nicely decorated and the beds are soft and comfortable. The resturaunt in the hotel, while it has changed names a few times is upscale dining and a good choice, for breakfast, lunch, or dinner. The bar area is nice for a drink or coffee. The pool and baby splash area is salt water and very clean. The pool side cabanas are a great way to shield babies, and tired out young children from too much sun. Also patrons are able to access the beach by walking out the pool deck entrance. I especially love the fire pit surrounded by seating for an evening of sharing smores. We love to stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Best Experience for Couples”
Reviews.Author: Jake B
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel. Rooms are nice and clean. Staff very helpful and accomodating. Balcony with ocean view a must. Close to Daytona Speedway. For a relaxing get-a-way for couples, this hotel is for you. Enjoy the vacation you deserve and feel it with their first class service. Check out the fire pits for a romantic evening.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: peter h
Reviews.Content: Our family of 4 arrived December 26 2011 for a 1 week vacation. We checked in and decided we would upgrade to the suite. The lobby is beautiful and very elegant but warm and inviting. The suite was breathtaking! Beautiful king size canopy bed, marble floors throughout, jacuzi, rainfall shower heads in bathroom. A very spacious area with a sofa bed chairs and a dining area. A kitchen equipped with a fridge, microwave and keurig coffee maker. The view from the balcony was spectacular! View of the pool and the ocean from every window in the suite. We had dinner at the hotels restaurant and the food was delicious! In the evening the pool area has 2 large gas fire pits with Muskoka chairs around where you could sit around and roast marshmellows or make smores which the hotel provides. Felt so cozy like a beach bonfire. The staff were truly amazing everyone made you feel welcome a special mention to Curtis for all his help with questions we had before arriving and for making our family vacation one we will never forget. Really you will not regret staying at this hotel, we recommend it to our friends and family and will definitely come back!

Reviews.Title: “passhotel”
Reviews.Author: adilms
Reviews.Content: The hotel is trying to pass a CAMRY as LEXUS. The hotel is OK but, it tries to project itseft as a very elite hotel that it is not. The Bridge to get to hotel has a malfunctioning elevator. The reservation doesnt send the confirmation email that it promises it will. The rooms are old and smell old. The beds make squeking sound and bathroom shower doesnt have proper door to contain the water. The water spills all over the place. The room prices are very high for this quality hotel and on top of that one has to pay $50 resort fees. They have attendents who are friendly but, it all comes with cost not as a service. It is better to look for name brand hotels for the same price than go to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place But Don't Go there!!!”
Reviews.Author: VAJill
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed for four nights at the Shores Resort & Spa in Daytona Beach, Florida. The hotel boasts a AAA Four Diamond rating and is a very nice place with a great staff and comfortable acommodations. The rooms are large and many have great views of the beach or river. The staff is friendly and the bar and Azure Restaurant at the hotel serve great drinks and food in a lovely setting. It is a charming and relaxing environment and it is quite affordable. The reason I am not recommending this hotel is that on the last night we were there five bus loads of teenagers and their chaperones arrived at the hotel. The whole experience changed. Anyone thinking they were going to have a relaxing stay could forget it. The hotel became a crowded, noisy scene and it seemed that every hallway, the pool , restaurant, and beach had lots of noisy teenagers running around. it was like being at a college beach week. Needless to say, this was not the experience we had expected from this hotel. I realize that hotels need to fill their rooms, but this was not a good idea. We were thankful we were leaving and because of this experience, I would not recommend this hotel. It's unfortunate, but something tells me that the Four Diamond statis won't be with ths hotel for long.

Reviews.Title: “A very nice stay in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: drfunches
Reviews.Content: Just left a 2 day stay at the Shores. I purchased our room from Priceline and got a pretty good deal. We stayed in an oceanfront room with a fantastic view. The staff was very nice. The restaurant in the hotel was pretty good too. I wasn't too much thrilled with the $17 a day resort fee. It included internet access but it worked intermittently at best. Yet, I think I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Last minute Staycation: to die for!”
Reviews.Author: CarpeDiem1987
Reviews.Content: Love love love it here. Beautiful location, beautiful hotel, wonderful service. We brought our five month old son here..drank wine by the fire pits and ordered amazing room service. Also very impressed with the rates :) Had an awkward incident with the maintenance man, but otherwise no complaints!!

Reviews.Title: “Well worth the visit”
Reviews.Author: philf2
Reviews.Content: We were at the Shores four years ago and liked it enough to return. The hotel has improved since then with internet in the rooms. Everything there is worthy of its four star rating. It is right on the beach with a large pool and patio area where you can socalize or be on your own - whichever you wish. The hotel charges a resonable resort fee which includes internet and parking. When you arrive, if they give you room 325, ask for another one. It seems to be the only room with a lousy view.

Reviews.Title: “I would live here if I could!”
Reviews.Author: rexadog
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful place! I had the pleasure of staying here in Dec 2010 (sorry for taking so long to write this). Pulling up to the hotel I could tell I was in for a treat. Check in went smoothly. When I made my registration online I asked for a quiet room so I was a little concerned when I got off the elevator and found my room right across from it. As soon as I opened the door though I realized I had nothing to worry about as there was a small hallway between the first and second entrance to the room. What a wonderful idea! I couldn't believe how large the room was. Everything was amazing! The staff was very friendly and helpful. One thing that has stuck with me is that upon retrieving my car from the valet, the valet asked where I was headed. When I said Jacksonville he said "oh that's a long drive, take a cold water with you". To me that goes the extra mile and say a lot about the staff of the hotel. A couple of minor complaints. I was surprised they charged for wireless as part of a "resort fee", but seeing my employer was paying for it I didn't complain. In this day and age though I think charging for internet is uncalled for. Also, they were working on the roof at the time and this was a little noisy in the morning, but management made me aware of this at check in and offered a free cocktail hour for all guests to make up for the inconvenience. All in all I was very happy with my stay and should I ever find myself back in the area I will gladly stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Charming Beachfront Hotel”
Reviews.Author: EmilyandSam
Reviews.Content: I liked The Shores! We got a great deal from Vacationist ($80/night) and decided to go explore Daytona Beach a little bit. The weather was wild and there was a wind and storm advisory warning, so the beach was empty, and unfortunately the pool and hot tub were closed. We had a "partial ocean view" room and it was truly just a peek of the ocean. The rooms were nice and the bed was super comfortable. The ambience of the hotel is great and we loved the lobby as well. The tiki bar outside was fun, as was the lobby bar. Daytona Beach really left a lot to be desired. There is not much to do around the hotel itself, but it's a great place if you want to spend the day on the beach or in the pool. We enjoyed happy hour next door at the Top of Daytona which is on the 29th floor and has sweeping views - don't miss it! Dinner at Azure, the Shores restaurant, was DELICIOUS and we loved the ambience - excellent service as well. They weren't lighting the fire pits because of the weather which was a bummer, because it looked like fun. The hotel will provide you with Smores Kits which are adorable but for $10 a pop, I'd recommend picking up a few Smores supplies at the store before you get there. They do charge a $17 resort fee, which includes Wi-Fi and self-parking. I dislike it when hotels charge this - I'd really rather have this built in with the nightly cost of the room. As we booked through Vacationist we didn't have to pay this fee, but were charged anyway. When I called the hotel after the fact, the service was excellent and they refunded the charge immediately. Overall, we really liked this hotel and would definitely stay there again if ever in Daytona Beach again.

Reviews.Title: “Best Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rickandme
Reviews.Content: This was our second stay here as we loved so much our first stay. The hotel is clean, the rooms very comfortable, the staff (except the tiki bartender) warm, friendly and very helpful. We chose this location for our 31st anniversary and it didn't disappoint us. The food in the restaurant is 5-star and fairly priced. The first night we ordered in and the meal was delicious and arrived hot and in a timely manner. There isn't very much to do in the area so a great hotel is key to enjoying your time here. We loved the heated pool, jacuzzi, fire pit and ocean view. If you're having a special occasion I highly recommend the oceanfront room with a wrap around balcony as this gives you a huge, private outdoor space to sip champagne, enjoy the stars and each other. If you're going with children a first floor oceanfront would be advisable as you have direct access to the pool and beach sans elevator. The hotel exterior is being refurbished and there is minimal construction noise during the day. This did not interfere with our fabulous stay. My point being if you are extremely finicky I'd check out when they will complete the update.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: FloridaGoingPlaces
Reviews.Content: We visited this hotel only for a one day last minute trip to the beach the weekend before thanksgiving. It is a Diamond of a find in Daytona. The interior is so warm and welcoming. The room and view gorgeous. The pool area with the fire pits, tiki bar, and jacuzzi made us truly feel like we had a mini resort getaway. The staff was extra friendly except for one mixup in our charges the next morning, which they cleared up for us. The manager Curtis goes the extra mile. The Restaurant staff was welcoming and we enjoyed a very reasonably priced breakfast on the pool deck overlooking the ocean in the morning. We went south to Ponce Inlet to enjoy the beauty of the area, climbed the lighthouse, took in the marine life museum, and enjoyed dining also at Inlet Harbor marina for a sunset dinner. We will be back.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: LynneHP
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed here at the start and end of our holiday - and it was great. The location is perfect for getting out and about - and the pool and the beach are brilliant. We had a room that opened onto the pool which was great as the children could go in and out of the room easily. Probably one of the most comfortable beds that I have ever slept in and the walk in wardrobe was great for hiding all our luggage! The food that we had at the hotel was good - especially the breakfast buffet. Would really recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Exotic Princess”
Reviews.Author: ExoticPrincess
Reviews.Content: This hotel is very nice. It has genuine ambiance. It has a good location on the beach, a nice pool and hot tub with comfortable outdoor covered seating, as well as, fireplace pits to sit at and enjoy the ocean breezes in the moonlight, which we did. The room was a decent size. The king size bed was very comfortable and the sleeper sofa was better than most. We all felt that the countertops in the bathroom were too low, making it awkward to wash up easily (I'm 5'6", which isn't tall). There was a nice vanity to sit at outside the bathroom so more than one female could get ready at the same time. We got a great deal at Vacationist.com. Besides the low height of the countertops in the bathroom, the only complaint that I had was that a section of the carpet in the room was very wet when we checked in late one night. We asked to be moved, but they were full for the night. They offered to move us the next night, but we didn't want to bother repacking and moving. So, we stayed. The spot dried up in a day or two but no one could explain why it was wet. Which was weird. But, overall I liked the hotel and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “fancy hotel, nice amenities”
Reviews.Author: Leesa W
Reviews.Content: hotel was very nice, lobby, beach front, rooms. However the boiler noise producing a high pitched ringing into our room did not allow us to sleep much. We had room 209 & 210. Could have been a beautiful view outside but for some reason that was the place chosen to store several ladders, maintenance equipment and an older table and chairs. valets were very nice and worked very hard.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service, doesn't live up to potential”
Reviews.Author: BarbRoses
Reviews.Content: When I arrived, the lobby was attractive and I had high hopes for a great 2 day stay. It started going downhill when I entered the room to find men on scaffolds outside on the balcony. When I looked out I could see that most of the hotel did not have scaffolds, just my area. Why didn't they pick another room? The air conditioner did not work in my room. The showers are nice but odd in that the design allows for water to leak on the floor. I went to the bar after a morning workout (nice fitness room) to purchase a cup of coffee because nothing is complimentary here. Noone was staffing the bar (set up for breakfast service), the girl who was summoned when I had to go to the front desk to inquire acted like she was doing me a favor and gave me cold coffee. I felt like some of the staff didn't care, and even though it is a pretty spot, it is not worth the price. Extra fees for everything....Won't return....

Reviews.Title: “New dog fee!”
Reviews.Author: bossafin
Reviews.Content: First off, I LOVE this hotel, but sadly I will not be staying there anymore. I always looked forward to stopping here for a night of luxury and comfort on my drive south with my dogs. The last time I stayed, I was charged $25 for both dogs--a very reasonable fee. This time, however, the fee has gone up to $50 per dog, plus a $250 refundable deposit. I understand that someone must have had some very BAD dogs to cause them to raise the fees so much, but it virtually almost doubles the cost of the room for me and my very well-behaved pets. I love the friendly staff, and the delicious food in the restaurant, but everything has its worth, and for an overnight stop, the pet fees, combined with the "resort fee" and taxes makes it no longer worth the detour for me. Au revoir, Shores!

Reviews.Title: “Mixed reviews!”
Reviews.Author: Annie M
Reviews.Content: The Shores Resort & Spa in Daytona Beach, Florida is an absolutely beautiful hotel! The stay was for my daughter's wedding and family came from all over the U.S. to share the day! The servers, bells, bartenders and general associates were extremely friendly and gracious! However...my whole party was generally over charged and had to produce e-mail and reservation #s to get the price we were quoted. My niece who was our liasion had to talk to the manager about the over charge on the honeymoon suite. He was rude and did not care. We had to produce the e-mail to prove what was quoted. My daughter was confronted on her wedding night by another bride about her room (not the hotels fault unless of course they gave the bridezilla's room away!) After checked out, my daughter recieved a voice message on her cell saying an I-pad was missing from her room and she would be charged. When I called about it, I was told it had been found but no message was sent to my daughter to inform her and an apology was never given. They accused my daughter of stealing with no apologies! The management team at this resort leaves a lot to be desired. They are uncaring and are extremely below the hospitality standards they should be. If they would replace the management team I would highly recommend this beautiful resort and spa!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic luxury/value”
Reviews.Author: northeaster22
Reviews.Content: Paid same price as bad hotel up the street. Luxury and value. And very kid friendly. Spa, etc.

Reviews.Title: “Still enjoying the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: Bob M
Reviews.Content: The Shores is a fine beachfront property. Hotel staff are quick to assist and offer assistance. Spa treatment was fantastic with exceptional staff! Azure restaurant provided fine seafood with good service! Request ocean front room not ocean view if you want to be on the ocean. Morning buffet was very enjoyable!

Reviews.Title: “Quite a nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: JJYTraveller
Reviews.Content: This is quite a nice hotel. We booked on hotwire.com and found the best price here. When we booked in, a double room was not ready in the category we apparently paid for, but we were upgraded to a nice room that had a four-poster bed and a side view of the beach. Be warned that there are resort fees that are added on top of the price you pay on the website though. This covers your parking, taxes and wifi. The price was quite good, although the bar was a little expensive. The included continental breakfast is very ordinary. Not to my taste at all - but that happened a lot to us in the USA - sugar, fat and artificial flavours dominated. We checked out and went to Miami for a couple of days (we couldn't go to NY due to Hurricane Irene) and then we checked back in again. We were given another room that had a view of a roof and parking lot, which wasn't the best, but also gave us a wonderful view of the sunset. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Warning: Resort tries to add charges to your bill days after checking out.”
Reviews.Author: Erron A
Reviews.Content: Make sure you keep your receipts. The Shores is trying to charge for rooms on the 9/14/2011, when we left on 9/06/2011. Also, the room advertised are not the ones that are really available, so be prepared to try another hotel. Television was like from 1980.

Reviews.Title: “Not value for money”
Reviews.Author: loseapoint
Reviews.Content: I guess that the Shores has traded on its reputation for years but, as evidenced by its slide down the TripAdvisor ratings, I fear its going downhill. The public area when entering is nice, dark wood but it was sort of spoilt by the front door being badly in need of revarnishing. Check in was smooth and the room above average size and reasonably decorated. we payed for an oceanfront room so expected great things. Unfortunately, it didn't deliver.There were, for example, only two coffee sachets in the room between two of us - a little penny pinching surely? The plug sockets in the bathroom failed to work, leaving my wife to dry her hair in the bedroom - incidentally, there were very few plug sockets in the room, again - leaving us slightly disappointed. We ate dinner in the Azure restaurant and the food was very good. It was perhaps a tad overpriced but the wine and spirits outrageously so! The food was just about value for money but we weren't sure everything else was. If you got a good deal on price to stay here, you might view things differently but we felt, overall, we would probably have felt better elsewhere. The final indignity is the Resort Fee which many other reviewers have qustioned. It seem that there is so little provided for it, that it is effectively a management levy and should be added to the room charge if management is not to be continuously brought to task over it. How you can charge a valet parking fee on top of a $17/day Resort Fee, I'm not sure. All-in-all, I don't think that the Shores is anywhere near as good as it thinks it is and, unless it wants to see its TripAdvisor rating continue to fall, the management needs a long hard look at what its offering. Would I go again? I'm afraid not!

Reviews.Title: “Great Get-away!”
Reviews.Author: DJ44446
Reviews.Content: Very nicely appointed room with an excellent view of the ocean and the city. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great beach front resort”
Reviews.Author: jamiemichano
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice resort that is right on Daytona Beach. Check in was very quick and the rooms were clean and well appointed. Views from the room we had were not that great and when we requested an upgrade, we were told that it was not possible. If you are going to stay here and expect a view, I recommend booking your room accordingly. Patio area is nice and large enough to accommodate everyone comfortably. Pool bar was surprisingly inexpensive. They have cool fire pits which are lit at night and there are Smore kits available in your room(which we didn't use them, but it's a great idea). The location is a little out of the way(South). If you are in Daytona to relax, this is great, but if you are looking for a nice restaurant expect to drive to find something.

Reviews.Title: “service certainly is not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: johannes051
Reviews.Content: Facilities are nice, but personnel is not up to standard. Glass ware in room was not clean; bathroom not cleaned. On Saturday afternoon bar tender was out of certain ingredients to make cocktails. After all this, we decided to go elsewhere for dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel with a boutique feel”
Reviews.Author: Bikerian60
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for three nights in Biketoberfest nice atmosphere with good finish internally . Outside is still a bit tired but not so it matters - staff friendly ad food drink and service very good. Location wise it's about 4 miles from Main Street so you need taxi's.

Reviews.Title: “A great hotel”
Reviews.Author: SophiaMaria1977
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have staid at the Shores Resort and Spa. The rooms are very comfortable and clean. The beds are great. They have wonderful mattresses and pillows! The bathroom was spacious. We had plenty of towels and they also provided bath robes. There is a small refrigerator in the room which is stocked with drinks - personally I put my own drinks in there. We got a room overlooking the pool and beach with a balcony. The view was great. Honestly I liked everything about our stay. The pool is big and well maintained. The pool area is beautiful. There is a pool bar and another bar inside the hotel. There are fire pits in the pool area that are lit up at night time and chairs around them, for people to sit and enjoy the fire and a little socializing. There are lots of couches outside and inside the lobby, lots of places to sit, have a drink, socialize with friends. It would be a great place to go with another couple or two. Also great for kids with the big pool and the ocean being steps away. The hotel restaurant has great food. We ate dinner there one night and I am sorry we didn't eat there the previous night too. The tuna was great as well as the rib eye steak! All the dishes I saw looked really good and big! They also serve a nice breakfast. We had the breakfast bar. It was good. You really don't need to go anywhere else. I would have been perfectly happy not leaving the hotel at all. Which I think on my next visit I will do. For those looking for a place to have a wedding, there is wedding accommodations there. There were 3 weddings going on the weekend we were there. It looked like a great place to have a wedding.

Reviews.Title: “Honeymoon Extravaganza!”
Reviews.Author: red1407
Reviews.Content: My husband and I got married July 2010. I know this review is a little late but i have nothing but good things to say about this resort. We came here on our honeymoon. The room was awesome! I mean, of course i woudl have loved a hot tub, but it was spacious and clean and the bed was like a soft cloud! :) it was so great! It was a little pricey, but it was well worth the money! the fire pits were great and my husband would get up early and go save us a seat under the umbrella. It would be great for a resort like this to start serving breakfast. We will definitely recommend this place to anyone going on a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary at Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: winelady07
Reviews.Content: The Shores resort "Romance" package is the best to celebrate an anniversary! Their attention to detail from the champagne and chocolate in the beautiful room to the smores by the moonlight over the fire by the pool and the delicious dinner and dessert! Quick getaway if you live in Florida or a stones throw from Orlando airport. Everyone who works there is so kind too! Can't wait to go back again for a "wine" dinner.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay”
Reviews.Author: Kat S
Reviews.Content: A last-minute decision to spend the extra bucks for luxury really paid off! My husband and I were looking to do something special for our 5th yr. anniversary. His idea was to be frugal and exciting. Mine was to do something romantic. Without letting him know, I booked the room while hoping he'd never know how much we paid for the 2day vacation. Upon arriving, the hotel didn't look grand and glorious but the first service we received was valet parking. Kinda nice. We go to register and found that customer service was a priority! Every question was answered thoroughly with a genuine smile. We received complimentary drinks, asked for chocolate covered strawberries to be sent to the room and headed up to our room after being offered to take our luggage for us. Our check-in was late at night-around 9ish.. but anything we needed was still open and waiting on us to partake. Our room seemed basic...king bed, walk in shower and balcony. What was exceptional was when we realized we had a huge wrap around porch with ample sitting for star gazing. Our first night, we experienced the wonderful fire pits! The pool is salt-water and there is a hot tub.. which wasn't mentioned online I don't think. :) That made me verrry happy. Once we retired to our room, we found chocolate covered strawberries surrounded by a huge pile of berries awaiting us. We indulged for a minute before trying room service out. He ordered shrimp and I ordered a chicken club. GET THE CHICKEN CLUB!!!!! I hate chicken.. but my mouth is watering just thinking about that stupid sandwich! Which leads me to say this: the dining experience there cannot be matched unless you go to an exquisite restaurant. The next day we had a hiccup..no need to dwell because it was solved happily, readily and beyond my expectations! As I've mentioned, customer service is definitely a priority at this resort!! After the hiccup was resolved, we went on to enjoy the summer sun in the salt-water pool, had a nice shower and went to our couple’s message. The girls did a superb job rubbing our cares away and nearly put the hubby to sleep. They too were very professional, yet caring. The hubby couldn't wait for dinner.. as mentioned before, the dining is excellent. Hats off to the chef! We found the menu a bit limited, yet still savory. I wasn't feeling well and couldn't find anything to suit my sick fancy. When I asked the waiter to see if the chef would mind surprising me with something light, the waiter was more than happy to ask and the chef (although I never saw him) seemed delighted to take my tastes to heart. He prepared for me a divine salad that again included chicken... and I LOVED it!! I would be aims to say that the hubby enjoyed his meal as well. It was a seafood bit with a ton of rice. Perhaps my special request overshadowed his dish... woops. Our last day there (and our actual anniversary date) would have been uneventful had it not been for the wonderful customer service. We received a late check out, so we eased into the day with a couple naps (again, the sniffles had me tired and not feeling well). By mid afternoon we found ourselves lounging in a cabana with a soft warm breeze, quiet music and the sounds of the ocean taking us off to one more nap. It was pure bliss! Suffice it to say, our stay was beyond our expectations. So very relaxing!! The next time I decide to take a nice vacation I will think twice about where to stay. I could have pieced out the entire vacation but not having to worry about food, car, etc. definitely made this trip so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: Ted H
Reviews.Content: Stayed here back in April and loved every second there. The rooms are beautiful and the staff is very accomodating.

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend”
Reviews.Author: Sydney1133
Reviews.Content: We decided to do a weekend getaway and were so happy with our choice of Shores Resort and Spa. I only wish we could have stayed longer. It was very relaxing. The atmosphere around the pool, the sports bar, sitting areas (inside and outside), fire pits overlooking the beach, and the tiki bar were all great. Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Retreat!!”
Reviews.Author: TAPhillips
Reviews.Content: I selected The Shores as the host hotel for my class reunion. The staff was exceptional and Denise was wonderful and easy to work with. We had three main events there, The Meet & Greet, 5K fun run/walk, and our formal evening gala. For the Meet & Greet, we booked the Imperial Suite which was FANTASTIC. The main area consisted of a dining table and seating area which was spacious enought to accomodate our classmates. I stayed in the Suite throughout the reunion and the bedroom accomodations were great and the bed was ultra comfortable. The amenities were beyond satisfaction -- we enjoyed the fire pit late into the morning and the beach access for our morning 5K run was convenient. The banquet room was beautiful and the support staff was always avialable and there to assist. I enjoyed the accomodation so -- I am going back in 2 weeks for some R&R.

Reviews.Title: “The Shores Resort & Spa (Daytona Beach Shores, FL) ROCKS!!!”
Reviews.Author: Kimballsfiesta
Reviews.Content: If you want a gorgeous view, great food, wonderful staff, & full moon (extra special), you should have been @ The Shores in Daytona Beach this past week for SGMP's 2011 SREC! You couldn't have ordered better weather (hint of Fall in the air). From the time I arrived (& Jason helped with the luggage, car, etc.) it was smooth sailing. Great GREEN hotel ~ congratulations! Cheers to Michelle, Wendy, Sally (does she ever sleep - she was working every meal!), Miranda, Charlotte, & Tye for making this visit fantastic...and it was a working trip!!!

Reviews.Title: “I will be staying there every time I come back”
Reviews.Author: to2to2too2
Reviews.Content: I travel to Daytona on biz 2 times every year. This is the second time at The Shores. It is fabulous. Clean updated rooms, great food, better drinks, wonderful staff. And my parking was free because I drive a hybrid... what a nice surprise! I have stayed in a lot of the beach hotels and this is one of the few that doesn't have the smell of mildew, that is a huge plus for me.

Reviews.Title: “Fees left a bad taste in my mouth.”
Reviews.Author: nrenick
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful time at the Shores. It's a beautiful place but the service was okay. It took several calls to housekeeping to resolve a simple issue. What really bothered us, though, were the excessive fees of $17 a day for wifi, the privilege of parking across the street in full sun, a newspaper they don't even deliver to your room and the use of tennis courts a few blocks away. Add an extra $10 a day if you want your car valet parked - in full sun. Our vacation ended on a sour note because we felt that the fees were not worth the so-called services provided.

Reviews.Title: “The Absolutely Perfect Ending to our Family Trip”
Reviews.Author: brighterlife
Reviews.Content: Our family - 11 of us, from ages 5 to 71, spent 4 nights at Disney World and then came to the Shores Resort and Spa before we headed home to Illinois. It was the most absolutely perfect place to unwind after a 4 day high. After we arrived there, almost immediately we wished that we had planned to stay at least 2 nights instead of only one. It was in a perfect spot, right on the ocean if we wanted to swim or play in the ocean, or it has a beautiful pool with plenty of lounge chairs all around if we chose to be poolside. The rooms were beautifully appointed and spacious. Two of our rooms had balconies which were lovely. We had had a great time at Disney, but for the adults in our group, staying at the Shores was the highlight of our trip. The breakfast buffet was very, very good. We'd go back to the Shores in a heartbeat!

Reviews.Title: “Poor customer service and rooms not very clean”
Reviews.Author: tyjojoko
Reviews.Content: The hotel room was not filthy but not clean either. There were candy wrappers under the sofa bed. The balcony was dirty there were two dirty towels left on the patio chairs on the balcony upon arrival as well as bird feces and mildew. The picture on the 42" television was "snowy" most of the time. The room was a little warm even with adjusting the thermostat. Poor customer service by front desk staff. The bed was very comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Will never make that mistake again”
Reviews.Author: Taylor D
Reviews.Content: Where do I begin? I knew this place sounded too good to be true..When we checked out we were told our balance & paid for it with cash. We assumed we were done with the place & could go on about our business. We were wrong. They charged our credit card the complete balance AGAIN a few weeks later. Along with an additional $100 dollars that they "forgot to tell us about." SERIOUSLY?? Then they refund us the money back..wait 2 more months and randomly take out the $100 dollars once again without any notification. So I look in my bank account & I'm in the negative because they decided today would be a good day to take our money. NEVER AGAIN..not worth the trouble. The audacity of some people.

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: Strategicevents
Reviews.Content: Just came back from Daytona for a business trip and would say that Shores Resort is the best in Daytona. While I most likely wouldn't come back to the Daytona area, this hotel was certainly very nice. Rooms are large and comfortable and clean. Service staff are very helpful and the food was quite good and reasonable. They offer many rooms with adjoining hallways which is a unique feature and good for families.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: donnamarie5
Reviews.Content: we recently stayed here,,, hotel was nice but no balconies if you have a room with two double beds. Nice view of the beach and ocean from inside the window. Would have loved to be on the balcony,,,,,,, to smell and feel the ocean. Rooms were clean and nice how ever. The $17.00 resort fee was a bit much.. there is only a pool and spa on the premises. Nothing more than any other hotel I stayed in, and was never charged an extra fee in any other hotel. The website for this hotel is a little misleading.... the Azure restaurant was nothing special..... on the website it looks like you would be dining directly on the beach..... not the case at all..... I wouldnt go back to this hotel,,,,,, compared to others for the same money,,,,

Reviews.Title: “Loved our stay, but...”
Reviews.Author: Cheryl L
Reviews.Content: Nice, clean property in a safe area of Daytona Beach. Loved the beds, Tiki Bar, restaurant and lounge. Staff members were polite and congenial; I would definitely go back. However, you MUST watch your bill carefully and scrutinize it even after corrections are supposedly made... Then check your bank/credit card statements to make sure all the adjustments were made accordingly.

Reviews.Title: “Annoyed with dog next door”
Reviews.Author: Sango01
Reviews.Content: Beautiful beach and nice pool. Did not realize was pet friendly and dog next door very annoying, also made me wonder if bed comforters are changed after animals stay in room, staff said yes but I saw them clean room next door and never saw a new comforter. Concerned me since I am allergic to pet hair. Bill under door was incorrect, had to wait in line 25 min to get corrected copy, they did not offer to bring to room.

Reviews.Title: “Nice, professional and comfy”
Reviews.Author: KaiWilly
Reviews.Content: Bathrooms was very spacey and shower was nice! Very comfy big beds and nice size balcony. We had a oceanfront kingsize on 7th floor. Service on hotel is very professional and good. Remember about their 17$ resort fee per day. This is added to your bill and is for internet, parking etc. So really it is no free parking and no free internet at this hotel. A bit pricey in my opinion when you have to park on the other side of the street. Valet parking is available, but for an extra charge. Loved the Azure restaurant. I had to order the filet mignon twice in one week we stayed, because it was so tasty! I would absolutely recommend this hotel to Daytona Beach visitors. I have stayed in many different hotels on the beach over few years and the shores is not rundown like many other "resorts" on the beach. But if you like to stay in walking distance of bars and shops in Daytona, this is not the place. This is in a quiet end of beach with lots of space for people who dont like to stay on top of others.

Reviews.Title: “Loved this hotel for the money”
Reviews.Author: lisacastro
Reviews.Content: I'm not one to write reviews but this hotel deserves it. Stayed at the hotel for three days and we enjoyed it very much. They have happy hour free of charge on Wednesday and Friday which was a nice touch(different choices of beer and wine). Room was great overlooking the ocean and noise does not travel between rooms. I really enjoyed the staff they were very nice and helpful. Great restaurant!!!! I recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Best in Daytona, we'll be back again and again!”
Reviews.Author: IWantToGoOnATrip
Reviews.Content: We've stayed at the Shores Resort and Spa several times for Girls Getaways and had a great time. The rooms are nice, clean and comfortable and we all felt very safe. I highly recommend this hotel if you are visiting Daytona Beach, FL.

Reviews.Title: “Wish I stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: roseofsharongardener
Reviews.Content: As soon as we walked in the door we knew that we were in for a treat. The room was beautiful, as well as the view! We were fortunate because I booked through Priceline and I paid for a room with balcony on the river side, but when we got there, they gave us an oceanfront room with balcony because they didn't have anymore riverviews! I was afraid they were going to somehow add an extra charge somewhere because of it, but to my surprise, they didn't, except for the normal charges of taxes and resort fee that we already knew about. Anyway, it was well worth the money! We ate at the hotel restaurant for breakfast and it was delicious! The beds were so comfortable, and the bathrooms so clean, the towels so soft, and the pool was bigger than I expected. Definitely going back to this Resort!

Reviews.Title: “Nothing But Problems!!!”
Reviews.Author: Dani0801
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location and thats about all it had going for them. We were on the 10th floor and heard nothing but stomping around upstairs do to a wedding parting on the11th floor which is their banquet room. I've had nothing but problems since I checked out with regards to my balance due. They charged me twice and can now not find one of the charges that has posted on my account!!! Basically calling me a liar!!! I get transfered at least twenty million times from person to person who cant help me!!! It's a beautiful location but find a different hotel to stay at.

Reviews.Title: “Be very careful”
Reviews.Author: jdandtammy
Reviews.Content: We decided to go to this hotel months ago and booked our summer family vacation through hotels.com and the stay was PAID FOR way in advance. Well at 3:20 AM, the morning we were supposed to check in, the hotel canceled our reservation! Are you kidding me! Thankfully I happen to check my email before we left and saw the cancellation. With hotels.com's help they found us another hotel nearby, but the only hotel available, it being summertime, was not very nice and our summer vacation never really recovered. The way I see it they must have got more money for our room and bumped us. I would not trust this place with your vacation. Be very careful

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, quiet location!”
Reviews.Author: KKL-WV
Reviews.Content: Hotel was nice. Located in a very quiet end of Daytona. If you looking for walking distance to the shops and restaurants, this is not the best place to stay. But if you are looking for a quiet, relaxing, away from it all--this is it. The beach was big and empty, the pool at the hotel was great. the only downside to the hotel was the beds. Only full size. But other than that--reserve it now!

Reviews.Title: “Only place I would recommend to stay!”
Reviews.Author: mahjrh
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with the hotel and all the staff. Great location, away from the noise of the north end of the beach. Only wish our stay was longer so we could have enjoyed all the amenities the hotel has to offer. The bathroom is awesome & love the shower head as we have same kind at home. Loved the size of the TV and the bed is so comfortable. To those that have complained about the carpet in rooms, I'm sure it's normal wear & tear and I believe the management will look into this & make necessary repairs. I would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT IN EVERY WAY, BEAUTIFUL, AND STAFF IS OUTSTANDING”
Reviews.Author: luvbug41404
Reviews.Content: I have had pleasure of staying here twice, once last yr. in November and about January 2011. I cannot express enough about this wonderful place. Very relaxing, clean, great food and drinks. The staff treat you like family, and truly want to make your stay impecable. So so much to enjoy about this place, and they all should take pride with making it a perfect stay as they do, for all. The ammenties and all are seriously a place that you will want to return to as often as you can. Thanks to all of you there, hope to see you soon again! Thanks again!

Reviews.Title: “Not sure about the AAA 4 Diamond Rating- it was OK.”
Reviews.Author: TravelGirl0517
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our vacation this year in July. Upon our arrival, there were 2 things that we were particularly not pleased with. One was that the hotel does not own the beach behind it. Therefore, there are no chairs or umbrellas provided for guests. You must pay $30.00 a day for 2 chairs and an umbrella. When I called the front desk to inquire about this, I was told that the hotel did not own the beach, that it was "public property." Being from NC, we were particularly not pleased with this as we have a variety of beach chairs, umbrellas, etc. that we could have taken with us, but did not because we thought a resort of this quality would provide these to theirs guests. We chose to go across the street down a ways to the Walgreens to purchase a beach chair and mat for our stay there. The second thing we were displeased with was the towels that they provide in the room for use at the pool. There was a sign downstairs by the pool that said these towels were for "pool use only." However, the website shows that the hotel provides "beach towels" for guests. Since we did not bring any of our own beach towels because of this, I called the front desk and was told that they were pool towels, but "unofficially" you can use them at the beach, which we certainly did. The hotel as a whole is nice. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. The king-size bed was probably my favorite thing. It was very comfortable. I slept like a rock every night we were there. However, again the website reports that all deluxe oceanfront balcony guestrooms have four-poster king-size beds, but we did not have a four poster bed and we stayed in a deluxe oceanfront balcony room. We were on the third floor of the hotel just over the pool. A helpful tip: ask for a room on a higher floor. The pool area is noisy and there were a lot of kids. The pool is supposed to close at 10pm, but kids were swimming in it as late as 11pm or after. We called the front desk to complain the first night we were there, but nothing was done about it. The pool is nice; however, the pool area is very crowded. Unless you are early, it is hard to get a chair and umbrella. There were also ants everywhere around the pool and on the access to the beach! Ants! I don't know if this is a common problem in summer in FL, but I can't believe they would give this hotel a AAA 4 diamond rating with an ant problem. We will not be staying at his hotel again in the future; however, the Daytona Beach Shores area is very nice. There was not a lot of traffic on the roads when we would go out for dinner. We would consider visiting this area again.

Reviews.Title: “A Let Down”
Reviews.Author: amicheltil
Reviews.Content: I was so looking forward to staying here. At check in they gave us a room and after seeing the room we asked for a higher floor, when we went back to the first room for our luggage, used the key to get in, there stood to men!! They had already given the room out! How embarassing!!! It was all about business parties and serving drinks, loud music til 3am on the pool deck. We ate on the pool deck on day ordering thru the pool bar. When we were finished we just left, hoping they would understand to just put it on our room. When we got back from walking on the beach the bartender tracked us down as we walked in the hotel yelling if we wanted to close our tab. It was so hard to take a shower with no shower door or curtain, it steamed up so bad, it just just a bad set up. One night 2 teen girls got into a fight like "jersey shore" throwing food in the pool, while their parents watched!! Guests came to the balcony trying to tell them to be quiet. It was a big scene of swearing and yelling. The hotel done nothing about it. The next day the teens girls were walking on the beach together. I also go a massage and it was not worth $20, like it was in a dark alley. I was so let down. Seems all they wanted was your credit card number and serve you drinks. It doesnt target the family vacation. Its the weekenders on company trips they want. I have no desire to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Dated but friendly service made the difference”
Reviews.Author: MountainJade
Reviews.Content: Our family visited Daytona as a side trip from Orlando. We wanted to spend time at the beach before the craziness of Disneyland. The entire town of Daytona Beach seemed dated and a little sad in places. You could tell it was lovely years ago, but it appears that the economy and poor city planning has hurt this area. However, the beach is really beautiful and saved our time there. The Shores hotel is a bit dated, but it is comfortable and the service was good. The lobby needs some work. The rooms seem recently updated and are bright and comfortable. We had a beautiful ocean view. The bed had a surprisingly comfortable mattress, and my husband appreciated the flat screen TV. The pool was nice and warm, and we had good food and drink served poolside by efficient and friendly waitstaff. The beach was lovely, although cars are allowed to drive on it. But you hardly notice them once you get close to the water. The hotel does not supply lounge chairs for the beach, unfortunately, but rental chairs and umbrellas are avail. on the beach (it was $35 for 2 lounge chairs and a large umbrella). We loved our time on the beach. After leaving Daytona, we realized we left a jacket behind. The front desk found it and mailed it to us immediately. So, if you go to Daytona, the Shores is a good bet for a comfortable stay, but nothing fancy. The service is why I have rated it a 4, not a 3.

Reviews.Title: “A little rough around the edges...”
Reviews.Author: fuzzypinkbunny
Reviews.Content: For the price and star rating of this hotel, I think there were some minor issues that shouldn't have been issues to begin with. There were spots and stains on the carpet. The lamps were dusty. There were smudges on the front door to the lobby. These things stuck out because of the high expectations that I had for the property. A little TLC would help make this a truly wonderful property to match the price point and high quality expected from the star rating.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again- Be Warned”
Reviews.Author: drmtk43
Reviews.Content: The Shores is trying to play dress up as a four star resort. At $300 per night, one should expect a clean, friendly resort with exceptional staff. Other than the bell and valet staff, the employees were sub-standard. The beach was beautiful, but the rooms, and common areas were below expectations for a four star resort. Worn look, dirty hallways (same trash present in the hallways throughout our stay). Enforced some rules, yet overlooked many others depending on who was around and how much alcohol they were purchasing. Told that we could not eat a birthday cake because they have a policy of no outside food and drink. We will never be back.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel! Would stay again!”
Reviews.Author: greeneyedpirate
Reviews.Content: We only stayed here for a couple of nights on our trip to Florida, but it was one of the best parts of the trip! The hotel is beautifully decorated and the beds are some of the most comfortable I've ever slept in. The standard rooms are plenty big and I like the way the vanity was outside of the bathroom so that the two of us girls wouldn't have to fight over the mirror. The staff were very courteous but the concierge was not very knowledgable about things in the area, and generally not very helpful. Azure had delicious food and we loved eating both indoors and out, but the menu is fairly limited. Try the seafood, it's awesome all over the Daytona area, especially the grouper which is apparently fished right in the area. We didn't try the spa but we toured it and it was very clean and pleasantly lit, if I were ever in the area again I would definitely give it a try!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in Daytona Beach but...”
Reviews.Author: TravelBuff28
Reviews.Content: This hotel is great, the rooms are beautiful and you have a great pool with lots of space for chairs, open fires, bars, hot tub, restaurant, etc. The beach is wonderful and you have lots of space and stuff to do, or you can easily relax if this is what you wish to do. The only problem we encountered is the service. We were 4 in the room (2 adults + 2 teens) and we had to ask several times for more towels because they kept leaving only 3 sets. House keeping was only making the beds, emptying the trash cans and changing the towels. We were there for 12 days and they did not change the beds or vacuum the whole time we were there. We had called a month in advance to ask for a room in the upper floors and they had confirmed that we would be able to have it. Unfortunately when we got there, our room was on the 3rd floor and they said they could not do anything about this. We visited most of the hotels in Daytona beach, and it is definitely the best one but they need improvement in service.

Reviews.Title: “Will definitely be back!”
Reviews.Author: merhou
Reviews.Content: My husband and I chose this resort, sight unseen, for our wedding in October 2009. My in-laws live in Daytona and suggested this resort. I called the event planner, checked the website and other review sites and decided to trust everyone and we booked it. My first visit to the property wasn't until a couple of months before our wedding and I was not disappointed. The food was fabulous, staff courteous, view gorgeous and the renovations to the property are outstanding. We had a great time and our guests at the wedding felt the same we did. My husband and I returned to, just as guests, and we had the same experience. The rooms are lovely, staff friendly and the pool is great. We never found it to be too crowded but we've never been during the "busy seasons." I have a son now, but I've never been a guest with a child so I can't say how kid-friendly it is. I would definitely recommend this resort to anyone who's looking for a great price with luxury amenities. Only downside, for us, was how far down the highway it was - it's not walking distance to any type of drug store or restaurant although if I remember there is a grocery store nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Fos123Uk
Reviews.Content: This was a hotel booked for me by my company based in Daytona Beach, as a first time visitor I was unsure as the reveiws of the area were not so good. However the staff at the hotel were very welcoming extremely honest and for a change very truthful about the area. The evenings were relaxing after being in the office all day and pretty quiet, I would suggest this is not a family hotel more of a retreat and getaway for couples.

Reviews.Title: “Family Vacation with a little one”
Reviews.Author: Shopgirl137
Reviews.Content: This was a very nice/updated and clean hotel right on the beach in Daytona Beach. We opted for the balcony with ocean view and we are so glad we did. After all when you go to the beach, you want to SEE THE BEACH and hear the beach. We traveled with our 22 month old and the hotel supplied us with a pack and play. We opted for the valet parking as well and so happy we did-well worth it. I couldn't imagine shuffling to and from with all of our stuff to the parking which was across the street. We simply called down when we were ready to leave and they had it waiting for us by the time we got downstairs. Hotel food was tasty as well-a tad bit pricey but definitely convenient. Spent most of our time at the hotel pool and children's play area. Our little one certainly enjoyed it.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful vacation!!”
Reviews.Author: Beckyfromal
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our trip to the Shores resort and it was amazing! The hotel is definately 4 star in my book. We had a king bed with sleeper sofa. The rooms are nicely appointed with a four poster bed and large flat screen TV. We loved the pool area and ordered lunch from the pool side waitresses numerous times. The fire pits were great at night for roasting marshmallows. The resort is right on the beach. Props to the valet staff as well! They were always very nice and courteous. The Shores is the best! We will definately return!

Reviews.Title: “Best stay ever”
Reviews.Author: Tjlco
Reviews.Content: Thanks to everyone at the shores from the super friendly valet guys, to the girl at the desk who I asked a gazillion questions to, and to Lindsey in the reservation department who now knows me by name because I called her so many times with questions. Great massages great pedicure, awesome bonfire. Yes yes and yes.

Reviews.Title: “Probably the nicest hotel in Daytona Beach area”
Reviews.Author: SKBubba
Reviews.Content: Pros: Luxurious lobby, bar, restaurant, awesome views from wrap-around balcony rooms, pool, cabanas, allows pets, on nicer section of beach, updated and well maintained, great service/staff. Cons: Expensive, pets not allowed anywhere on property except room, $50 per day extra pet charge, restaurant food wasn't that good, parking situation (across street or valet), wi-fi unreliable to non-existent, large screen plasma TV but no HD, extra charges. With resort fees, one dinner tab and one mini-bar tab, our four night stay was over $1700, plus tips. Parking is valet or across the street. There's a covered pedestrian bridge, but the elevator was out of service the first couple of days making it difficult to load stuff in and out. You can use valet if you don't come and go a lot, but it is $10 more per day plus tips. An attendant mentioned that valet parking is free for hybrids. When I made the reservation, they mentioned a $50 pet fee. They didn't mention that was per day. Pets aren't allowed in patio/tiki bar area or anywhere except rooms and lobby coming and going. They will allow pets to stay in room unattended (in crate) but we don't like to do that. There's a nice city park next door for walking the dog, and there are nice dog beaches at Ponce Inlet and Smyrna Dunes. This hotel was originally a Hilton years ago, and was featured in the NASCAR movie Days of Thunder. It was fabulous back then, and the nicest on the beach. The new owners have maintained it very nicely, the "king suite" rooms are a bit on the small side but if you get one with the spacious wrap-around balcony the views are awesome. Staff is friendly and provides great service. It's a very relaxing, fairly luxurious and romantic place. Probably not great for business travel, especially if you need wi-fi. The bar is pretty nice, skip the restaurant. Try Porto Fino just a couple of blocks down the street for passable American/Italian, or Blackbeard's in New Smyrna for fresh grouper or prime rib.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort - Fun Girl's Getaway”
Reviews.Author: DogLover86
Reviews.Content: I had stayed here back at the end of March with my husband, and this time came with a friend of mine. Everything was wonderful. We had an oceanfront room with a balcony overlooking the pool and beach. Although room service was slow as it was back in March, the food was delicious. The restaurant Azure is fantastic. We sat outside each meal to a great view. We both had massages at the spa as well. The spa area is very small and doesn't have any facilities to use before/after an appointment like a sauna or jacuzzi, but the massage was great. A little expensive, but very relaxing. I only had a few small negative things to say about my stay back in March, but I really don't have anything but praise for this visit. The Shores is definitely on my go to list for any stay I have in Daytona. There really isn't anything more you can ask for at this resort.

Reviews.Title: “4th of July at the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: Moondogge
Reviews.Content: Once again the Shores Resort in Daytona Beach Shores delivered on being the finest hotel in all of Daytona. We stayed over the 4th of July for 3 days and it was excellent. I had my wife, my 8 year old daughter and her friend, and our 1 year old baby. Our room was beautiful with a king bed and pull out sofa. We also had a balcony looking out onto the pool deck and beach. The pool and jacuzzi were great and we even purchase a cabana on the last day and loved it. What sets apart the Shores is their service. The front desk staff is the best in the business and were always accomadating when we had a question or request. I highly recommend The Shores as the only place to stay in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: simpsonj
Reviews.Content: very clean, exceptional staff, great location, beds where very comfortable, had a large group over the july 4th holiday, everyone wants to come back next year. The size of the resort was perfect, plenty of room around the pool area. Perfect for family or group

Reviews.Title: “AMAZING!!!!!! Can't wait to go back:)”
Reviews.Author: mrswalk80
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband just stayed here for our 3 year wedding anniversary. It was just a one night get away. The service was excellent . Everyone was so nice and very helpful. Our room was beautiful we had a ocean front with a balcony. If i could give this 10 stars I would. Best place in Daytona for sure. And I live here.

Reviews.Title: “A fabulous hotel,definately hope to return”
Reviews.Author: Gerardine24
Reviews.Content: Use the tiki bar for lunch and dinner,and the restaurant for super breakfast.Evening use the dining room more sparingly as can be relatively expensive but excellent.The rooms were lovely and the overall service amazing.Everything was spotless and staff very efficient,nothing was too much trouble.I could easily have stayed here for the two weeks without going out and about,it was so comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Place in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: travellingwest
Reviews.Content: Was an Orlando for a brief trip and had a chance to breakaway for the weekend to the Beach. After looking ALL OVER THE WEB for a nice place to land I discovered The Shores. Rooms were a bit pricey but worth the cost for what you get! Parking, Wi-Fi, pool towels, beautiful views, direct beach access are all included in the resort fee. Rooms were very nice. Comfortable beds and the river view rooms were as stunning, yet different, than the ocean front rooms. Turn down service at night is a nice touch and they keep the fire pits with beach view open late so you can roast s'mores and enjoy the evening outside. Only downsides in our trip is some weird smell, oceany/sewer like smells, at night. Wasn't there in the morning...but...at any rate wasn't pleasant. Also, the hot tub was not hot or open during our stay. Kind of disappointing. Seems like they'd get right on that and have somebody do a rush repair to get it fixed. Azure Restaurant on the property had great food. There pool service staff was busy but awesome. The reservations team via phone were fantastic too. Although I would check online via their website for the best deals. I noticed later in our stay that if we had booked online for the 2 nights we could have had the 3rd night free. Kind of felt shafted when I realized I missed out on that because I called. Overall, great place to stay in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Maybe not a 4 star.....but nice!”
Reviews.Author: GirlsfromJAX
Reviews.Content: Booked this for our 25th anniversary getaway! Upon check in...asked about upgrading our room, they wanted $90.00 more per night.....hotel wasn't even close to being booked! Opted out and stayed in our "riverview" with king. Nice spacious room, ice machine on 10th floor out of service and our toilet wouldn't flush....both working within a few hours! Rooms get very warm and stuffy at night even with a/c turned down. Beds are very comfortable. Poolside TIKI BAR not open, workers constantly around. An adult only pool would be nice, lots of kids. And the pool was full of sand even bright and early in the morning. Dirty towels lying around on the ground poolside, several staff walking past and not bothering to pick them up. No internet connection. On a positive note the staff are very attentative and friendly, loved talking with Tiffany at the bar and Kelly poolside. We will return but not expect as much next time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Time in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: avsafe
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights and loved it. Great food at the restaurant, great service from everyone, and great rooms. Sightseeing is convenient and there's lots to see, from traveling to St Augustine (1 hr 15 mins if you take the scenic route) to seeing the Ponce Inlet lighthouse...and it's easy to get around. Many of the sights are right on the road going past the hotel! The cost is a little more than similar places, but for a honeymoon it was simply perfect. There is a fee of $17/night for various services, like internet, and valet parking is $10/day. You get a good discount by booking through Allegiant Air.

Reviews.Title: “I will return the next time I want to splurge!”
Reviews.Author: JourneyWoman321
Reviews.Content: I never considered myself much of a beach person, but I had forgotten how much fun the ocean and the beach could be, especially when I can rinse off at the resort’s outdoor shower or dash up to my room for a quick change. I can’t wait to go back. The staff is welcoming and helpful. I arrived in late morning, had lunch on the terrace, and two spa treatments at Indulge before checking in afterwards right at 4 pm. I had a spa pedicure and the 50 minute massage medley and enjoyed them and the spa’s décor very much. I had never been to a spa before and the service and surroundings were wonderful. My oceanfront king room with balcony was on the seventh floor (I was originally assigned to the 4th floor but had requested an eStandby Xtra Offer for a high floor add-on at time of reservation). When I checked-in they had a room available on the seventh floor but since the 8th floor and up is technically considered ‘high floor,’ the resort waived the add-on fee. The room was spotless, spacious, and charming. The huge walk-in shower did not flood the bathroom at all, and the cable television selection was good. I’m not a fan of down pillows, so would bring my own next time. I particularly appreciated being able to control the room temperature. Not all oceanfront rooms have balconies – so if you want one, make sure the reservation says ‘w/balcony.’ I rented a cabana by the Tiki Bar for one full day and one by the pool for another ½ day – the one by the pool was the best because it was easier to stay cool. I loved being able to get food and drink out by the pool – and anyone can, not just people in the very comfortable cabanas. It was wonderful being so close to the beach – just emerge from my private cabana, walk down a flight of steps, and I was on the beach. ½ day in cabana was $40, not the $35 listed in the information folder in the rooms. Tax is added to that rental fee. Valet parking is $10/day. Lattes cost more than they would at a coffee house, and the alcoholic beverage prices were on the high side for the size of the drinks. Food in Azure restaurant was good, especially the Chocolate Chip Banana pancakes, Challah French Bread Toast, and the calamari. The Teriyaki Seared Flat Iron Steak was fabulous (I had it twice, once as dinner in my room). Unlike some previous reviewers, I had no problem with being overcharged on my bill at checkout (in fact, the resort had failed to note $80 in charges and I asked them to recalculate the bill for the higher amount). Only negative was I felt overlooked by the pool staff part of the time I was in the cabanas. A word with a member of the restaurant staff took care of that issue and all was fine after that. Tiki bar closed for repairs without warning on my second day – but service not really affected. Just a shame that I could not hang out there in the evening my second and third nights. I enjoyed the s’mores at the fire pit my first night. Haven’t had them since I was a kid.

Reviews.Title: “Over-Rated and Over-Priced”
Reviews.Author: FSU_Family_11
Reviews.Content: In planning our vacation to Daytona Beach, my wife and I contacted our local AAA office for recommendations. They recommended the four-diamond rated The Shores Resort & Spa, as well as some three-diamond rated properties that were significantly cheaper than The Shores. Wanting to make this a special time for our family, we chose The Shores for its professed extra amenities and four-diamond rating. That was a big mistake. Having been “stuck” before with extra fees for parking, we had our AAA agent contact The Shores directly to ask about extra charges because the property’s website made no mention of additional fees. We were present when she was told by The Shores representative on the phone that there were no additional fees for parking unless we wanted valet parking, which was an additional $10 per day. Believing that we knew what our stay at The Shores was costing, we booked four nights. However, we found out after arriving at The Shores that they did, in fact, tack on additional fees that were not covered in the already high cost of the room. They charged us an additional $17 per day plus tax for “self-parking”; wireless internet access (it did not work half the time and was very slow when it did work); use of a fitness center which we never used; use of a dvd library?; a daily newspaper that you had to pick up downstairs (rather than at your door); local and toll free calls (give me a break, everyone has a cell phone these days), and use of tennis courts, bocce ball, shuffleboard, and horse-shoes at an off-site facility somewhere down the road. The fee was a total rip-off. The only thing of value was the parking, which we had been assured before booking was covered in the cost of the room. To make matters worse for us, the room was nothing special. About the only amenity that was not standard hotel fare was the very comfortable, four poster bed. Other than that, it was nothing you could not get somewhere else like the Holiday Inn or the Hampton. Additionally, one of the few lamps in the room did not work, the cold-water faucet leaked all over the counter, and the maid never replaced our pool towels during our stay. Otherwise, the pool area was pretty nice and the bellmen at the front door were always very courteous. For the most part, we enjoyed our stay in Daytona Beach and the weather could not have been better. We will probably be going back to the beach, but we will not be going back to The Shores Resort & Spa. It is over-priced and over-rated.

Reviews.Title: “Love the firepits”
Reviews.Author: chat4kim
Reviews.Content: It's a lovely hotel. We got the special rate: 'stay 2 nights, get 1 free'. The staff were all friendly, rooms lovely, had breakfast one a.m. and it was very good. For 'Happy Hour' on Friday, they had a small set up in the lobby with appetizers & they also served FREE beer & wine. The firepits at night were great (while listening to the waves); we met some new friends (who were repeat customers, for 4 yrs). My only complaint was it got hot in the room between 3-5 a.m. We had the air on 68, so not sure what it was. For a 4 diamond resort, It's a very affordable hotel & we will surely return.

Reviews.Title: “Very disappointing!!!”
Reviews.Author: JRN1313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for Memorial Day weekend. We were so disappointed, let's see first the room and hallways had funny odors. Our room had a partial ocean view which was great. However, everything was old and very small, there was no room in the bathroom and the sink and countertops were so low I had to kneel when washing my face. The hotel is very small and has only one restaurant which was pretty good. One morning I went downstairs to the lobby at 6:45 for coffee, no coffee shop, nothing it was completely vacant!!! The gift shop was tiny and the lady working in there couldn't even give us directions to a nearby hotel. The worst part was when we went to check out the Spa, you walk into a room with a closed locked door. There is no one there to meet you , so you just have to sit in this room until someone comes out. There wasnt even a spa menu for us to look at while we wait. Twenty minutes later, we walked out! The pool was small, and waiters were scarce to bring you drinks. We will not be coming back here. My advice is to stay at the Hilton a few blocks north. It was much bigger and had so many more options!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice”
Reviews.Author: itraveltons
Reviews.Content: It was a very nice hotel, you could see that it has been updated recently. The décor is “old time beach” with wide red and white stripes and a lot of dark wood as well as beach print fabric, it was very nice. The service was very good, all of the staff was friendly and helpful. We enjoyed our stay there, but, there is a $17.00 per night resort fee. I was told everyone paid it. It was to cover parking, coffee in the room that was really bad (could not drink it) and internet. We didn’t need internet and the parking was across the street. There is a parking deck under the hotel that was not full, in fact it was almost empty, but they didn't let guest use it unless they requested it. I felt the fee was kind of deceptive, if everyone pays it it should show up in the cost of the room. That adds about $130.00 to the room cost for the week. Also we had book through Hotwire, our room faced west, which is okay in Daytona you have a parking lot/river view, but not as nice as an ocean view, also our room had no balcony. It was obvious that this was the least desirable rooms. The hotel was not near full at any point in the trip. A little upgrade would be nice and make me want to return.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommended for a 4 Star at a reasonable rate!”
Reviews.Author: WkndTravelGal
Reviews.Content: Our family just checked out after holiday weekend stay at The Shores. It was our first visit and plan on returning again soon! Staff was extremely polite, professional and helpful.
