I'd recommend this hotel for both couples and people with families. The rooms were clean, the pool area amazing and quick access to the beach. Ask for Kelly at the pool bar for the best service pool side. I've stayed at very high end hotels for business and pleasure and would rank The Shores among them.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT IN EVERY WAY”
Reviews.Author: HANS186284
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has a great warm and friendly atmosphere. The staff enjoy your stay as much as you do. The Hotel has all you need for a relaxing, and hasstle free Holiday. The pool is great,and you are a gateway from a perfect white sandy beach, and clear blue Atlantic Ocean. Don't look anywhere else..Book it.!

Reviews.Title: “Pampered Relaxation...”
Reviews.Author: BostonGirl13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had the pleasure of staying at the Shores for two nights recently in an Oceanfront King room with balcony. Upon driving up to the valet, we knew we were going to have a wonderful stay! The valet attendant was so helpful and friendly during our stay, going above and beyond in more than one circumstance. We were brought to our room by one of the concierge staff, who oriented us to the room and the area. The room itself wasn't huge, but it was very clean and bright. The bed was extremely squeaky, but comfy! The bathroom was large and absolutely beautiful.The shower, however, had a half glass wall that wasnt quite long enough to keep the water from running out onto the floor. We had quite a little flood one night, but housekeeping quickly came up with extra towels and cleaned up. The balcony was beautiful. We ordered room service breaskasft both days (the best room service breakfast and service I have ever had!) and ate it out on the balcony. Highly recommend it! We spent both days at the pool/beach. The pool service was great and we never had an empty cup :) The drinks were great, about $8 each but there is a $6 special each day. The food at the Tiki Bar was good as well. We ate at the hotel restaurant one night, and that was they only downfall. The restaurant, Azure, had mostly good reviews on TripAdvisor so we decided to try it. We were seated at a tiny table and were brought a LOAF of bread to start. It was very good, but way too much and we wasted most of it. My husband started with a caesar salad that had a very unusal (not bad) taste. I had the tomato basil soup. When it came to the table we couldnt stop giggling. It was literally a cup of pasta sauce. Im not even kidding. I think that someone mixed up the marinara and the soup. I didnt eat it, and was never asked how my food was. I dont like to complain to waitstaff0 its not their fault, they are not cooking the food. It would have been nice to have been asked how I liked it, however. The entrees were not much better. My husband had the shrimp and grits. He was not impressed. I had steak that was not seasoned and collard greens that were incredibly salty. Service was underwhelming. Even the table next to us was not impressed. A woman with her elderly mother had the manager over multiple times to complain. The restaurant aside, we would most definitely stay here again. It was a perfect relaxation getaway and we cant wait to come back- maybe next time we will stick to pizza on the beautiful balcony for dinner :)

Reviews.Title: “Perfectly wonderful from arrival to departure”
Reviews.Author: emptynesters0580
Reviews.Content: We spent five pampered and peaceful days at this beautiful resort. Our impeccably clean and lovely room was a King Oceanfront with Balcony. We want to thank and commend the entire hotel staff, those behind the scenes and those we encountered. It is evident to us that the comfort and enjoyment of the guest is the highest priority at The Shores. When we arrived it was late Monday (ll:00 p.m.), the front desk attendant greeted us and recommended a relaxing sit by the lighted fire pit. It was a delightful way to start our vacation. The wait staff at Azure and Tiki Bar were professional and friendly. Our special thanks to Dottie, and David. The food was exceptional, so fresh and well prepared. Twice we rented a beach umbrella and two chairs. The cost of $30.00 per day was well worth it, just pure relaxation. The man in charge of this service was also very friendly and mindful of our comfort moving us up higher on the beach when the tide came in. We are already talking about returning to this lovely place as soon as possible.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect choice for our business meeting”
Reviews.Author: Laura B
Reviews.Content: Recently I was charged with putting together a business meeting for twenty people in Daytona Beach. There are not a lot of business meeting choices, so I chose The Shores Resort because Kary the sales person was fantastic. Turns out the whole resort is too. The meeting went great, the rooms had fantastic views of the ocean and everyone wants to come back. We all agreed this was a best kept secret and we were so glad to have found it.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Stay!”
Reviews.Author: Bosco60
Reviews.Content: I recently spent four nights at The Shores for a business meeting...everything about the facilities was top notch. Great room, excellent meeting facilities, outstanding food, and service that was second to none! On my way home, I noticed that I was missing an expensive piece of personal electronics. I called The Shores and asked if they had possibly found my property. Within minutes, I was informed that Housekeeping had turned in my missing item and that it would be FedEx'd to me ASAP. Folks, service does not get any better than this!!! My thanks to the entire staff at The Shores, especially the sweetheart in Housekeeping who was so honest.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel - however, they do not guarantee requests from travel sites”
Reviews.Author: LisaAcierno
Reviews.Content: The hotel and property are beautiful. Just a word of advice, if you book on a travel website, they do not guarantee your room. We booked a room with two beds on Expedia. Unfortunately, when we arrived, we were given a room with a king bed and pullout sofa. They did let us change rooms the next day, but that's always a hassle.

Reviews.Title: “This is the ONLY place to stay on Daytona Beach!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: kasemt2001
Reviews.Content: Although a little pricey, The Shores is well worth. Traveling with teenage daughters we rented the Imperial Suite with connector room. The suite is very large and impeccably clean. The staff was very friendly and accommodating to our request. Housekeeping, valet parking, Tiki Bar, and front desk really are at your beck and call. A little pricey but well worth it. Plus there is beach umbrella's and chairs right in front of hotel on the beach. The view from our balcony was breath taking as we were on the 9th floor

Reviews.Title: “Nice property, with some attention to a few details could be fantastic”
Reviews.Author: RB50
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a long weekend over Easter at the Shores resort. I had booked the "Couples Retreat" package directly on line from the Shores website. This package included a couple's ritual bath and a couple's massage in the spa area of the resort. First of all, the property is located right on the beach which, of course, is a major plus. This family friendly property is located south of Daytona Beach proper, near Daytona Beach Shores towards Ponce Inlet. For us this was fine because we didn't really want to be in the hustle of downtown Daytona Beach. Valet parking is offered, and was included in our package. Gratuties were included in our package. I will say that upon our arrival on Friday at around five pm the valet staff seemed to be shorthanded and somewhat confused, although pleasant. (Seems like the managemnt would recognize that this would be a busy time for check in.) Check in was fast and the lobby is very nice. By walking though the lobby from front to back, the doors open to a fairly large brick patio area where there is a hot tub, a pool, a tiki bar area, and several fire pit areas. The patio area opens to a view of the beach and the ocean. The patio area seems to be well maintained and clean. All of the pool attendants and bartenders at the Tiki were friendly and helpful. The inside hallways were clean and the carpeting there seemed in good condition. Our room was on the 8th floor with a partial ocean view looking to the South. There was a small patio area outside the room. This side of the building is very nice since just south of the resort building is a municiple park so there are no buildings immediately next to that side of the building. Essentially, we had an open view of the beach looking South as far as the eye could see. The room itself was big enough, however the carpet in the room was dated, worn and had some stains. The furnishings, which included a small couch, desk, desk chair and small arm chair were dated and tired. The bed frame (a four poster type bed) also seems worn.The mattress however seemed newer, comfortable and in good condition. The tv was an older plasma type television but not HD. There was a DVD player in the room, but only a small minibar type fridge in the room. Our remote did not operate properly but was quickly attended to when we called for assistance. The a/c controls were easy to operate and cooling worked fine. The bathroom was clean but is rather small and in our room the tub drained extremely slowly. We had dinner one night off property and then a dinner at the Tiki area on another evening. We did not eat at the Azure restaurant so I cannot rate that. The food at the tiki was good, delivered promptly and reasonably priced (for a resort). We had room service breakfasts each morning ordered from a card menu the night before and the breakfasts were good. The spa, located on the second floor, is small but adequate and our two masseusses were professional and competent. Now for the billing at check out. There were some major discrepancies on the final bill which I must say in all fairness were corrected by the checkout staff promptly and with no argument when brought to their attention. It is a shame, though, that they were there at all. Our couples retreat package included two breakfasts for two as part of the package. We had room service deliver both breakfasts each morning. On the final bill, I was billed seperately for the first morning's breakfast. Our package also included a "$100 resort credit" which I intended to partially use for our dinner at the tiki. However the tiki meal was also included on the final bill. Again, once I pointed these things out, the breakfast and the Tiki expense were removed from the bill, but there was over a $100 of extra charges on the original bill. I guess the lesson to be learned is to always review the final bill. We did not pay gratuties, not even to the spa staff, ( as that was part of the package) and that was nice since we didn't have to keep handing out money to the staff. I certainly hope the staff does indeed get the 17% gratuity. All in all this is a good resort establishment, perhaps somewhat overpriced and somewhat in need of refurbished rooms. The staff, however, were pleasant everywhere we encounter them and all seemed intent to make everything right.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel but....”
Reviews.Author: CASETS
Reviews.Content: I have stayed twice now, and would like to say that this is our hotel for visiting our college son on breaks but I am thinking seriously about our next time. The first time, my only problem was the bill for the room minibar- they charged me for items I didn't consume. This second time I came with everybody- husband and two teenagers. They gave us two non-communicating adjacent rooms, rather than the communicating rooms I desired. We decided yo tweak that and move on. I again this year received another minibar bill for almost $23 for various items when my husband only consumed 1 ($2)- same problem as first stay. The shower while nice had a leak when turned on, and the flooring was "convex" ( uneven) were the water pooled against the towel wall and slashed all over the bathroom. I grabbed a glass but it felt dusty like it had not been moved or sanitized for a while. I wanted to have some coffee but the coffepot's water compartment looked visibly moldy or dirty, which seemed encrusted. I have liked very much the valet, chose this time to opt for the parking across the street which I liked. Finally the breakfast bar is great- wished they had a chef to make fresh omelettes but that's ok. I was a little perturbed that after the waiter greeted us, he went on to anticipate us that the kitchen service may be affected because there were a bunch of new staff in the kitchen. As we had tge buffet, everything was perfect but tge preemptive bashing of the kitchen staff I thought was inappropriate and unprofessional especially when nothing had happened (yet) and we had just sat down. We hardly watched the tv but we couldn't understand tge issue of having a nice HD TV with no hd programming. There were also errors on the breakfast bill as well. Might give it a third shot when I return to daytona because to sunrise and view of the beach from the room are breathtaking, clean, we liked the room artwork displays, the atmosphere is really great and the beach is beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: resecupSc
Reviews.Content: We planned a trip to Fl. for the shuttle launch. Unfortunately the shuttle launch was pushed out, but we decided to continue on with our plans. What a great idea. The Shores Resort is was very nice place. When we arrived the front desk attendant was very pleasant. We got to our room and found we didn't have one with a balcony. We asked if it was possible if we could move to a room with balcony. The attendant made this happen for us. It was a very nice place. It seems really family oriented with lots of activies for families to enjoy with there children. When we find ourselves in Daytona again this would definately be our choice hotel. Thanks to all the staff that made it a nice stay, a special thanks to the front desk attendant, you made a difference.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected and Delightful Peacefulness”
Reviews.Author: bbqrulz
Reviews.Content: My husband booked us a two night stay for our 11th wedding anniversary. Along with our ten-year-old son, we arrived and were treated kindly by the front desk personnel. Our room was spacious, very clean and very comfortable. We noticed, however, that just below our room off of the balcony was being prepared for a banquet. Wanting peace and quiet, to get away from our own worklives in the hospitality industry, we kindly asked to be reaasigned to a different room. The request was readily accepted and we gathered our belongings for a room on the opposite end of the hotel. We found this room to be as perfect, but more so than the other. The only thing wrong with our experience was that it did not last longer than two nights. I also would love to go back to experience some of the spa treatments they offer. Maybe a girl's trip may be planned in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Beach Bliss”
Reviews.Author: meggyjones
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel through Jetsetter and had moderate expectations, but the resort blew us away. The rooms were bright and spacious. The staff was super friendly and helpful. The location was great -- quieter than the main drag in Daytona Beach, but plenty close. Just steps to a pristine beach with chair and umbrella rentals -- $32 for the day, no matter what time you head down to the water, a much better deal than the pool cabanas. The tiki bar has great drinks and the food at the hotel was better than at the local seafood joints we tried. Order the grouper tacos and a pina colada.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Paradise”
Reviews.Author: carrie-craig
Reviews.Content: The room was spacious, all the staff were very friendly. Dlyan was our bell hop and he was very friendly and made conversation and gave us some great tips while he was bringing our bags up to our rooom. The hotel restaurant had some great food. The bed was so comfortable that I went to lay down on it after travelling all day and fell asleep within minutes. The marble shower was too cool. The balcony was a perfect way to start the morning with a cup of coffee and the fire pits were a great way to end our evenining.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: BFralick
Reviews.Content: We booked a long weekend here for our anniversary. The staff was great! Especially bartenders Clinton, Tiffany & Jim. They were the best. Also, the valet attendants were very good. We had a few minor issues with the room and they were addressed immediately. We would definitely go again. Thanks for making our nine year anniversary memorable in a nice way :-) Belinda & Bill

Reviews.Title: “Good resort, but with a few problems...”
Reviews.Author: DogLover86
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent two nights at The Shores. All around it is a nice place, and most likely one of the best hotels to stay in Daytona. I was a bit disappointed in a few things, though. I thought the room could have been cleaner. The drapes had stains on them, there was some mildew in the bathroom, and I found a sewing needle in the carpet. The staff at check-in was not helpful at all. We arrived in terrible weather (thunderstorms, tornado watch, windy). The clerk basically just handed me my room key with little welcome and no information about the hotel, and when I had to ask basic questions such as where to park and what direction my room was in, she had to ask other staff members. There is a self parking lot across the street with a covered walkway to the hotel which was very nice (especially in the rain), and saved the cost of valet parking. We had an oceanfront room which was very nice. The shower was great and the bed was very comfortable. There was also a large flat screen TV. One of the resort's best features is the terrace with the pool, fire pits, cabanas, and tiki bar. The fire pits are awesome, but good luck getting one as they fill up fast. The wait staff on the terrace was extremely slow. It took 30 minutes just to get a drink. Some people in front of us ordered food, and when they were done their plates remained on the table for hours, even though the wind was blowing scraps of food on the ground. Our own empty plates and cups were still on the table hours later at 9 pm. We were also surprised the hotel seemed to often run out of things like pina colada mix and lemonade, and also the cappachino machine was broken. Their restuarant Azure was wonderful. We were able to get a table outside for dinner. The atmosphere was fantastic - relaxing as the sun set, light music in the background, and the fire pits lit up. The food was delicious and our waiter David was prompt, friendly, and helpful. All in all though, it was a pleasurable stay and I would definitely return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value, Great Quality!”
Reviews.Author: Sunfyre227
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at Shores Resort and Spa and had a wonderful stay. The hotel is located 3 miles from the crazy of Daytona Beach, yet close enough to enjoy the activities. The pool, view, and room accomodations were exceptional. The staff were very accomodating, and since we had some bad weather, the free DVD's were a nice bonus. If you're looking for a true SPA, however, the spa is not at all up to standards. It's 6 dreary rooms and the prices were ridiculous! WE instead went up the road to the Oceans Water Spa, which is quite lovely and reasonable. Overall, our stay was great, and we can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “very nice & classy”
Reviews.Author: jjmarcelin
Reviews.Content: we just stayed 6 days here and they really go out of the way to take care of their guests. the hotel is beautiful and clean. The food is amazing and the outside patio is a wonderful place to hang out and enjoy the day or night. we asked the front desk about a cab they called Edward, he was the most kind, on time hardworking cab driver I have ever met. He drove us all over the place and would always be only a phone call away from picking us up. He drove us to the airport this morning and he bought us coffee mugs and magnets for the fridge to remind us of our vacation. what a great man. If your in town make sure to all Edward for a ride and tell him the north dakotans sent ya

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: Cycle75
Reviews.Content: Nicely located on the beach, but most hotels are on the beach. We paid extra for a full ocean view which we got. Problem was window was dirty so our view was obscured. We prepaid for breakfast. Arrived just after 7:00am to be told that they had an accident in the kitchen the night before and gas had gone off so there would be no hot food. The helpfull lady offered half price for the cold side which was above average. Reported both problems to the front desk. First time no response, second time was told sorry. The counter in the bathroom is very small. Room design is slightly above average.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic stay”
Reviews.Author: travelframpton
Reviews.Content: From the hotel staff to the spa attendants and Azure staff, everyone made this getaway for my wife and I fantastic! The gentleman at the front desk went out of his way to accommodate us. The room was great, the Spa experience was top notch, and the dinner we had in the Azure was 5 star quality. I never write reviews, but honestly the entire staff made our "Couples Retreat" very special and I feel they deserve the accolades. Thank you

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PBLorraine
Reviews.Content: Love, Love, Love this hotel! I will stay here again and again. My husband and stayed the first weekend of Daytona Bike Week and we loved it. There are not many really nice hotels in Daytona Beach - I am being generous here because I haven't stayed anywhere really nice since the Adam's Mark was new, like 15 - 20 years ago? So this was a huge surprise for us. First off, it was biker friendly, which was super nice. Bikers got to park right out front by the valets at the front door - always a perk when riding. The service was impeccable from the front desk, to the bar, restaurant, room service staff. The restaurant was great - the ambiance, the food, the fabulous service. The decor and layout were just beautiful in the public areas as well as the rooms. The out door seating with couches and cabanas by the pool and tiki bar were wonderful but the Best Best Best were the fire pits with Adirondack chairs overlooking the beach! They even offer smores kits to roast your own over the fire! Absolutely Fabulous!

Reviews.Title: “The Shores Spa-left much to be desired”
Reviews.Author: skmc
Reviews.Content: Recently, myself and three friends visited The Shores Indulgence Spa. Upon entering the resort, we were told that the spa was upstairs. After finding our way to the spa, we entered a dimly lit, poorly ventilated small room. No one was there to greet us, offer us a beverage etc. After waiting ten minutes, a spa employee walked out and asked us if we were her 10:45 eye brow wax. When told no, she immediately exited, only to come back a few minutes later and ask us the same question. At that time, we asked for some water and were given four bottled waters. Needless to say, the treatments (one facial, three massages) were okay. When finished with our treatments, we were ushered out the door within minutes (in other words, there was no time to relax after the treatment, no option to spend time in a steam or sauna room, etc.) After visiting several spas, I would have to say this was the least "rejuvenating" experience I have had. Considering the steep prices at The Shores as well as the lackluster service and amenities, I would not return.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! this was Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: stayindaytona
Reviews.Content: We took a trip to Daytona for Valentines Day weekend! We enjoyed our stay at the resort. Friendly, nice, clean and very helpful staff. Anything we needed they brought. The Valet parking was fast and efficient. Excellent food, beverage and snacks. The rooms were a little small, but overall comfortable and clean. I would certainly visit again. Hope to plan another trip in the fall! this is certainly my new daytona get a way accomodation.

Reviews.Title: “What a great stay....”
Reviews.Author: Honebemine
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend surprised me with a 3- day surprise Valentine's vacation at Shores Resort and Spa! As soon as I walked in I was astonished! This resort is beautiful! From the minute I walked in the staff was friendly and curtiousy. My boyfriend had arranged for an oceanfront room on the sixth floor. To his surprise we were not oceanfront. He called the front desk and complained. They were nice enough to accommodate us with a room on the second floor oceanfront. They also gave us a late check out for the inconvenience. The food and drinks are great! We had our Valentine's day dinner at the restaurant, our waiter Swan was marvelous. The food was to die for. The amenities were also gtreat, especially the big hot tub! I had a memorable stay. I will back!

Reviews.Title: “A Gem on Florida's East Coast”
Reviews.Author: travelinggang
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a quick getaway after riding the New Smyrna Beach bike trails. We wanted great food, a romantic atmosphere and relaxation...just what we got! The lobby bar is very upscale as well as the restaurant. I had the best wild salmon ever and his steak and the sauce were amazing as well. Service is top notch. The bartender was extremely well versed and made the best lemon drop martini and dessert martinis I have ever had!! Smiles all around from staff. Level of professionalism not seen in Daytona Beach!! Splurge for the corner suites with jacuzzi and four poster bed! We did not have to leave the resort!

Reviews.Title: “This is not a hotel...it is truly a RESORT”
Reviews.Author: Pam1031
Reviews.Content: The staff were wonderful...the decor was beautiful and felt peaceful in the Lobby. It just had a different feel than a "hotel". Rooms weren't huge, but tastefully decorated...and enough room for the three of us...it was just right. Not small. Loved the firepits at night. There was construction going on - but during the day...and I'm sure this time of year is better for them to do that work. Not sure I could normally afford to stay here, but it was economical at this time. Only at breakfast a couple of times, so can't comment much on food. Our tv wasn't real clear, older plasma maybe - but watching tv wasn't high on my priority list of things to do. Main thought - it did not feel like a hotel, but a relaxing atmosphere. We were there for a basketball tourney, so not sure costs when not discounted.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Shores!”
Reviews.Author: vaca81
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I stayed at the Shores Resort and Spa for New Years Eve, and had a wonderful romantic vacation! The beds were really comfortable, the rooms were clean, the staff friendly and helpful, and the hotel was beautiful! We loved the fire pits overlooking the ocean and enjoyed sitting by the fire at night and listening to the waves. For any couple looking for a romantic vacation for a reasonable price we would highly recommend the Shores Resort and Spa.

Reviews.Title: “ABSOLUTELY AWFUL STAY”
Reviews.Author: missme46
Reviews.Content: 30 DEC 2010: Recommended as one of the better hotels to stay at in Daytona, this place was awful. I am in the military so we actually splurged for the Holidays to come here. This is one of the worst stays I have ever experienced and that is saying a lot from someone who has lived in a tin storage trailer in Iraq. We arrived to find that we were placed in a double room after booking a King and even calling to verify the morning of (we’re compulsive like that). We were told unless you book on their site nothing is guaranteed (WOW!). We then were offered an accessible King room that when we went in was dusty and in disrepair so we went back to the double since already 8pm. Well the peep hole was missing and someone had to come fix what was essentially a hole in the door where people could see in (we stuffed with tissue until they came) and then to top it off the hotel started drilling with construction 7-8am right above our heads. Really for the holidays too, they should be ashamed. On a positive note, the shower was nice and the beds slept well.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel, Love the Firepits By the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: fishermark178
Reviews.Content: The Shores is a lovely resort, made even lovlier by the Christmas decorations and exceptional service. The resort is undergoing a brief renovation (construction noise between the hours of 9 am and 5:30 pm which will end soon), which may deter travellers who prefer to cozy up in their rooms; however, the oceanside firepits, manager reception with complementary cocktails, wonderful view and top notch food (the ribeye dinner and pear and walnut salad were terrific) made our second stay at this location a comfortable and relaxing experience. We booked our visit as a 'blind buy' via an online hotel service, but we knew what hotel we were getting since we stayed there last year. There is a daily 'resort fee' that I was told encompasses parking (in a lot across the street accessable by a walkway bridge) and decent wireless internet, so while they do offer these amenities, I cannot list them as free. The business center was small, but complimentary (perhaps as part of the resort fee??) and the workout center had a standard selection of cardio equipment as well as free weights and some nautilus equipment. The pool and tiki bar overlook the ocean, which is steps away. There is a nice inside bar and rentable poolside cabanas, but for us, the most pleasant time was spent sitting beside the large firepits in the cool air next to a warm fire listening to the steady rhythm of the ocean. Restaurants and pubs are close, but not walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT in every way...”
Reviews.Author: ablonde1
Reviews.Content: This hidden little gem is a GREAT value! I stumbled upon The Shores Resort while booking an overnight stay while working in the area. I couldn't get over the price and wondered if I would be disappointed? Upon arrival, I was greeted by the hostess who had me checked in less than 2 minutes. You do have to pay for parking ($7 a day) which is located across the street. You'll receive the code to access the lot when you check in. It had been a really long day and once I laid on this COMFY pillowtop bed, I seriously considered room service. But, I had heard FABULOUS things about Azure so I freshed up and headed downstairs. It was a week night and I was quickly greeted by the dinner hostess who seated me outside. There was a light breeze and it was a gorgeous evening to be outside. There is a bonfire every night of the week and other guests were gathered outside enjoying the sound of the ocean. My waiter was equally fabulous and got me settled in with a great glass of Riesling and a menu. Little neck clams with pinot grigio butter sauce for an appetizer and the roasted all natural chicken breast with sweet potato puree, toasted mushrooms and asparagus, in brandy cream sauce. Easily THE best chicken I have ever tasted. DELICIOUS! I was off to bed in no time and had the best night's sleep of my entire week away. It was like sleeping on a cloud! Even though it was overcast the next morning, I had the beach to myself for a leisurely walk before heading out. I will DEFINATELY be back both for business AND pleasure. Thanks for a GREAT STAY!

Reviews.Title: “Upsacale resort in Daytona Beach... who knew?”
Reviews.Author: MarkOrmondBeach
Reviews.Content: New favorite local hotel to recommend to family and visitors in the Daytona Beach area. Lovely rooms, posh spa and great restaurant with a fabulous pool and beach area. Highlight was making smores over the beachside fires outside listening to the waves rushing in.... nice....

Reviews.Title: “A perfect respite!”
Reviews.Author: dotskri
Reviews.Content: This ia a posh, intimate hotel that is also very comfortable; the attentive and friendly staff made for a relaxing stay. Rooms are big and the shower is divine! The pool deck is well appointed and decorated with colorful umbrellas and cabanas. We enjoyed drinks by the fire pit before indulging in our dinner at the Azure restaurant. The meal was way beyond our expectations-fresh, tasty, and reasonably priced, too! Would love to have stayed longer - the hotel was beginning to decorate for Christmas and it looked beautiful!

Reviews.Title: “"It's not worth it"”
Reviews.Author: georgeta01
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for a week. The first night there around 1:30 am someone tried to get into our room, but because we put the top door security latch they could not. We called the front desk and they said that they gave the wrong key, but never bother to call us or apologize. Then, Monday morning the construction started. We went there to get away to have a nice week long vacation, and should have been told that the hotel is under construction when we booked it, we would have never picked it. The hotel was clean and beautiful but our room was another story. The carpet had a lot of dirty sports, and few wholes in it. After few days the television stop working, but they were nice about it, and replaced it. The hotel is extremely noisey-you hear every door slam and water running in the middle of nite when someone decides to shower. The view from the room was not all that. We had an partial ocean view, and all we saw was the top of another building with a lot of construction materials on it. The hotels' pool area was nice and clean but it had a lot of red ants and they bite. I do not recommend staying at this hotel !

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience- Can't wait to come back.”
Reviews.Author: TravelinMan2000
Reviews.Content: Wonderful experience. Wonderful staff. Wonderful oceanfront view. What more can I say, but this is a place everyone should visit. This place should be number one on trip advisor for daytona. They have a wonderful firepit next to the water. Nice big hottub, but I didn't have time to go in. Defenantly, you should upgrade and get a balcony. It is a hundred times better with an ocean front balcony view. You can hear the ocean. Dinner at the shores was a little too expensive for my taste, but everything else was a good value. It would of been nice to have some lower priced meals or snacks available to guests. We ended up jumping in the car and heading to Subway. If it wasn't for that, we would of never left the Shores the whole time were where there.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Loved it”
Reviews.Author: SunshineSeeker71
Reviews.Content: This place was just amazing. As a Florida resident, we were able to book for $109 per night. it's right on the beach. Comfy canopy bed, large room, 42 inch flat screen tv. I think what I liked best was the campfires on the beach. It was very relaxing, and they have several, so we didn't have a problem getting a seat. Signs say you can't bring your own drinks down, but the bartender just gave us plastic cups to use. We are doing a 4 day trip here in Daytona, and split it up between The Shores and Bahama House, where we are now. The shores has the Bahama house beat, hands down. Wish we would of booked our entire vacation at the Shores

Reviews.Title: “Favorite place in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: SCLMMM
Reviews.Content: I have been coming to Daytona my entire life. I LOVE this place. This resort has such a nice feel and atmosphere both during day and night. I love to get dressed at night and go sit by the tiki hut and have a drink before going out to eat at our favorite restaurant, Park's. It's a beautiful property sitting on an even better beach!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: rmtCentralTX
Reviews.Content: The Shores resort was a wonderful place to stay. Great views from oceanfront room,,, great bar,, highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing at the american atlantic beach has never been better...!”
Reviews.Author: dekanus
Reviews.Content: Clean, luxurious and relaxing. Good service. Friendly personal. Comfortable pool area with nightly firesides. Beach, beach, beach with spectacular sunrises. Four diamond award from AAA. What do you want more?

Reviews.Title: “Great value and outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Bryan993
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel at the last minute for a quick family get away. We only stayed one night, but wished we could have stayed longer. The staff could not have been nicer. I was greeted by a very friendly young lady at check in. I did not use the valet service, but they were very nice and made a point to open the door for guests. Even the housekeeping staff went out of the way to make our family feel welcome. I am not a big fan of Daytona Beach, but this hotel is located south of the seedier areas. The rooms were dated, but very clean. Great television and a very comfortable bed. Parking across the street was very convienent and safe. Service at the pool was also very good. We did not eat at the hotel. The food looked good, but was a little on the expensive side. Would have given it a try, but with two picky children I know it would have been a waste of my money. I would not hesitate to back and would like to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: albertocoelho
Reviews.Content: What a great experience we had at this hotel!! Everything was perfect from the time we checked-in to checke-out. Great rooms, beautiful ocean view!! This is the best hotel in Daytona Shores!!!! Great staff as well, everyone we meet was very helpfull and happy!!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: Shirlshubby
Reviews.Content: Stayed at The Shores Resort & Spa for 4 nights after a cruise from Port Canaveral. On arrival we were told the Sea View room we had booked was unavailable due to overbooking so we were upgraded to an Oceanview room. And what a room that was!! Huge 4 poster bed, large bathroom, double size walk-in shower, separate storage room, 42" TV plus coffee machine. All the staff were friendly and very helpful. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: JayHudson
Reviews.Content: This is a classy place. The service is top notch from the valets to the front desk and the servers in the dining room. The rooms are incredibly clean and the views are amazing. At night they had a firepit that we were able to relax by and here the ocean rumble. The staff really goes out of there way to make you feel comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Decent Place, but not a 4 star resort.”
Reviews.Author: parfait1
Reviews.Content: We stayed at The Shores for 2 nights as a result of our daughter being part of a beach wedding here. It is true that the rooms are spacious.........many with nice balcony's either overlooking Atlantic Ave. or the Gulf of Mexico. The wood furniture in the rooms were knicked and the sofa was worn. The carpet in the room was adequate, but had several stains and tears. A $15 per day "resort" fee was assessed that we were told covered coffee in the rooms, pool towels, and high speed internet. We have stayed at dozens of 4 star hotels and have seldom experienced such charges. We were politely informed by the staff that the Shores was not only a 4 star hotel, but was a "resort". The Shores is located on a quiet part of the beach, but a couple of miles from affordable bars, restaurants, and shopping. The Shores was adequate, but not worth the price as it was no nicer than many neighboring properties.

Reviews.Title: “Best of the Shores”
Reviews.Author: Linda&John
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shores Resort for a week in August. Much improved from our last visit two yrs. ago. Check In was great-fast, and efficient and Best of all, our room was ready at 1pm; not the usual 4pm. The staff here are really exceptional - friendly, very helpful and courteous; a definite asset to this hotel! ROOM Our oceanfront room on the 7th floor was spacious and clean with a view to die for. Our only regret was not having a balcony. Not every oceanfront room has one, but the view was gorgeous and worth the extra $$. The beds are extremely comfortable and maid service was great. Nothing worse than spending a day at the beach and coming back to a dirty room waiting for the maid to come! There's a mini fridge stocked every day, but we found the prices ridiculous. Go to one of the local convenience stores. Also, the safe was located on the upper shelf in the bathroom closet! Extremely inconvenient unless you're the Jolly Green Giant, and we aren't! PARKING Parking is available across the street from the resort with a convenient walkway leading directly into the hotel. You can use valet $7/day or self park as we did. The Shores is located in a quieter section of Daytona Beach, which was exactly what we wanted, but quite far to shops, entertainment and restaurants without a car. RESTAURANTS There is only 1 restaurant open for BLD. The Azure is the specialty restaurant for dinner; and a bar and snack bar near the pool. You cannot bring any food or drinks in the pool or beach area unless purchased at the hotel; but there's a few convenience and liquor stores nearby to buy what you need. We didn't try the hotel restaurants at all because there are numerous excellent restaurants in this vicinity. We tried a different restaurant every day and all were exceptional! BEACH The beach was very clean and beautiful with no rocks or debris to be found. Perfect for long walks on the beach. There are no palapas on the beach, but you can rent an umbrella and 2 lounge chairs for $30/day right in front of the hotel. You can also drive on designated areas of the beach for a $5 daily permit. POOL The pool/ hot tub area is very clean with lots of umbrellas for shade. Also, you can rent special tent/day beds in the pool area with bar and food service from the snack bar. All in all, we would recommend the Shores for a quiet, relaxing vacation. If you're looking for a party scene, Go Elsewhere!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach, Poor Value”
Reviews.Author: zoo260
Reviews.Content: The beach is great but there are some service issues with the hotel. 1. When we checked in we found out the breakfast package did not include a full breakfast but included a $12.50 per person breakfast credit. Nowhere on the website or confirmation was this mentioned. I see they have since added this information. A waitress told us we could use the vouchers for the weekend buffet, this was ok, no one at the front desk mentioned this to us. They billed us a few dollars because the buffet was $14.50. 2. The terrace outside of our oceanfront room had massive amounts of peeling paint. Not very luxurious. We did not spend much time on the terrace. 3. Lots of billing issues. We were overcharged $50 for our deposit. We were double billed for a massage. I went to the front desk at checkout to get the charge reversed and the gent in front of me was complaining about various double charges to his bill. Watch your wallet. The food for breakfast and lunch was great, dinner not so much. Great view from the oceanfront room. Great beach and nice pool. It is a pricey hotel, there are better values out there.

Reviews.Title: “The Azure Restaurant was terrible.”
Reviews.Author: pschmit4
Reviews.Content: The Shores Resort & Spa is a wonderful hotel. The location, rooms and people that work there are very professional & a few went out of their way to help us. Special note to DAN at the front desk who went above & beyond our requests. He is a definite asset to your Hotel. The Azure restraurant on the other hand was your downfall. Not only was the service SLOW but everytime we ordered they brought the wrong meal. Ordered eggs over easy, recieved scrambled. Sandwiches that were listed on the menu were not the sandwiches that we ordered. The Mahi fish wrap had one small piece of fish in it! Substituting white (burned) bread for pumpernickle....ughhh! To add insult to injury, charging $3.20 for a cup of coffee in the early morning is an insult to my intelligence. You have Holiday Inns that have FREE breakfasts every morning!! Is this reall a 5 STAR Hotel??

Reviews.Title: “Great stay for anyone - honeymoon or family vacation.”
Reviews.Author: SStofka73110
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for our honeymoon and it was all that we could imagine. Very clean and classy. We would love to bring our kids to enjoy the pool, beachside. It does help to have a car to stay here because there are not many close restaurants or shops and the food at the hotel is a little pricey. But only 2 miles down the road you can find everything. The beds are incredible comfortable too! I don't have anything negative to say about our stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great Resort”
Reviews.Author: Ocean622
Reviews.Content: This place is great! The staff was very friendly. The pool is wonderful and the location couldn't be better. The prices at the bar were pretty good and the food was fantastic.

Reviews.Title: “Great Service”
Reviews.Author: hashammas
Reviews.Content: The Shores had the most courteous, prompt, accommodating service I have gotten in a long time. I treuly felt like a guest and not just a paycheck. The food was great, the location was perfect, the pool was clean and well designed. Valet service was inexpensive and prompt. And the tiki bar was a great little hang-out. We will definately go back and stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The Best stay on the beach”
Reviews.Author: anthony72253
Reviews.Content: This was our third visit to The Shores in Daytona Beach. It is still our favorite place to stay whenever we go to Daytona Beach. The hotel is very clean and cozy. The bedding is so cool and comfortable. The valet is definitely the way to go, and the hotel staff is very friendly and so helpfull! The hotel is right on Daytona Beach and the sunsets are spectacular. You can lay by the salt water pool or rent a cabana. There is beach access, so you can walk on the silky Daytona Beach sand, collect shells, and dip your toes into the cool ocean waters. We especially enjoy the firepits at night it is so relaxing. The restaurant was surely four star. We can't find a better hotel for the price. It is so nice to have all these ammendities at such reasonable prices! We can't wait to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Chris60814
Reviews.Content: What more can I say about the The Shores Resort and Spa. We stayed for 4 nights. Everything was wonderful, all the staff were very courteous and so nice. We will def be back next year for a longer stay. Our entire stay was so relaxing and enjoyable. We met some really nice peopled from Oklahoma. The Hotel was so clean.

Reviews.Title: “ok not great”
Reviews.Author: mrmage
Reviews.Content: 4 star rating a stretch. Carpet was stained but otherwise room was acceptable but far from 4 star quality. No deck, no fridge(other than mini bar), no robes in room you must ask, no newspaper delivered to room etc. Like I said not a 4 star resort by any stretch but over all was acceptable for $76 bucks a night (excluding the $15 per day resort fee),Beds were very comfy. I would not pay more than I did to stay here. Better deals in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved It!!!!”
Reviews.Author: shortyao1
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one night stay and I must say I loved it!! The staff was very pleasant, hotel was clean, lots of things to do. Next trip to Daytona Beach will definitely include a trip back to the Shores Resort & Spa.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Weekend!”
Reviews.Author: MCOtravel
Reviews.Content: After reading many Trip Advisor reviews, we booked our weekend trip to the Shores for a business conference with minimal expectations. From the time we pulled up we were impressed with the service that was provided. We travel quite extensively and I cannot tell you another time when I have felt this welcome at a hotel property. Some suggestions for the hotel include the possibility of offering some a la carte breakfast options for families with children. The positives for this hotel long outweigh the one negative we found: -Valet and Bell Service were outstanding. Always welcoming and ready to help. They were very appreciative of any tips provided. -Front desk was great as well. No issues at all and our request for a late checkout was granted without giving us much trouble. -Wait Staff. I cannot say enough about the staff at the Tiki Bar and Azure. Always there to help and they even offered us the ability to order food for our children off the bar menu. I cannot say enough about the service. Well done! -Conference and Meeting space was better than average. The team did a great job providing our group with most everything we requested. I will be recommending this hotel to all our friends from Orlando who want to get away for a weekend and receive great service. Thank you to the staff at the Shores and we will see you soon!

Reviews.Title: “staff was mostly friendly resort fee was bogus”
Reviews.Author: lsalmons
Reviews.Content: Upon arriving at the hotel the valet service was superb and only an extra $7 a day plus tip. When we went to place our stuff in our room we opened our door and about 2-3' later we had to open another door with our key again. This not helpful when your carrying luggage. The room was very clean although the DRY and CLEAN towel rack was inside the shower meaning they would get wet if they were left on the rack. There were not any dressers with drawers to place your stuff in if you like to keep it organized and take it out of your cramped luggage. The furniture seemed very mismatched and thrown together. They often ran out of towels and chairs near the pool. The internet was very slow. The azure breakfast buffet was overpriced at $17 a plate. You could also purchase a "smore kit" consiting of 4 marshmallows, 2 candy bars, and 4 packages of crackers for $10. Where I am from that is a TOTAL RIP OFF so i went to wal mart and got my own kit and made tons more for a fraction of the cost. The wait staff was mostly friendly with the exception of a few. I usually stay at the Hilton but could not get a room there on the date i was there. I will be returning to the Hilton next time i visit.

Reviews.Title: “One of Daytona's nicest hotels”
Reviews.Author: ladyaloha
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores Resort & Spa during bike week. It was a plush hotel oceanfront hotel. The rooms were very nice and comfortable. We especially enjoyed the nightly firepit gatherings.....so relaxing! Walking the beach to the board walk was a bit of a stretch for us ( we're out of shape) but was very enjoyable!! I would do it again. The resort was pricey due to bike week.Parking was available across the street or underground and was not free.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel I have ever stayed at !!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: dmcmillin
Reviews.Content: I was impressed from the moment i walked into the hotel. Very friendly staff. beautiful rooms , outstanding pools and right on the beach. What more could you ask for. The bed was the most comfortable one i have ever slept on. Great place to stay!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Hotel is in a good location, but very dirty and poorly kept.”
Reviews.Author: obvious25enigma
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel with my family, and overall, we really liked the located in a mostly residential area. However, the rooms are very dirty and poorly maintained. When we arrived, we were shocked by how dirty and stained the floor in our room was. We called the front desk and asked for a different room, and we were given one with carpet that was almost as stained and dirty. The refrigerator that serves as the "mini-bar" is noisy and rattly, and the air conditioning went out during the stay, requiring yet another call to guest services for maintenance. Also, the in-house restaurant is horribly overpriced for the quality of food that is served. The hotel is in a good location in a relatively quiet portion of the beach and the common areas are nice and pretty well kept. However, I would not recommend this hotel, especially considering the price of rooms.

Reviews.Title: “A pleasant stay with a great upgraded room!”
Reviews.Author: Nifferchic
Reviews.Content: My parents live in the "Shores", but we wanted a room seeing that we were on a mini vacation and had an infant with us. We decided this on a very late Friday night and according to the website they only had a riverview room available. We wanted oceanfront, but took it anyway. Once we arrived at the hotel at 10:30pm, we were greeted by friendly staff at the valet and front desk. We ask about the oceanfront room and were told they were sold out. My 5 month old daughter kept flirting with the front desk staff and I think she may of helped us! Next thing you know they found us an oceanfront room!! We were soo happy! It was nice to be spoiled for a change after working full time and taking care of an infant. We loved our ground room oceanfront room. The grounds are nice, hotel is clean and staff is very pleasant. I was a bit worried about some possible noise from a bar mitzvah right next to our room outside, but it was pleasantly calm. I do hate resort fees ($15 per day) because I think they are a joke, especially in this economy (you get wireless internet (slow), hotel towels for pool, local telephone calls and some other emenities that I don't use). In my opinion, this should be included. Room service was slow, forgot my drink and the food was not worth a 1/4 of the price. We will stay again, but we will eat out next time.

Reviews.Title: “Total Bliss!!!”
Reviews.Author: kitkat702010
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at The Shores Resort and Spa in Daytona Beach, Florida over Memorial Day weekend. Our stay was fantastic! I have never taken the time to write a review before, simply because no other hotel had ever been worthy. This hotel is worth taking the time to write about. Everything was 5-star quality, from the comfort of the matress and pillows, to the food in the Azure restaurant, to the service, and the amenities. The staff went out of their way to make you comfortable and meet any need you had. They truly thought of everything at The Shores. They had a talented man doing live music out on the pool deck, fire pits they light at night to roast marshmellows or just sit around and sip a cool drink, and the food is oh so good. For breakfast, you should go for the buffet. It offers fresh fruit (BIG juicy blackberries, raspberries, watermellon, strawberries) a waffle maker with all the 'fixings', different egg dishes, bagles, incredible thick and lean bacon, raosted potatoes, everything- and it's only $14.95 including fresh squeezed OJ or other juice, and coffee. It kept us full until dinner. They have staff out by the pool grilling for lunch, or you can be served and sit at one of the outdoor tables overlooking the pool and ocean. I can't say enough about the service. They didn't let your glass get empty. They seem to work together as a team with other servers delivering refills on drinks, and asking if you need anything. The rooms are very comfortable. Lots of water pressure in the shower. Beautiful soft lighting and modern decorations. They have a large flat screened TV in the room. The bed cradles you, and the feather pillows are the icing on the cake. For a special drink, I recommend the "Lori Special". Not sure what's in it, but it's totally delicious!!! My husband decided we are going to make this an annual trip. We left feeling so relaxed and refreshed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but Beware!”
Reviews.Author: BeaclLover
Reviews.Content: We arrived a couple of hours early and upon check in the clerk told us someone would call when our room was ready. No one ever did although he told us they tried. Not true... No coolers or outside food is allowed around the pool area. You must purchase food and drinks from the tiki bar. This quickly adds up when bringing the family. The grounds were beautiful aside from the hot tub which always looked dirty. The staff was friendly. The rooms are decent. Was disapointed when I checked my credit card charges. I was charged my room rate which was higher than my reciept at checkout, I was charged for the mini bar which we never used, and a deposit for the room.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Pede231
Reviews.Content: The hotel was very nice, when you first get in the lobby it looks a little fancy but it's really a nice laid back hotel. All of the staff was extremely nice. Our room was Ocean view and we were on the side of the building but it was nice because from our balcony we could see the river and the ocean and we could hear the ocean like you were right in front of it. I would for sure ask for a balcony when you book because only every other room has one and they are a must need to enjoy your room. The room was a great size and had a huge flat screen tv and a vanity that I thought was really nice to have. The beach was great and right in front of the hotel so you didn't have to walk far at all to get to it. Overall we loved our stay.

Reviews.Title: “The best!”
Reviews.Author: vacouple1996
Reviews.Content: We stumbled upon The Shores when we wanted to stay in a nice resort at a beach on our way to Disney in Orlando in 2006. I know many hotels on Daytona Beach are dives, so when I saw this was a 4 star and pet friendly, I took a chance. And how wonderful it turned out to be! The people are MARVELOUS!! We travel with an odd pet, and they made her and us feel right at home!!! When we drove up to the lobby, which is so beautiful, we were worried that it would be too "hoity-toity" for us. But they proved us wrong! They are so welcoming and fantastic. The rooms are very well decorated and very clean. The view is spectacular and the ammenities at this resort are very relaxing. We sat out on the veranda at the fire pit over looking the ocean with music in the background. The pool is very clean and relaxing. The tiki-bar/restaurant is wonderful - to eat great food on the ocean front! The restaurant is SUPERB. The Christmas decorations are so classy. The beds are very comfy. The room service while eating on your private balcony overlooking the ocean is heavenly! The gym is modern and has all you need for a good vacation workout. There is not one bad thing I can say about this place. We have gone back over and over again. The manager, David, who since has left, always dealt with our reservations personally which made us feel very important. He always welcomed us and our traveling companion with a big smile like he had known us forever. The staff remembers us and makes us feel like family! I love this place!!!!

Reviews.Title: “The shores again exceeded our expectations”
Reviews.Author: pandapoo
Reviews.Content: This was our 2nd trip to the shores and overall we were not disappointed. This is your best choice for a more sophisticated getaway to the beach. My husband and I drove there from Orlando. As we approached we could see that the property was well taken care of. The valet was prompt. Checking in was okay. I had reserved a room for $124 a night via hotwire for Thursday and Friday. When we checked in they were able to change us from a river view to a partial ocean view. No ocean view rooms were avaialable due to 2 conventions going on. I knew about the $15/day resort fee but wasn't expecting the $25.00 a day pet fee. I didn't mind too much because I had gotten a lower rate but wish hotwire would have told me that. Our room was comfy and clean although there was dental floss in the bathroom garbage pail that was a little gross. One of our lamp lights was burnt out but housekeeping quickly fixed that. Pool was nice and heated and kept clean I got up early two days in a row and saw them cleaning it. YOu MUST MUST rent a cabana. We did the "lazy days" package and it was great having the privacy of the cabana and having "cabana service" One thing I would say is reserve it early. Also I notice some cabanas the put really small matresses and some ripped towel matress covers. I pointed that out to the staff and they fixed it promptly. The Tiki bar was great and also the inside bar. I loved the breakfast buffet. I do have to say I had dinner at Azure one night and that is $100.00 I wish I didn't spend. Although the ambiance was great, the food was not woth the price in my opinion, however it was good.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: mobt
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent from March 18th through March 22nd at the Shores Resort & Spa and we loved it. I have read previous reviews that complained of the service but we found everyone quite helpful and very friendly. Our room was spaciious and had an incredible ocean view. We had breakfast each morning and one dinner at Azure and the food and service were excellent. It's been over thirty years since we were last in Daytona and our memory of the beach area was congested and busy. The Shores Resort fortunately is located in a less busy and very quiet area of Daytona and for that we were thankful. The beach area is flat and great for long walks or runs. Get up early and watch the sun rise... it's incredible. We had a very pleasant and relaxing four days at the Shores and hope to return.

Reviews.Title: “A very average hotel -- not worth the cost (nor its diamonds)”
Reviews.Author: ScubaDiver-Traveller
Reviews.Content: Very disappointing room and personnel. I rented the largest suite for 2 nights in the spring of 2010 (the executive oceanfront wrap room). It is not more than a budget hotel. It is not worth all the 4 diamonds it claims it earned. The personnel at the reception is useless; it does not care are servicing customers. They are not aware of any activity in the area. There is no concierge service to recommend activities. There is only one computer in the lobby to service all guests; it is clearly insufficient and we end up waiting constantly. The rooms all have the same size. Decoration is average at best. The whining from customers in the lobby when they check out and relate their experiences to other departing guest is amusing -- and telling...

Reviews.Title: “made daytona feel like paradise”
Reviews.Author: fondue1134
Reviews.Content: Live an hour from daytona. Saw add in paper and had a couple of days to get away. Daytona isn't our beach of choice but the shores haver change that. Such a friendly, pretty place that I am excited about visiting again, Nice to stay some where that can make you forget the stresses of everyday life with out the stress of spending too much money. Job well done keep up the good work!

Reviews.Title: “The most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in.”
Reviews.Author: Caringandsharing
Reviews.Content: Like I said the most comfortable hotel bed I have ever slept in in my life, I wanted to stay an extra night just for that reason alone. The pillows were so comfy. My only regret was that I did not bring a coat because the conference room temp. was too cold. So just beware if you should come for that bring a sweater or coat. Great time, great place. Love the salt scrub hand cleaner in the bathroom. You can buy it in the gift shop. Love it!

Reviews.Title: “Found a jewel of a hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MissyBlufftonSC
Reviews.Content: The Shores exceeded all expectations - beautiful decor, extremely clean, great food, perfect location, friendly and efficient staff...... We were there for a funeral and even though it was also Bike Week and the weather was cold, we had a fabulous time. Room was spacious and beds extremely comfortable, location was perfect, restaurant food outstanding, staff very professional - a top notch operation! We look forward to our return.

Reviews.Title: “Was a nice place except where our room was”
Reviews.Author: sparky1107
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this resort for a company banquet. The place was beautiful & the rooms were equally nice. The only complaint I have was that our room was on the 10th floor. Which the floor above us is the banquet rooms. Needless to say the rooms were definetly not sound proof. Evidently they were setting up for a banquet(probably ours) and you could hear them moving furniture around making a racket which made resting not an option. Also at the banquet when a few of us asked for Ice tea the waiter said it was not on the menu which in reply we said we would pay for it if they would just bring us a glass and were told no there is no tea anywhere? After our stay the company said that they did ask that tea be provided and did not realize that no one got any and that it was included in the menu & the price. Other than those couple of things the resort is a beautiful place. Just would not recommend the 10th floor if there is a banquet going on.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable and lovely, a wonderful place to relax.”
Reviews.Author: perfectcatchdating
Reviews.Content: I stayed here Jan 22-25, 2010. The hotel is beautiful, mostly clean, comfortable and although I was traveling alone, I felt safe the entire time. The beachfront patio/pool area is wonderful, the firepits are a great accent and the view is to die for. I had a king room and everything was comfy and clean except I do have one complaint--the shower. The shower had excellent water pressure, but the fixtures weren't the cleanest and the curtain had a stain on it near the bottom. But other than that, it was great and since that was the only issue, I didn't even call to complain. The gym is nice, like most other hotels. But if you can, working out on the beach is priceless. The hot tub was very hot and relaxing. I didn't venture in the pool though by hand touch it was also very warm. Azure, the restaurant was delicious. They made a simply Turkey Club taste fabulous and look appetizing too. I also ate breakfast there one morning and I recommend sitting on the patio anytime you dine there because the view is just amazing. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dancinbear
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel is located about 3 miles south of Daytona and features a beautiful lobby, bar and a fabulous restaurant. Everything we sampled in the restaurant from appetizers to the poolside sandwiches to the room service was beautifully presented and incredibly delicious. Kudos to the kitchen staff and the chefs for making our meals extraordinary.

Reviews.Title: “Resort fee rip off.”
Reviews.Author: ronlogan
Reviews.Content: Prepaid for The Shores Resort & Spa online - including fees. When we checked in were informed that there was a $15 "Resort Fee". This was petty and trite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay and Snow!”
Reviews.Author: MrsAU
Reviews.Content: Being from Orlando, we visit Daytona Beach a lot but never bother staying anywhere nice because we're on the beach or by the pool most the time. I gave my husband tichets to a show at the Peabody right after Christmas but wanted to stay in a nice hotel as part of the package. I found The Shores online and it looked too good to be true but I booked it anyway. From the moment we arrived, we were treated as if we were the only guests in the hotel. The staff was attentive and very friendly. To my surprise, the room was exactly as advertised ... large, clean and luxurious with an amazing view. The next morning, we enjoyed a delicious breakfast in our room as we watched snow gently fall outside. What a fun bonus and a wonderful end to our trip! The Shores is easily the best hotel in Daytona Beach and is now our new favorite place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: VesimeMillano
Reviews.Content: We stayed a fortnight and enjoyed the oceanfront located quiet comfortable hotel.

Reviews.Title: “superb hotel”
Reviews.Author: DUTCHANDFREE54
Reviews.Content: spend four nights while researching a condo purchase in daytona area. Definitely deserves the 4 star/4 diamond level it has. Former Hilton, redone to a superb, casual and friendly hotel with all the amenities one could ask for...and at a price equal to several 2/3 star properties. I would recommend this to people used to Waldorf level accommodations.

Reviews.Title: “Almost perfect”
Reviews.Author: tpmfoodie
Reviews.Content: Pluses: Clean room, large bathroom with plenty of hot water, clean linens, enough outlets to charge cell phones and a laptop. Pleasant lobby with room to sit. Nice firepits. Good food in the restaurant. Minuses: "Elevator" music pool and beachside and in the restaurant. I would MUCH, MUCH prefer the sound of the ocean to the canned music. After all, it's the ocean I came for. I didn't know before I came that the hotel was "pet friendly." I am allergic to cats and dogs (causes asthma), and although the room was clean of pet hair (after all, it's dander that's the problem) I wheezed for the two days we spent there. Since it was quite cold, we spent more time than usual in our room. I would prefer to have a non-pet room.

Reviews.Title: “Would be a wonderful experience in any city”
Reviews.Author: ScottOrlando
Reviews.Content: We're from Orlando, so when we stay at a resort in the area, we aren't blinded by the warm sunshine of the area. We're able to see the resort for what it is minus the given wonderful weather. The Shores exceeded our expectations in every way. The room was well-appointed with a wonderful view of the beach from our balcony. The two "musts", the bed and the bathroom, were upscale and lush. The TV in the room was state of the art. The staff servicing our room was extremely cordial. We loved our breakfasts at the resort restaurant, and also had an amazing Christmas night dinner there as well. The lobby and hotel bar are rich with dark woods and plush chairs and sofas. Some beach hotels can be a little beaten up, but The Shores doesn't fall into that category at all. We were there with another couple and while the guys played golf, the ladies enjoyed the spa with 90-minute massages. Our wives love their spas, and this one rated near the very top. At night we roasted marshmallows and made s'mores in one of the 3 fire pits near the beach. It was a great place to laugh, enjoy a drink and listen to the waves crash behind us. All in all, if you're going to do a beach vacation in Florida I have no qualms recommending The Shores. As locals we'll be going back soon for our next getaway.

Reviews.Title: “New Year's at The Beach!”
Reviews.Author: LolaLani
Reviews.Content: From the moment you are greeted at the valet, you feel like you're staying with friends! David, the General Manager, checked us in and made us feel so at home! The resort is gorgeous, like staying at a smaller Ritz!! We love the oceanfront rooms with balconies! They are so spacious, king size beds, full size sofas, big ottomans and huge Hi def tv's!!! By the tiki hut, there are fire pits, hot tubs and a heated pool! Great cabana's by the pool too! Bathrooms are spacious and well-lit! We have stayed here before and love coming back each and every time! And they have great specials!!! Food here is amazing too!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place for "staycation" with spouse”
Reviews.Author: FiveCents1
Reviews.Content: As a Florida resident who lives in the next town over, I took my wife here on a "Florida Resident Rate" package for a night away from the kids - which was about $125 all-in, and included a buy one, get one on dinner and a discounted spa package. We did all of the above and it was a great deal. This is a 4-star+ type resort - an excellent restaurant and just a cool, intimate atmosphere. We had a great time. Additionally, given the economy and the likely high vacancy rate, they have subsequently sent us emails aggressively marketing a return trip at an even better rate - which we are taking advantage of this weekend. Additionally, when you book your room, you will be given the option to upgrade to a better room at a discounted rate, based on availability. I booked us into the cheapest room, then opted for the $9 upgrade to an ocean view - which would normally be like a +$25 room. We got the upgrade which was a win-win. In summary, a great place to stay - probably the best in the greater Daytona Beach area. Anywhere else, this place is a $300+ a night-type resort.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely resort off the beaten track, needs to get their act together”
Reviews.Author: mikestage
Reviews.Content: My two night stay at the Shores was lovely on many levels: Great room, nice balcony, very pleasant staff members, good food at the restaurant, great fire pits out by the beach, nice pool, nice TV in the room, good safe, strong water pressure in the shower. It seems like it is one of the nicest hotels in Daytona Beach shores, the community just south of Daytona Beach. The city was absolutely dead; I mean dead. Half of the restaurants were closed, and the hotel seemed completely empty. We got a great rate of 99 with a AAA discount. But there were several hitches. When we drove up, we had to lug our own luggage up to the room. After about 10 minutes of unloading someone offered to help, but by then, we had done all the work ourselves and didn't want to tip someone for coming in at the end to help. We used a cart and took everything up by ourselves and returned the cart. Then we had to move our car to the self-parking lot across the street. Valet was an additional $7 per night. The room was great. Very pretty and everything was brand new. Large room. The internet was not working and did not work until the next day. They waived the $15 resort fee given the situation. The internet was working by the second night, but was unbelievably slow. Worse than dial-up. They never cleaned our room on the second day and we had to call down to get fresh towels and soap, which they brought up immediately. Breakfast was nice. The menu was reasonable for a resort. The food was very good, and the deck out by the beach, even though it was cold and overcast couldn't have been nicer. The service was a mess. It took over a half hour to bring our food, which was not really hot when it arrived. The coffee was not hot, the waffles were not hot at all, but very good anyway. The waiter was a nice as he could be however. So given the iffy problems, I'd still stay here again. as a matter of fact, there really isn't any other truly nice resorts in Daytona, away from the action but right on the beach. I'm sure they will get things together and it will become the great place it is destined to become.

Reviews.Title: “Pet friendly and fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: bossafin
Reviews.Content: Found this on bringfido.com, a site for dog-friendly hotels. Expected fleabag since the price was only a surprising $100, but we were thrilled to have a beautiful suite-sized room, excellent service from Dylan the valet, to Tyler the waiter in the wonderful restaurant. Staff couldn't have been nicer. There is a park next door to walk dogs in, beautiful terrace on beach with firepits. Nice bar--overall a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Classy Hotel”
Reviews.Author: redroadster1967
Reviews.Content: Do not book this hotel unless you are willing to add another $15.00 per day for the resort fee. I booked this through Orbitz and this fee was not disclosed, it was only learned at arrival. I feel that this was wrong on the part of Orbitz not to share this fee up front.

Reviews.Title: “Will Definitely Return!”
Reviews.Author: idreamofvacations
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant experience... picked this hotel on a whim and what a delightful stay we had on our vacation. Staff service was excellent and the hotel was exceptionally clean and well maintained. We will definitely return in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Great staff, great rooms, great food & drinks and great view....”
Reviews.Author: JudgeHamilton
Reviews.Content: The young staff at this 4 diamond resort are eager to please and go out of their way to make you feel very special....the bar inside and the tiki hut outside are both great spots to drink while you watch and listen to the ocean waves....and they have spoors for the open fires on the pool deck....The snacks at the bar and the food in the restaurant are nothing less than fantastic....and ask for a Rum Runner...they are Great !!!!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel made our Anniversary the best experience of our lives.”
Reviews.Author: rwest1119
Reviews.Content: The management and staff at this hotel did a wonderful job of meeting our every need and the Azure food was terrific. Great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Just Do It !!! You have to !!!”
Reviews.Author: SystematicVoyager
Reviews.Content: The Shores is absolutely awesome. Our first experience was great and we decided to revisit. WOW !!! It just gets better. The oceanfront room is an absolute must. The view will take your breath and the sound of those waves crashing is just perfect to lull you to sleep at night... and quite romantic too. Noticed the new "perks" now offered such as... poolside service, towel boy, locking of the beach gate (feels safer), offer of complimentary water at every turn. Check in was painless. Check out was painless. They really seem to have their stuff together. OH... and while there you must "indulge" yourself at INDULGE Spa. For a superb massage session Sue is awesome. And for the pedicure of a lifetime Lisa is the best. The wonderful experiences had at The Shores will definitely keep us coming back. It is so refreshing to see this beacon shining as you drive down Daytona Beach. You just know all is well once you get there.

Reviews.Title: “Top Notch”
Reviews.Author: rbronnie1
Reviews.Content: The service here was outstanding from the minute you enter the lobby, actually from the moment you make your reservation I was impressed with a call a few days prior to let us know what activities were taking place. We did the bed and breakfast package and also had several meals at the hotel. Every meal was fabulous and the wait staff was amazing. The rooms were spacious and immaculate, beds were so comfy. I would give this property a 100% except for one thing. It is pet friendly and there was a family with a puppy who left it caged in the room all day while they were out having fun and it would bark constantly. That was unacceptable. I would definitely go back.

Reviews.Title: “A Wonderful Summer Vacation”
Reviews.Author: momof3sib
Reviews.Content: The SHORE RESORT AND SPA was a beautiful place to stay with my family and small childre, i love the look of the rooms cause they are so much nicer than a typical look of a hotel room..felt cozy! Pool and beach were great & food to! YOU MUST ORDER ROOM SERVICE FOR BREAKFAST THE PANCAKES AND FRENCH TOAST IS DELICIOUS AND AN ADULT ORDER IS ENOUGH FOR 2 PEOPLE...I CAN'T WAIT TO GO BACK NEXT YEAR!

Reviews.Title: “Upscale for Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: travelgirl1055
Reviews.Content: Upscale for the struggling city of Daytona Beach. I booked through Priceline and got a rate of $65 /night for a riverview room. Since the hotel was slow they gave me a very nice free upgrade to an oceanview room at the same rate. The only caveats: There is a $15 "resort fee" that is added on daily for "free" internet, local calls and use of the swimming pool, hot tub, Tiki Bar and fire pits. The self park is across the street with an over road walkway so leave someone in the lobby with luggage before self parking. Valet is a reasonable $7/night. Poolside restaurant is nice, service friendly, but breakfast set us back $50 for three. Try driving a few miles north on A1A to the Starlite Diner across from the Ocean Walk for a nice pile of pancakes for around six bucks.
