Reviews.Title: “Will definitely return to this resort!”
Reviews.Author: HenleyOrlando
Reviews.Content: Come prepared to relax, enjoy, eat and be treated like royalty

Reviews.Title: “Don't go if you are allegric to pets”
Reviews.Author: bobfirst
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel but I was shocked and very disappointed that they allow guest to have their dogs in the room. When I tried to explained that I am allergic to dog & cat hair they responded they were very proud of their "pet friendly policy". Then they insulted my IQ by telling me how they use a special "ozone cleaning system" that removes all pet hairs. Yeah right ! This saves the pets owners the cost of making arrangements for their pets at the expense of other patrons HEALTH. I hope upper management realized the error of this pet friendly policy.

Reviews.Title: “Seamless Service would take The Shores over the Top”
Reviews.Author: garypcsc
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores from September 11 through September 15 in an Oceanfront King Room with balcony (Room 708). We were quite pleased with the large size of the room and bathroom as well as the decor.. My wife would have liked a tub, but the shower was satisfactory. Our package included breakfast every day, which we enjoyed thoroughly. The breakfast menu has a good selection and you can have your breakfast indoors or on a covered veranda. We also had a nice dinner at the Azure restaurant. I had a strangely cut NY Strip (like 2 triangles), but it was tender and juicy. My wife had a fish dish which she enjoyed. My wife took advantage of two included spa treatments, first the massage medely and then the magarita pedicure. (You guessed right, the pedicure comes with an included margarita). The decor of the lobby and indoor bar were really hansome with the dark mahagony walls. The view of the pool area and ocean from our balcony was spectacular. We also enjoyed the easy access from the pool area to the beach. The 2 fire pits, lit at dusk, were a nice touch. We didn't use the pool or the hot tub, but everything appeared to be well maintained. We did enjoy cocktails at the Tiki Hut Bar and Lorie the bartender was very accommodating. Ask her to make you Lorie's special which is on the bar menu. Valet service was always prompt. We also had good service from the bellmen. Now for our only complaint. Had we been told that we should simply sign for all our included package amenities and they would be adjusted off the bill at the end, service would have been flawless. However, since we weren't told, asking the service provider (such as at the restaurant, the spa, the bar) what to do only opened up a can of worms. The spa said you should have a certificate, the restaurant didn't know what to do, the bartender never heard of welcome cocktails, etc. After taking this up with the front desk, thehy said to simply sign the bill and it would be adjusted. Sounds great, makes everything alot easier, but when we got the bill left under your door the night prior to your checkout, it included all those prepaid items. When I called the front desk and asked why the bill hadn't been adjusted, the response was "because, that's not your final bill". Well, if that's not my final bill, why waste my time and yours by delivering it?? All things considered, I still gave The Shores 5 stars because it did so many things right.

Reviews.Title: “Absolsutely the best”
Reviews.Author: MyShores
Reviews.Content: This is our second time we stay at the Shores, we came back because we loved it, and will always come back. The rooms, the service, the staff, the food and the events/activities are all excellent. We go to Daytona Beach 3-4 times a year and we always stayed in different places until we found the Shores, we will not stay anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “More than pleased with this resort”
Reviews.Author: southga
Reviews.Content: Visited this destination as a pleasure trip but it was with friends from work . We were more than pleased with the entire facility,was very clean, food was good.It is rather small compared to others in daytona, but I really like these smaller more boutique hotels.We had only a small little problem that they corrected for us. When booking we booked an ocean view and when we realized this was a side room looking partially over the lower roof and not a direct view which is called oceanfront view, we called downstairs and was changed to a much better room and was only maybe $15 more a night, which it was well worth it . Was a great view of the ocean ,pool and hot tub area. We loved it. Sat on the balcony alot. Had excellant service from the bellman and from all staff. The breakfast was very good , did not eat any other meals here. Would highly recommend this hotel,but be sure and ask for oceanfront view with a balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: lolly1123
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Shores Hotel from 9/10/09-09/13/09. Let me say I am very picky when it comes to hotels and I really love this place! We had Grandparents, my husband and my 2 kids, 2 and 4 yrs old vacationing. We had Ocean view rooms, 831 and 832, one with a balcony and one without. I would stay in the King bed when we go back as the 4 poster bed abscured the view of the tv and the tv is bigger in the King rooms. No balcony is good if you have small kids who are climbers like mine. The beds are very comfortable and the linens and pillows are very soft. There is a table and 2 chairs in the double rooms and a couch and ottomon in the king room that does fold out for kids. The bathroom was nice with granite countertops. The sinks are a little low, but not a big deal. The hotel is just beautiful inside. The paint colors and light fixtures are so unique. The staff was very nice and even changed our linens at 3am when our son wet the bed. The valet is only $7.00 a day and they are very quick, never had to wait for the car. The resturaunt had outstanding food. Expensive. They do have a minifridge, we took everything out from the minibar and used it for our milk and snacks. Even the little lunches they bring you out to the pool deck are wonderful. We ate breakfast and lunches there on several occasions and were all excellent meals. The pool and deck are very pretty and like a tropical oasis. Nice hot tub, no jacuzzi though. The pool is saltwater and heated. The kiddie pool is a regular little round one, but they do have a terrific splash pad area right next to it which my kids loved. they have tons of lounge chairs and cabanas to use. You can rent the cabans for the day for around $45 and that includes the cabana mattress and pillows. If no one is using them, you can sit on them and put your belongings there. They have pool towels that you can sign out. They have great pool deck service. There was staff coming around checking to see if guests needed food and giving out cups of ice water with lemon. There is also a locked gate that you have to have a code to get back in with. Nice for people who dont belong walking up from the beach. They have a nice spa, my dad got a massage and enjoyed it greatly. They did have a late checkout that is complimentary until 1pm. If you want to stay till 5pm, it is an extra $45.00 charge, which we took advantage of. I would definitly go back to this hotel. It is located on the south end of Daytona beach so there is less traffic, and no other big hotels are located nearby, mostly houses and condos. There is also a cute playground located next door to the hotel and has a nice ramp you can access from the beach. I am already looking at going back in November for my husband and my birthdays. We live locally and would highly recommend this hotel over all the others in Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Paradise! We loved it!”
Reviews.Author: RoscoeTracie
Reviews.Content: Great room, sofa bed perfect for out 2 year old daughter to sleep on! Breakfast room sevice was Awsome! We will go back to stay there everytime we visit Daytona Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel! 5 stars from us!! Comfortable, Great Service and Clean”
Reviews.Author: premierm3
Reviews.Content: We have high expectations when picking a hotel. CLEAN!!! SERVICE!!! COMFORT!!! CONVENIENCE!!! This hotel exceeded all my expectations. We were extremely happy with our stay. Valet was awesome. Got my car real fast every day. Staff was ALL FRIENDLY. We didn't have 1 bad experience. We have stayed at the Wynn, MGM Signature, Mandalay Bay THE HOTEL, and even 6 star hotels in Hong Kong......THE SHORES really shined. We enjoyed our stay very much. We had drinks at the fire pit, their Tiki hut bar, it was only a minute to go down the stairs to the beach and swim in the ocean, the heated pool was so nice, just a relaxing, clean, friendly hotel. Excellent drinks by the way. Oh, and the Shower pressure in the bathroom was incredible. We had the partial ocean view but the view from our room was sweet and we even kept the balcony door open at night to sleep to the ocean sound. Plasma Tv, Fast Internet. A+++++++++ Highly Recommended.

Reviews.Title: “best hotel experience we've ever had!”
Reviews.Author: carolinatabby
Reviews.Content: We booked here for a 1 night rest after getting off a cruise befor heading back to SC. Could not tear ourselves away after just 1 night! postponed our trip home and can't wait to return to this wonderful hotel.lovely rooms,lobby,restaurant,bar,pool.the location is perfect on the beach,great tiki bar area with firepits lit each evening as the sun sets! you can even make S'mores!!! IMPECCABLE service,truly above and beyond! my husband is wheelchair bound with ALS and we rarely find places this welcoming and accomodating.We were even able to drive his wheelchair down on the beach1 Priceless!!!This resort is only for tose of you who expect the best! Rob & Betty Cramer

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Facility ...so, so service”
Reviews.Author: GreatEscaper
Reviews.Content: This is a very beautiful facility with well appointed common areas and attractive rooms. Lots of special touches such as the fire pit by the pool, the cabanas and a drop dead lobby area with accessible laptop. This end of the beach is less crowded and close to the park at Ponce Inlet. We experienced trouble at check-in and the pool side cabana bar was poorly managed and staffed by two unfriendly female bar tenders. They may have just been overloaded, but it took us two tries and 45 minutes before we were finally able to get two drinks. We ended up driving down the street to the liquor store and getting our own after that. Make sure to consider the mandatory $15 resort free (internet, paper, towels and free lot) and $9 valet when comparing prices.

Reviews.Title: “You need to know this before you book”
Reviews.Author: Well_travelled097
Reviews.Content: Just returned from our first (and last) trip to Daytona Beach. We stayed at the Shores Resort and secured a great price for the Presidential Suite through a friend who is an employee in the parent company. Here is our review: What God is responsible for (beach, ocean, weather): absolutely gorgeous. Wonderful beach and beautiful ocean. No complaints. What man is responsible for (Daytona Beach): There is no other way to put it but than to say it is a dump. We had not been before and found it to be a mixture of tacky souvenir shops, condo buildings (some nice, some shoddy), so-called 'resorts' and motels (several of which were closed down and in disrepair) and seedy looking bars. Daytona Beach is not a family friendly place, and I can now see why it is so popular with college kids who don't know or care any better. There really is not much to do there other than drink yourself silly. As for the Shores: As I mentioned, we secured the Presidential Suite thanks to a friend who works for the parent company. The suite is absolutely gorgeous. It was spacious, clean and located with a tenth-floor ocean view, including two balconies overlooking the ocean. We have no complaints with the room. Our only problem on the first of our two-night stay was the late-night noise made by the four heavily tatooed men staying in the next room. The constant humming noise sounded an awful lot like a tatoo machine, and they were loud and annoying, to say the least. I did meet an interesting lady coming out of the elevator who was clearly agitated and said to me, "this hotel is a piece of ****." Apparently, this was her sixth stay, and she was upset that she had to move her own stuff from the 10th to 7th floor. Oh, well. That didn't bother us. We booked our stay in order to 'get away from it all' and relax with our children by the ocean. We enjoyed the resort location and easy access to the beach. The staff were friendly, and we had no complaints with them. Here is what you need to know about the Shores, which advertises itself as the area's only 4-Star resort: Unlike any other 4-Star resort I have stayed at (and I have visited a few), the Shores allows locals to come in and use its facilities. Now, I am the most social of guys, but my egalitarian nature balks at having to compete with non-paying locals (the Shores is definitely not cheap) for a seat by the pool (a small pool, FYI), a seat at the tiki bar or space in the pool itself. To make matters worse, the hotel has no way of vetting (nor does it seem to care) who comes in its doors throughout the day or night. Throughout our stay there was a steady stream of locals coming and going. Many of them brought coolers of beer in with them and sat by yhe pool, happy as pigs at a trough, consuming alcohol all day. Nowhere does the 'resort' make this open access clear in its advertising or anywhere else. You just have to discover it for yourself, as my wife and children did on our last night as they sat by one of the fire pits (a nice feature) roasting marshmallows. Bombarded by a stream of offensive language directed at the bartender by a clearly intoxicated woman, my wife politiely stepped in (I was in our room or the following would have had a much different ending, quite possibly with the drunk in hospital and me in jail) and asked the woman to mind her language (the 'f' bomb was flying liberally) as there were children around the area. She was met with a foul invective as the drunk (it emerged she was a non-paying local) took none too kindly to being called to task for her foul mouth. Worse still was the fact my children had to see their mother treated this way. Security was nowhere to be seen and after my wife made a legitimate stink to the restaurant manager, the rowdy drunk and her two companions were asked to leave. I spoke with the manager about this unacceptable situation. She was kind enough to sympathize and reduced our bill by one night. However, our experience raised an important concern for would be guests at the Shores. This policy of allowing locals in with no 'quality control' is at best unfair and inconvenient to paying guests. At worst, it represents a major liability for the guests and the hotel. This place does not differentiate (or care) between who the paying guests are and locals. You need to know this before making a reservation. You may be fine with it. Not me, and we will not be back. In fact, had we known this before we made our reservation, we would not have stayed there. It is just not what I want or expect when staying at a supposed 4-Star resort. I told the manager this was disingenuous. Buyer beware! If you don't mind having to compete with non-paying locals, you will probably enjoy the Shores. Next time, we will make sure we ask the question "do you allow non-guests on property?' before we make a reservation. One last observation: We have stayed at several resorts. You should also know they charge a 'resort fee' on top of the room rate. It covers all the stuff (paper, pool towels, wi-fi) that many other places include in the room rate. Our experience at the Shores proves demonstrates there can be a vast difference between two resorts with the same rating. This one is definitely at the 'economy' end of the scale (not necessarily in price, though) of resorts.

Reviews.Title: “I'll come back”
Reviews.Author: JoanieZ
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night on July 14th and again one night on July 21st. The first experience on the 14th was far better than that on the 21st. I just read some of the (poor) reviews for this hotel. I did not experience those problems. Even though parking is across the street, valet parking is offered and is very convenient. The $7 charge is waived if you drive a hybrid (I do.) Check in on the 21st took longer than it should have. Our bedroom layout with 2 canapy beds provided an obstructed view of the large TV. The bed poles were in the center of the TV. The resort fee is supposed to allow for newspapers and robes. That did not happen. The fee was charged, but the amenities were absent. I found that a room with a balcony exceeds a room looking over a concrete surface with AC units. Children unsupervised were allowed in the hot tub. Too many kids in the hot tub. No fire was lit in the pits. There was a fire during my previous stay two weeks earlier. The tiki bar service, both food and drink was wonderful. When I checked out, my statement was incorrect. The hotel as well as priceline.com charged me for a night's stay. The hotel had to re-do my statement; they did so but with an attitude. The bell hop and valet guys were very friendly and helpful. They even offered to help while I waited at the check-in kiosk. If hotel pool towels are not permitted on the beach, who enforces that rule. I saw many, many wet, sandy, unattended pool towels clumped on the beach. The hotel areas were clean. Most of the staff was friendly and would go out of their way to offer assistance. I asked a housekeeper for a toothbrush and she went to another floor and found one. (I had called the front desk first, waited an hour or so, no response, ) so I walked down the hall and found a housekeeper. When I returned to my room several hours later, the "front desk" call had been heard and accomodated. Fresh soap, shampoo, toothpaste and toothbrush were waiting. I will go back to the Shores. I think it is a good value and a clean, safe hotel.

Reviews.Title: “COULDN'T FIND A THING WRONG”
Reviews.Author: dedwards41015
Reviews.Content: I think I am critical when it comes to the hotel rooms I stay in. This hotel was impecible. The room was as described on the website. The pictures were the same as the room I arrived in. check in was a breeze. Staff was always willing to help. Couldn't ask for anything more when it came to the fire pits, pool, hot tub and beach access. I reserved the room through priceline for $75. Got upgraded to ocean view because it was available.

Reviews.Title: “Elegant beach front”
Reviews.Author: TSC-Florida
Reviews.Content: Only stayed one night, but we would happily return for a longer stay. The beach behind the resort is gorgeous and is beach that cars can drive on. The hotels in this area sit up high above the beach and you have to take stairs down to the beach level. Up on the hotel level is a lovely pool deck area. The pool is fine, but not huge. There are lots of chairs around the pool and also several set up away from the pool with more privacy. I loved the chairs that were set up looking out over the beach. Also out on the pool deck are the fire pits that are lit at night. Each pit is surrounded by chairs and it was really nice at night with the breeze coming off the ocean to sit around the fire. The room was very nice. We had a lanai room (first floor) which means no balcony, but instead your room opens up onto the upper deck of the pool area. I loved having the easy access to the pool and the beach (could go right outside and did not have to take elevator in bathing suit.) Because the pool area is on a lower level, you have more privacy than it may sound. The room was nice size, we had a king bed, loveseat, arm chair, ottoman/coffee table, and a desk and chair. TV was a nice large plasma screen. Somewhat limited as to the channels offered, but the major ones were there as was HBO. The room was nicely decorated and everything seemed in pretty good repair. There was no tub in the bathroom, but the shower was great with super water pressure. Somewhat strange was the location of the closet. You had to go into the bathroom, and then close the bathroom door in order to open the closet door. The closet was really large, but somewhat akwardly located. Lobby is lovely as the photos demonstrate. We did not make reservations, and the restaurant was busy, so we went to "The Cellar" a lovely restaurant back on the mainland. Highly recommend The Cellar.

Reviews.Title: “We have loved staying here for twenty-five years!”
Reviews.Author: JohnandJudyFlorida
Reviews.Content: When I first moved to Florida from England, the hotel I was staying at, close to my new office, was quite literally being built around me. The staff was fantastic, and as one of the few guest, spoilt me with personal attention. The location was very convenient for business so I put up with the construction. But every weekend I could I would grab an overnight-bag and drive up to Daytona and check in to my favorite beachside Hilton – which is now The Shores. I got spoilt there too. Breakfast of Eggs Benedict with Buck’s Fizz (or Mimosa as I learned to call it) on the balcony watching and enjoying the sea. I was always given an Oceanside room, and took my family to stay there the first week the arrived. They loved it too – the rooms with the ocean filling the view, the pools, the Tiki Bar and restaurants – and, of course, the service. For nearly twenty five years then my family and I have been frequent guests at this hotel – even as gradually, over years, that vaulted service degraded, crumbled through lack of training and poor recruitment, then eventually – even as a Hilton – disappeared. Our last lunch in the restaurant just before the hotel changed hands was a Pizza – and we had to wait while it was delivered! When The Shores Resort and Spa opened were rather cautious about returning – it seemed expensive too. But the compliments and rumors of great service grew, so after an absence of nearly two years, we stopped in one weekend and dined there. By the end of that lunch we were booked into the hotel, our only luggage - a couple of those First Class ‘goody bags’ of toothbrush, eyeshades and a comb that used to be given out by airlines to their customers free of charge. (I felt I had better explain that bit of airline history!) We could not enjoy an Oceanside on that occasion, literally walking in off the street as we did, but we did enjoy the service. As you can see from all the accolades posted here, The Shores is a very special destination to most of its guests and it is obvious from the repeated comments on the staff and service teams what it is that makes The Shores special. The people. Oh..and the food! The Azure Restaurant tries very hard to be VERY fine dining and often succeeds – the staff has become very educated about the menu and, of course, the service is great. As other guests have commented The Shores has got to be the very best hotel in Daytona – and there is a lot of competition. We now even have the Hilton back, taking over the Adams Mark and creating a much more welcoming high service hotel. But we are now too brand-loyal to The Shores to stay anywhere else. Try it out – we have used the Spa, room service, restaurants, beachside dining, and had Laura and her great team in the pool area give us cheerful and friendly service when we use the Cabanas. We have tested everything over our visits and love going back. Any problems? Yes of course that is life, but they will be resolved – often by the empowered team members themselves. We think you will enjoy your stay because of this enthusiastic staff. Operations Director David Smiley run a tight ship!

Reviews.Title: “Anniversary Trip”
Reviews.Author: Ostroski
Reviews.Content: I was very nervous about booking a place I had never seen. WHen we pulled up we were welcomed and surprised that it was even better then the photos online. Everyone there is very pleasant, the room was wonderful, the dining room was awesome for dinner. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “perfect”
Reviews.Author: hairsay
Reviews.Content: Did not know what to expect we bid on priceline and had a terrific price!!!!! Hotel was one of the best we have ever stayed in. we travel frequently and like to stay in 4-5 star hotels. It was beautiful there staff was outstanding and could not be nicer. if you have any doubts about staying here please take my advise and stay here!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “unpleasant situation made pleasant...”
Reviews.Author: trsiny
Reviews.Content: Recently, we had to plan a quick trip down to the Daytona Beach area due to the unexpected death of a close relative. Needless to say, there was not a lot of time to plan the trip out. While booking our flight, noticed package deals with hotel and rental car. The Shores had many good reviews, so we decided to take a chance. Were we ever glad we did! The hotel was beautiful and clean...recently updated. Located right on the beach with a beautiful deck and pool area. It was not a trip we ever wanted to have to take, but the accomodations made the stay much easier. We were actually sad that our children were not with us! They would certainly have loved. We would definitely consider staying there, again, and bringing our family, as well.

Reviews.Title: “WHAT AN EXPERIENCE”
Reviews.Author: virginiabeachtravler
Reviews.Content: Highly recommended to all. This place was exceptional from begining to end. The Staff and Facilty well above what I expected. Rooms and entire facility was spotless. Great place to get away and relax.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the Rough, but Service Needs a Lift”
Reviews.Author: traveler949
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores recently and really enjoyed ourselves. I believe that this is, hands down, the best hotel in the area. It has everything that you would expect from an upscale beach resort in terms of pool area and beach access. I really liked how all of the outdoor activities are right outside the door. Many large resorts have all of the amenities spread out, but everything is really just steps from your room. Very nice pool area (with cabanas) and a nice beach. Azure, the restaurant, is really the only place to eat. Breakfast buffet (eggs seemed like powder, potatoes were bland) was sub-par, lunch was really good, and dinner was excellent. One thing to watch out for is the prices of food/drinks. I know that it's a resort, but we were charged $6 for a glass of orange juice, $2.75 for a small bottle of water, and $17 for a glass of average champagne. I think we'll stick with ice water next time! :) The rooms were really nice. Flat screen tv, spacious balcony, and really clean carpets, linens, bathrooms. Slow drain in the bathtub (I hate that), but everything else was great in terms of the room. As far as the service (and this is not something I usually care too much about), it was noticeably slow and inaccurate. Bar/restaurant service was just extremely slow. Servers seemed to forget things, needed to be asked 2 and 3 times for things like sweetener, drink refills, etc. Our server at dinner spilled a beer down my back when he was bringing the drink tray over (just an accident, but seemed to be par for the course). Despite the misses in this area, everyone was really nice and hard-working. They just seemed stretched pretty thin. Maybe they are understaffed for the summer. Regardless of that, I really enjoyed the stay there, would return, and would recommend it to others. I think that it's a wonderful facility with nice people. Maybe they just need a pep talk from management! P.S. Also loved that it is pet friendly...that is a big deal to us!

Reviews.Title: “We had a great stay.”
Reviews.Author: bobbystoney
Reviews.Content: This place was awesome. The location was great. Even had a little park right next to it for our daughter to play when she got tired of swimming. The only thing that was missing is that it would have been nice to have a microwave in the room.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED my Stay”
Reviews.Author: WORK4TRAVELVACATION
Reviews.Content: Was headed to Daytona beach for an outdoor tournament. I thought about being in the sun all day in 100 degree weather and decided that even though I was within driving distance from home I better look for a place to stay. I quickly found out that Daytona Beach Shores is not inexpensive. I called a few hotel/motels and decided that if I was going to have to pay in that range I would check into a resort I always wanted to visit (The Shores) and see what rates they were offering. I was VERY HAPPY when I heard it was in the same price range as the lower end places. I knew where I was staying! I made a great choice. I had an "ocean view " room with a balcony. The Bed was Heavenly!!! The location was great. The beach is excellent! Plenty of nightlife right at the resort...Miami Style seating/lounge pool area. I have a new love for Daytona Beach and I love this place. :)

Reviews.Title: “First impressions overshadowed entire trip”
Reviews.Author: Niki090
Reviews.Content: My husband and I booked 3 nights at this hotel as part of a romantic getaway for our anniversary. We were very excited and looked forward to seeing what this 4 diamond resort had to offer and had great expectations. We arrived at about 8:30 p.m. the first night and were greeted by a very friendly gentleman who opened my door and was a pleasure to talk to during check in. We were even given a free upgrade and were delighted! Within 5 minutes we had the keys to our room and I headed upstairs. We were exhausted so I turned down the bed while I waited for my husband to come up with our bags. It was then that I saw a shadow beneath the sheet, on the mattress cover. I lifted up the sheet and the mattress cover was horribly blood stained and slightly pee stained. I have stayed in all kinds of hotels in my life and have never been confronted with such a thing. I pulled the sheet back down and then noticed that the white blanket was blood stained too. I called housekeeping and they sent someone up right away. She was very apologetic and visibly shocked when she saw the condition of the bedding. She assured me that the staff is held to a very high standard and that things like this are not taken lightly. Still, it was quite a disappointment considering how much we were looking forward to this trip and the supposed caliber of the hotel. The room itself was beautiful, though the lamp on the right side of the bed did not work and the desk lamp flickered continously when turned on. These things are not typically a huge deal but I expected everything to be top notch at this place. The bed was comfortable and the layout was impressive. Our balcony overlooked the ocean and it was wonderful to wake up to the sound of the crashing waves. The main areas of the hotel seemed fairly clean and the lobby was beautiful. Staff was pleasant and courteous and always referred to us by our names whenever we spoke to them. Had we not had such an awful incident our first night, I would have rated this hotel 4 stars but dirty bedding at a 4 diamond hotel is unacceptable, even if everything else was ok.

Reviews.Title: “The customer service tide has gone out”
Reviews.Author: rryan3131
Reviews.Content: The Shores Resort has great potential. The property, while an older property has aged well. It has some very nice possibilities. Yet, with the current management staff in place, this "supposed" AAA four diamond property falls short of it's rating. Checkin with fairly well, only on person at the kiosk, so we had to wait for a couple of minutes. When we (wife and myself) got to our room, it was well appointed, byt upon reading the in-room directory, it said that Robes were in every room, and that newspapers would be delivered to the room each day. We did not have Robes in our room and did not receive a paper the next morning. Upon calling the operator and asking to speak to the General Manager, we were told that he was on vacation, and would we like to speak with the Rooms Division Manager? I asked to be connected to him, and of course, got his voice mail. I called the operator again and asked that he be located. 30 seconds later, David Smiley answered my call. I explained everything to Mr. Smiley, and his comments were that they had discontinued the newspaper delivery, so save costs (yet the still charge $15 resort fee, which free newspaper delivery is part of) and also told us that Robes were now available for rooms that pay a certain rate structure, but, because we were upset, he would have 2 Robes sent to our room. This is pretty much the level of service you will receive at the Shores. Complain about something loud enough, and they will fix it. They have really nice fire pits, at the pool area, however, in the 5 nights we were there, they were never cleaned. Cigarette butts laying in the pit, as well as around the seating area. They even raked the area, but NEVER picked up the butts. We asked Mr. Smiley why the cigarette butts were not picked up, and his response was, "Unfortunately we only pick up this area once a week." I guess it must have been one of the other two days of the week that we were not there. There we servers at the Tiki Bar area, that were supposed to wait on the guests at the pool, but they never did. They just sat and talked with friends. The staff at the desk would not address the guest first, you had to address them. You would get coffee in the morning at the lobby bar. One morning, four guests were waiting to get coffee, when a lady from the restaurant saw us waiting, and instead of asking us what she could do for us, she asked if we were just watching tv. Service like this happened throughout our stay. Finally, upon complaining to Mr. Smiley a second time, he deducted $50 off our bill.....way too little.....way too late.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, Fantastic, Luxury”
Reviews.Author: jmh72
Reviews.Content: My wife and i stayed at the daytona shores resort for one excellent night only as we were visiting my parents who live in Palm Coast. We left our 4yr old with them and headed for the hotel. After a bit of haggling we got an upgrade to a room with an outside balcony. I say balcony it was like an outdoor extension, it was fantastic it had room for 4 chairs 2 loungers. Room had a huge bathroom with rainfall shower and huge closet. Food in the resturant was excellent I had steak and my wife had chicken both meals were great. We will return next year for a longer visit.

Reviews.Title: “Nice room-not the best place for kids”
Reviews.Author: mariagrace
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores in June 2009 and loved many things about it. The room was a great size and the beds and pillows were extremely comfortable! The pool area was nice and the fire pits were a nice touch and a nice area for the family to sit around at night. The beach was very clean with soft sand and the water was clear as can be. The things that I did not like about the Shores was the fact that you have to pay a "service fee" of $15.00 for use of certain things whether you used them or not such as wi-fi, pool towels, etc. SInce I was traveling with children I also didn't appreciate it when we were approached by an employee when my daughter was sitting on a cabana and told about the prices for it if we wanted to rent it for the day!! I feel like a four star hotel should not be nickel and diming you since you have already paid so much for the hotel itself. If you are interested in being closer to the boardwalk, water park and movie theatres-stay at the Hilton, it is right in the heart of Daytona Beach. I am saying that I would not recommend this to a friend because my friends have children that they travel with and I just don't like the way that some of the employees behaved-a little too snooty for my family.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful, Relaxing, Pampered!”
Reviews.Author: rkujawa
Reviews.Content: This hotel was exactly how it looks online, not like some other places. We went with a group of friends and had a great time. The hotel is so clean and everyone we talked to wanted to help make our stay perfect. My husband and I found and researched this hotel for the group to go to and were worried we would let our friends down if it was not top notch so it was good to see that this hotel did not let our friends down. The Spa was beautiful and the staff was so professional and you could tell they really wanted to make sure there guest had the best experience ever.

Reviews.Title: “Decent but not great”
Reviews.Author: WallyJr
Reviews.Content: Spent one night at this hotel for a beach weekend. Was expecting more from the online description. Reserved an ocean front room with balcony. The room was available for early check in which was great. It was on the small side and the decor needs some updating. It also smelled like someone had smoked in it recently. The four poster bed is too big for the space and blocks the view of the TV if sitting on the couch. No HD feed either. The marble shower was showing some wear and seemed to be patched with caulk. The best feature was the balcony and views. The pool and lobby areas were very nice too. We did not use the resturants but they seemed to offer nice views and a choice of inside or out. For the area, this hotel seems to be on the high end of the spectrum price wise. And I would say it delivers to an extent. With some updating it would be there.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!”
Reviews.Author: Team_Funky
Reviews.Content: Holy Mackerel, this was a top-shelf hotel. I stayed jun 13-19th and LOVED this place. Every year me and a friend or two make a trip to florida to get in the water, walk the beaches and check out girls. And this is the best hotel I've ever stayed at to do these things. The Pool? Clean and nice. The outdoor fire pits? perfect for hanging out and getting to know people over the course of a few hours. The staff? cordial and friendly, always holding doors open and smiling at you. The spa? (I RECOMMEND! don't cheap out, get a massage!) After years of working out my back muscles lack....motion. The lady that did mine really worked out the kinks and made me feel great. The beds/pillows, all the most comfortable hotel sleep i've ever had. Room was clean, heck even the soaps and stuff in the bathroom were quality. the only possible things I could complain about, is it was hard to get the room REALLY cool; I had to sleep under only one blanket at night. This would have only been a problem if I brought a lady back to the room, but that sure didnt work out the way I wanted. The other complaint would be food/drink at the costs a lot more than it should. I would think those areas would get more business if the prices were lower. I did get room service one night, and the food wasn't bad, but again just more expensive than I would have liked. Me and my bud had a blast hanging out and getting to know people, I think this hotel would be great to bring your girl to (or hey ladies, bring us guys down) for a trip. I think its just a great all around place that isn't pigeonholed by any one thing (only for couples/only for families/etc) There wasn't a lot of kids around, which in a way was nice but If i was still a kid i wouldnt complain if I got to go! I used hotwire to book, and got a fantastic rate when i booked in feb. Last year i did the same thing and stayed at the plaza beach resort, also a 4-star hotel, both were under 100/night. which is 30-40 dollars a night cheaper than booking through expedia/hotels/etc.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely SUPER Fantastic! YOU MUST Stay HERE!”
Reviews.Author: Grizzly-on-Vacation
Reviews.Content: We bought a Bed & Breakfast package for 4 days. I Must tell you it was Money well spent! From the time we pulled in, until the time we left, we were pampered! If your looking to get off cheap this may not be for you. BUT, if you want value for your money then this is the place. The Breakfast is to DIE for! The staff is EXTREMELY friendly. The maid service IS by FAR the best I have ever seen. We found our room Spotless! EVERYDAY! My wife found the Swedish massage and aroma therapy truly relaxing, I scored BIG Big points for booking that amenity! The guys that run the Valet are superb! The cold bottles of water were a really nice touch when we left, we were sad to leave! The ONLY bad thing I can say about our stay at the resort was the HEAT! Outside I mean! Next time guys try dimming down that sun! LOL! While we were there it was HOT! VERY HOT! OUTSIDE! But while in the resort we were VERY comfortable! The AC worked GREAT! I don't write many reviews, and while I do watch my pennies THIS place was worth every dime! I can hardly wait to return to this resort, Although it will be in the winter! But then we are true northerners and love the cooler climate! I would and WILL recommend this hotel very highly to anyone visiting the coast of Florida!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: volfan061
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel - immaculate, very upscale, loved the valet parking and attention to detail. I would definitely recommend renting the cabanas - $49 per day versus $35 per day for two chairs and an umbrella on the beach.....Rooms were very nice and well kept - loved the rainfall shower!!! A little on the pricey side and no frig in the room so you are forced to eat out but I would definitely recommend this place!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “our second visit - very pleasant - off seasson great value”
Reviews.Author: babette50
Reviews.Content: our May 2009 stay featured room with same funky key west decor but this time upgraded to oceanfront with small balcony - great view, ocean breeze and lullabye - enjoyed cocktails at firepit lounge area near pool and ocean - nice breakfast on patio - out of the way of daytona beach decrepit scene

Reviews.Title: “Good overall value-easy place to stay at”
Reviews.Author: Tulsa_OKEztravel
Reviews.Content: The Shores was recommended by Florida locals who use it for weekend getaways. We were not dissapointed. It is an easy place to get comfortable in. You don't have to go offsite to find a good eatery but the are several good spots within easy driving. The beach access is is convenient and the pool patio comfortable. We would have liked earlier morning access to the pool. The attendant did his maintenance around 8:00 am. Food and serviceat the onsite restaurant were excellent. We'd go back any time.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed - too inconvenient and lacking too many things”
Reviews.Author: kmm2121
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a nice location and right on the beach. We chose to stay here based on high rating and the hotel's claim to be a top notch hotel. We booked a King bed room for a romantic beach weekend. Upon arrival we pulled up to the hotel, it took awhile for anyone to offer any assistance depite the pouring rain. Once inside I had to look around for the check in area as the employee at the small check in podium did not acknowledge me or direct me to her to check in. When I was directed to her to check in she informed me that there were no King bed rooms available, that they had been full for days. I informed her that I specifically booked a King bed room when I made my reservation over a month ago. She had a "that's too bad" attitude and just repeated that there were only rooms available with two double beds despite my reservation. Our room had a nasty view of the 2nd floor roof and A/C units. The self-parking area is across the street and then you have to walk over to the hotel. After driving to the self-park lot, the gate did not work twice when we swiped our room keycard. So we were inconvenieced by having to drive back up to the hotel and find someone to reset our room card to get the gate open TWICE. And you are charged a resort fee/parking fee for THIS type of parking?? The remote control to our TV did not work and had to be replaced. You are NOT ALLOWED to take the hotel pool towels down to the beach. We were going to bring our own until the hotel said it had towels for the guests to use as part of the Resort Fee. But alas we were stuck going to the beach with no towels since you are not allowed to take them away from the pool area. And the pool area is super crowded with way too many people for as small of a pool as they have. And an employee was dumping a large bag of powder chemicals into the pool while there were many people swimming in it!! Dangerous! Too many inconveniences and they try to charge you for things at every possible chance.

Reviews.Title: “Best getaway in a long time for us.”
Reviews.Author: patdonFlorida
Reviews.Content: Unlike other resorts where you might have to leave to find a good meal this is not that resort. Excellent food, impeccable service and an overall enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Resort Location”
Reviews.Author: dfrishe
Reviews.Content: Our family stayed here recently while my husband was in Daytona on business. My 11 year old daughter and I spent the days at the resort while my husband worked. She and I enjoyed the pool and beach all day and together as a family with my husband in the evenings. The staff was very attentive and the facilities were very nice. We had a king bed with pull-out sofa, river-view. Normally we would have booked an oceanview but my husband's employer was paying so we had to go with the least expensive rate. We found this perfect since we spent little time in the room. The bathrooms are a little small but there is a vanity table outside the bathroom. The room was the perfect size for all three of us. There is a DVD and LARGE tv. The pool is heated and salt-water. The kiddie pool is very small. The hot tub is very hot indeed. They have two outdoor fire pits which we found quite peaceful in the evening when we made Smores. Self-parking is across the street but is easily accessed by foot via a covered bridge. The $15 resort fee covers in-room wifi (spotty coverage), parking, pool towels, etc. The website states beach towels are provided but you are not supposed to take the pool towels to the beach. We did and no one stopped us or questioned us. I would recommend taking your own beach towels. We had the grilled cheese at the Tiki Bar for lunch (not the kiddie menu grilled cheese). As ordinary as a grilled cheese sounds, theirs was incredible. Grouper bites and chicken fingers were okay. Their fruit cup is wonderful. We ate at Bubba Gump's, Oyster Pub, and Caribbean Jack's. I highly recommend Caribbean Jack's. Bubba Gump's was good but the Oyster Pub I would not recommend. (See reviews of these restaurants under their listings.) Cow Licks is within walking distance for ice cream. It was delicious -- take cash as they do not take debit or credit cards. Overall, our experience was great and I would highly recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “By far the best choice in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: sasNc
Reviews.Content: All our friends rolled their eyes when we said we were going on vacation to Daytona Beach. We'd heard the reputation: touristy, party town and kind of trashy. The Shores does not fit this at all - it lived up to its 4 diamond rating. The staff was friendly and attentive. Our special requests were immediately taken care of. The room was meticulously clean with beautiful furnishings. The ocean view was perfect! The food was good, but a little expensive. If I ever return to Daytona Beach, this is the only place I would stay.

Reviews.Title: “Gourgeous Resort with very high quality ammenedies”
Reviews.Author: postalsandy
Reviews.Content: The Shores Hotel is right on Daytona Beach. Rooms: clean, spacious and gorgeous. On site 5 star resteraunt, indoor / outdoor dining. Very large pool / hot tub area. Cabanas close in for full privacy. Beautiful Tiki bar / dining by the pool is common. Extremely pleasant and friendly staff. Music / romantic fire pit.

Reviews.Title: “Why Stay Anywhere Else?”
Reviews.Author: stwalke2
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at this resort a few times including when it was a Hilton many years ago. One thing is for sure, this is the BEST hotel in Daytona Beach. I was out for a romantic weekend in Daytona (came from Virginia) and once again decided on this hotel. We thought we had booked a partial ocean King bed and I called to confirm this 7 hours before arrive (since we would arrive at midnight). When we got there the hotel was sold out but for an Ocean View with two beds or a River View with a King bed. This was a little annoying seeing as I confirmed and we ended up with a River View. Now if you read that and are thinking "so why did you love this hotel?" than read on because all hotels make mistakes but it is the ones that go above and beyond to make you happy that are fantastic. So we got to our room and crashed since we were tired and thought we would deal with our situation tomorrow. Well we got up and had breakfast at the hotel (expensive but good) and we ended up staying at the hotel the entire day. Why? Because it is beautiful. It is calming yet fun. You can start off with a walk on the beach followed by laying at the pool with a few drinks. Later on you can sit in the hot tub and dry off by the many fire pits they have. So around mid day we thought about it and decided that it doesn't matter what room we are in because we were sooo relaxed as is. We ended up saying nothing about to the staff and would just address our concerns later since I didn't want a change of room or anything discounted. Yes, the hotel was THAT calming on me. I could go on about the beauty of this hotel but let me talk about what happened when I left and was asked to give a survey via email. I'm always very critical in surveys because they help provide constructive feedback to those running the place. I wrote about my situation and stated a few other concerns I had. Within TEN MINUTES of submitting the survey the MANAGER called me up to discuss the survey. I told him about how we didn't want to address the problem at the hotel because we were having a good time and he understood. I also told him I didn't want anything for my troubles because we had a good stay. Well we talked for awhile and he agreed with some of my comments and gave me his personal email address so the next time I stay with his hotel he will book the hotel for me. I really can't describe the conversation I had with him but I was extremely satisfied with how well he listened and addressed my concerns. Not only that, but he recommended a hotel near where I live (and is not related to the hotel he currently works at). Crazy! So here is the bottom line, I had a MINOR problem and it was addressed above and beyond what I would say is needed for "great service". Furthermore the hotel is the best, most relaxing yet fun hotel in Daytona Beach. My only recommendation now is for some lower prices on the drinks which are high even for a nice hotel. There may be some reasons I don't know that cause this, but lots of folks I met ended up bringing their own drinks (bought from the grocery stores) ha! So just book your hotel here. I will again and, in fact, I am looking at having a wedding there! Keep up the good work guys!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Fantastic!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: monster3526
Reviews.Content: This will have been the second time that my mother and I have stayed at the resort for a girl's weekend, and all I can say is that it gets better every time. We arrived there on a thursday afternoon and were immediately greeted by a friendly valet who helped us with our luggage and showed us inside. The young lady checking us in couldn't have been more friendlier. The check in process took about 3 minutes and she showed us to our room. We chose the Ocean Front Lanai room. I will tell you that you should most definitly splurge for this room. It is fantastic !!! Also try and ask for room 120, it is the last room on the first floor. It is the best room. It is away from everything so you can relax without all the noise. The tiki bar is open and if you lay out by the pool make sure you ask for Scott. He was our server the entire time that we were there. He is Fantastic. We never had an empty cup. He really pampered us and made us feel like we were the only ones there. The restaurant there is Fabulous as well as the spa. if you get a hot stone massage make sure you ask for Angela. She is great at what she does. We had such a great time and look forward to coming back in August.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful relaxing hotel”
Reviews.Author: nursesar
Reviews.Content: I won this hotel with a Priceline bid and could not have been happier. We were given a river view room, but it was wonderful. It had a balconey, canopy bed, large flat screen TV, great shower head, and refrigerator. We did not use any of the spa or restaurant services, but those are rather pricey. There is a $15 a night resort fee. The bed was WONDERFUL, so comfortable (down comforter, mattress pad, and pillows). This was probably the most comfortable hotel bed I've experienced. Just a wonderful relaxing room. The hotel is right on the beach. They have "campfires" on the pool deck at night. You can rental beach equipment/beach bikes right on the beach in front of the hotel. I highly recommend this hotel. Only down side I experienced is that there aren't any restaurants really close to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with great amenities”
Reviews.Author: Stellahellah
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for Mother's Day and had a wonderful time. The rooms are beautifully decorated and larger than average and extremely quiet. We loved the teddy bears! Here are a few notes: Wireless Internet is free. The resort charges a $15/day "resort fee" and that includes internet and self-parking across the street. The parking is no big deal and the overpass is well-designed. There are also computers available for complimentary use in the lobby and check-in area. We weren't told about the internet or the computers, so make sure you take advantage if you want to. My only complaint about the room we had was that there weren't any blackout curtains and it was BRIGHT and HOT once the sun came up. We stayed in a river-view room, so that may not be true for other rooms. The pool and hot tub are wonderful. Nice and warm and the pool is very large. The tiki bar is fun to hang out at. The pool has an ocean view... stunning. The previous reviewer mentioned a local restaurant, Our Deck Down Under. We also went there and had a fantastic meal of fresh seafood and cold beer at a very reasonable price. Hotel is great, staff is wonderful.... a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Divine!!!”
Reviews.Author: bebebets
Reviews.Content: The hotel is impeccable, the staff is friendly and very accomodating! We went for the weekend and didn't want to leave! Every little detail was thought of. We had an oceanfront room which had a spectacular view of the pool area and beach! The spa toiletries & spa robes are decadent! Love the decor in the room ! The bed was absolutely delicious! It was top of the line comfort. They really paid attention to all those small details that makes you feel right at home! The comfortable bed linens, the big screen tv, the snacks in the fridge (healthy ones too!), the mini bar, the extra pillows and blankets! The pull out couch was just as comfortable! My teenage son loved the ipod docking station as well as the fitness room. The pool area is divine, nicely layed out, it makes you feel relaxed. There are many little smaller areas such as the fire pits where you can gather with a group or for more private fun, they have wonderful cabanas. The salt water pool was marvelous! There are great little areas for toddlers too! The tiki bar was great to go to at night and nice ambience with great soothing music. It is a great place for couples to be romantic as well as lots of fun for the entire family. Next time I go I will visit the spa. We really didn't have time to enjoy all the amenities, but whether you're there to relax and just sit on the beach or the pool or enjoy the town and all it has to offer, this is the perfect place. It feels like home, but better because you feel pampered because everyone treats you like a VIP! We absolutely would highly recommend this hotel! If you're in Daytona Beach, it's the best place to stay! They earned their Four Stars!!! However, I would rate it five stars!!!

Reviews.Title: “Better this time”
Reviews.Author: savannahpeach
Reviews.Content: My second stay in 30 days at the Shores. Both were business trips, first stay not so good, spoke to Mr. Smiley the manager about problems and he was very concerned and offered me a discounted stay for personal stay if I wished. I declined, but did call him when I knew I was returning again on business and I was provided with an ocean front room with balcony. My only issues were the hair dryer did not work and I did not have time to call for another when getting ready for my business reception. Luckily I have wash and go hair, (maybe house keeping should check out worling order when cleaning room),second issue was I was charged for valet parking for a car that I did not drive, I car pooled with another guest. But it was taken off my bill without problem. I love the beds, ocean front is the way to go, if you get a balcony, some rooms don't have them. Due to price of hotel, I would not stay here if not for business, but overall it is a very nice hotel compared to other hotels in Daytona, there is not a lot to pick from.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Hotel, Nice Staff - a few disappointments”
Reviews.Author: Romjester
Reviews.Content: I found most of the staff to be very friendly and the hotel was nice. Keep in mind they charge a $15 resort fee. I was in a room on the third floor which did not have a balcony and overlooked the roof with very limited few of the ocean. Requested to be upgraded but was sold out the first three nights and was told a surcharge to upgrade for the last night. The room had double beds which my feet hung over the ends. I was there over the weekend and due to the hotel being next to a drive on the beach entrance on one side and a public park on the other, the beach was quite crowded and the umbrella vendor took over the entire beach in front of the hotel. They charge for the USA Today but do not place it outside your room. You have to pick it up off a table by the lobby. I mentioned this at checkout and the clerk was nice enough to refund one day's resort fee. Additionally, self parking is across the street and they only have one luggage cart so will not let you use it without taking advantage of a bell hop.

Reviews.Title: “Would return again”
Reviews.Author: The_Dylaness
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for one unexpected night after leaving our previous hotel that we were very unsatisfied with. We won a room on Priceline- as expected we didn't get the greatest view but that is understandable and not a problem given our booking method. The lobby is really lovely and check-in was a breeze. Valet is available but since we were going in and out a lot (we were in DB for personal business, not vacation) we self-parked across the street (included in the somewhat silly $15 "resort fee". Just raise the price of the hotel, really!) Room was spacious, had a small fridge and coffee maker and two very comfy queen beds. Temp was easy to control. We visited the pool area for a brief while... jacuzzi had an awful lot of dead bugs in it but the overall area is very lovely and perhaps this was a temporary issue? We would consider booking a poolfront room on the first floor if we stayed here again for vacation as it would be so convenient. Our main dislike about this hotel was the fact that the restaurant, while appearing lovely, was really quite expensive even for such a hotel. (We did not eat there but looked at the menu.) Easy-to-find options nearby are few.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, but might suggest a few changes”
Reviews.Author: Luvlife
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our two daughters (5 and 9) to Daytona for spring break, April 5-9. While the hotel was very nice, I have to agree with the others who said the "extras" made it a little too pricey. The drinks at the Tiki Bar were $9 on average, with beer being around $5 I believe. For me, $9 for a mixed drink is just too much. It was also nearly impossible to get lounge chairs, in the sun, on the pool deck. I'm not sure how it would be policed, but offering chairs on the beach (at no charge) would be a nice perk. I know that would be difficult as it is a public beach, but I'm guessing if they had one staff person on the beach monitoring the chairs/tables, it would be pretty easy to control. One more complaint is the ice machine on the 10th floor didn't work the entire time we were there (4 nights). It wasn't a major deal because the machine on the 9th floor worked, but just a little inconvenient and frustrating that in 4 days, they never fixed it. A four star hotel shouldn't have those types of glitches. As for the room - ours was very nice. Personally, I LOVED the showers - great water pressure and a shower head that extended to be positioned directly over your head, pointing straight down on you. The bed was wonderful - probably the softest and most comfortable I have ever slept on. The front desk staff and valet staff were always very friendly with a "hello" when we returned to the hotel. One of the front desk staff, Mr. Smiley, was outstanding. He was at the desk the day we checked in and then had the next two days off. We saw him again the day we left and he remembered who we were and talked to us about the same things we talked about the day we checked in. I thought that was impressive as I know these people see tons of guests coming and going every day. Overall, it was a very nice hotel with great staff. There are just a few changes I would like to see them make.

Reviews.Title: “Overall clean and friendly.”
Reviews.Author: angsan74
Reviews.Content: I would stay at this hotel again.I only had two problems with the hotel. I guess now you get charged a "convience fee" at most hotels. This is supposed to cover the internet, coffee in the room, and newspaper. I don't think it should be 15 bucks a day. Maybe at the most 5 bucks.The other problem is the location of the pool. After about 2pm you loose the sun over the pool. I guess that isn't a major problem. IF you have kids swimming u can't move to another location on the deck. There is no life guard.Other than those two minor things a beautiful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but....”
Reviews.Author: naplesm0m
Reviews.Content: Everything is nice about this hotel. It was very clean, the pool area was large and nice. But even though this hotel is on the beach, this is not a beach hotel. They will not let you take towels onto the beach, and they do not have beach chairs and umbrellas for guest use. For the price they are charging and the fact that they are ON THE BEACH this was a little disappointing. Also, the chickee bar outside closes very early - much before sunset. Otherwise this hotel was great.

Reviews.Title: “The staff at this resort are the definition of great customer service!”
Reviews.Author: Quality_travels
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is very nice; lovely rooms, great pool area with Tiki bar and fire pits. But where the Shores really shines is their people. Everyone was geniunely nice, polite, helpful and you could tell they loved working there. It was also very evident they all like each other. One of the best things about their staff is they are all empowered to take care of customers. My best friend and I were there for their 'girlfirends weekend getaway' which included among other things 2 free Spatinis. The only thing was no one knew what a Spatini was - other than a drink. It was very funny not the least bit annoying. And we ended up going back to the spa to ask and they didn't know either, but promptly called the bar and ordered us 2 drinks to be billed to the spa. The servers would come by our table just to say hi. I highly recommend this resort to anyone who wants to feel special and have a great time!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!! Would go back....”
Reviews.Author: Mjs61084
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and I just got home from a trip to Daytona at the Shores! We couldn't have been happier....we are 23 and 24, on my college spring break. We didn't want to be around all the people partying, so we chose not to stay in the middle of all of it! We were so happy to have found The Shores. I booked the vacation and we were in a river view room without a balcony, and at check in I asked if we could pay to upgrade to a balcony. I was told they didn't have any balconies available, but that he could upgrade us to ocean front without a balcony, which was still better than river view. When we walked into our room, to our surprise, we had a balcony and oceanfront!! We were very pleased with the service we received. At one point we were walking up the drive and the person valet parking a car was driving down the drive. He seen us coming up, backed the car back up the drive that he was parking and got out and opened the door to the hotel for us! If that's not five star service, I don't know what is. The housekeepers also came to our room at 2, 3, 4 in the afternoon. If they hadn't been there in the morning, because the DND sign was hanging, someone ALWAYS came back late in the day to tidy up the room. The shores is down the strip from all of the "main" hotels in daytona, maybe about three miles, but if you're not wanting to be in the middle of everything, yet close it's a great place to stay! The only complaint we had was the way the showers were set up water always leaked all over the floor, so we had to lay a couple of towels down to contain it. Not a big deal, just an annoyance. It wouldn't stop me from going there again....I've seen a complain or two about having to park across the street, and I'm going to comment that it's a gated parking lot, that isn't crowded, and there is a covered bridge above the traffic so there is no waiting for cars to go by. If I go to Daytona I will be at The Shores again, these people bend over backwards to make for a very pleasurable stay....

Reviews.Title: “Overall, a quality experience in every regard!”
Reviews.Author: Elisdad996
Reviews.Content: The service at the resort was exceptional and the rooms were very nice as well. The bed was like sleeping in the clouds. The resort is right on the beach and has some ground floor rooms which have direct access to the pool area. Our dining experience at the resort was very good. Dinner at the restaurant "Azure" was excellent, lunch at the bar was equally as good. Breakfast at "Azure" was also very good. My only bad experience was lunch at the pool / Tiki bar were our table service was slow and sporadic, although the food and drinks were very enjoyable. I was somewhat able to overlook this because it was a pretty busy Saturday afternoon and I think our waitperson may have been new and a little overwhelmed.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: RhondaP
Reviews.Content: A 3 night stay at the Shores Resort & Spa proved to be excellent. The service, room and location is great. The resturant has gourmet food and might be a little too high dollar for familes, but I did enjoy the lunches I had. This resort lives up to it's high standards, but they are going to have to start doing maintence to keep it this way. The hot tub wasn't working and there were several areas that needed painting outside. The location of this resort is perfect for getting away, but it can get pricey when you add in the extras..cabana beds have to be reserved and rented, the beach only has rental chairs and unbrellas. So if you want a great place to wind down and just enjoy a bit of relaxation this is.

Reviews.Title: “Another "great" stay ...”
Reviews.Author: SuggieFl
Reviews.Content: We were here at THE SHORES in July of 2008; a two night weekend in a King Oceanfront with Balcony. Just stayed for another two night weekend, March of 2009; King Oceanfront with Balcony, again. Always a pleasure; great manager, great staff, very nice accommodations. Yes, a bit on the "pricey" side, but a class hotel, with a class act; you get what you pay for!

Reviews.Title: “What a First-Class Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ddonna500ss
Reviews.Content: We checked in Fri 2/27. Booked trip through Orbitz, Oceanview Room. Called hotel to confirm reservation, they confirmed Oceanview Room, king bed, balcony. Got to hotel a little early and room was available. Unfortunately upon entering room, we did not have a balcony. Dylan, our bellman, took care of this very graciously and suggested we relax and get a cocktail out at the tiki bar while he solved the problem. Within 10 minutes, he returned to us. As promised, he took care of changing the room so that we had a balcony. Everything at this hotel is first-rate. You cannot hear anything when you are in your room with the doors closed. Beach is awesome, very clean. Tiki Bar serves great drinks, delicious lunch. Azure dinner was truly delicious, a little pricey but well worth the money. The indoor lounge area is very relaxing and comfortable. Did not use the pool, but it looked very inviting. Breakfast in the morning outside in the FL sun was heaven! Fire pits at night are a great addition to this resort.

Reviews.Title: “Bike celebration”
Reviews.Author: TonyKris
Reviews.Content: The room was very clean. They have spa charge. even if you do not use the spa services.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: cqusa07
Reviews.Content: We booked on Priceline for 3 nights at a great price and extended our stay directly with the hotel because we were having such a good time. We had a ocean front room, it was great. The bed was comfortable, the room was quiet (no listening to shouting people and banging doors). The food in the hotel was so good (well worth the extra $). We went in the hot tub every night under the stars, listening to the waves and sat by the fire pits to dry off. We walked the beach, fed the seagulls, had great food and lots of wine. We were so relaxed that we did not want to go back home to the kids, dogs, cats and work. We will be back soon. This is not the fanciest hotel we have stayed in but by far the best. The staff were brilliant (no obnoxiousness here) Loved it, loved it. loved it. (The only downfall was the snoring husband)

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed”
Reviews.Author: SewnSewNewBrunswick
Reviews.Content: The staff here was great! The Manager even wrapped my wrist for me after I had taken a fall in the Logan Airport. The Resort sent a shuttle to pick us up and I'll never forget the driver. He was so nice ...

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel! Amaaazing hotel restuarant”
Reviews.Author: amandaOmaha
Reviews.Content: We had a great stay at the Shores! We booked our room through lastminutetravel.com and got our room, including taxes for only $153. We we arrived I was pleasantly surprised to find the room was airy and tastefully decorated, and most importantly clean! The hotel backs up to the beach where there is a tiki bar, fire pit, hot tub, pool, and even areas for couples to lounge together. By far my favorite part of staying in this hotel was the restaurant inside the resort. For both my boyfriend and I this was one of the best meals either of us have ever eaten. Compliments to the chef! I wish we had this restaurant in my town because I'd go there all the time. Overall a great hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Top notch hotel”
Reviews.Author: modem77
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 3 day stay at the Shores and it was a very nice experience. All the staff there were very attentive and I feel like I was a VIP. I originally booked it through Hotels.com for a river view room. Upon arriving around noon, my room was available. I then asked if I can check out the ocean view room to see what it's like and it's much better as the bathroom was much bigger and nothing beats stepping onto the balcony and looking out onto the ocean. I paid the extra for the upgrade to ocean front and it was well worth it. You can hear the ocean waves coming in and watch the beach all day long. The bed was the most comfortable I've stayed in. There were so many pillows that makes you not want to get out of bed nor the room. The pool area was great as beach towels are provided. I was told the outdoor swimming pool is heated but didn't get into it. There's a small kiddie pool, two fire pits & a hot jacuzzi. You can relax on the pool deck or go out onto the beach. There's a code to get back onto the pool deck so it's good to keep the non-hotel residents out. There's Publix (grocery store) 1 mile south on A1A. Parking across the hotel is free and there's a pedestrian overpass so you don't have to worry about crossing the street. Valet parking is available for $7/day as well. This is definitely the NICEST hotel in Daytona Beach. The only regret was that it was time to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous and Classy”
Reviews.Author: AomWam
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a week at the Shores Resort & Spa in Daytona Beach. The hotel was magnificent and we experienced incredible service. The rooms are beautifully decorated - and we certainly enjoyed the luxury and experience of a canopy bed, with mattresses that made you feel that you could spend the day in bed with no trouble. Magnificent view of Daytona Beach itself - with the convenience of a pool and hot tub at the resort. Great menus, accommodations and friendly, courteous staff made our stay very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Phenomenal”
Reviews.Author: on-the-journey
Reviews.Content: This property is among the finest I have ever stayed in. The staff is first rate, food services wonderful, and the entire property is in perfect shape Room was very large, balcony was a bonus (not all rooms have balconies). Location is right on a beautiful beach, a bit outside Daytona Beach proper. Plenty of shopping and dining in the area. Choosing The Shores is a 'can't miss' decision!!

Reviews.Title: “Totally relaxing”
Reviews.Author: skyyse
Reviews.Content: I booked a room just for 1 night to get away and celebrate my birthday. It was a great experience from the moment I made my reservation til the moment I left. My boyfriend and I could not get enough. They even sent me chocholate coverd strawberries to the room as a birhtday gift. Everyone that works there was friendly and eager to help in anyway the could. I absolutly love it. This is the best hotel in Daytona Beach.

Reviews.Title: “Never Again!!!”
Reviews.Author: MrsJohnson2B
Reviews.Content: I was not pleased with my stay at the Shores Resort and Spa. First of all, I was not pleased with my room and when I requested to have the room changed, I was told that someone would call me back. Unfortunately, no one ever did. Then, I was not happy that you had to park across the street and was charged $5 a day for that. The location of the hotel was at least 3 miles away from anything and the hotel staff did not make you feel welcomed. I will not ever stay there again, nor would I have my worst enemy stay there, it was that bad of an experience. I wished I had chosen to stay at the Wyndham like I had planned on to begin with. This was the worst resort that I have ever stayed at.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected luxury at great price”
Reviews.Author: Mindwanderer
Reviews.Content: This hotel has great value. For 1/3 of the price of a Four Seasons or a Ritz Carlton you get very similar quality (not quite the same but almost) - with lovely sheets and large comfortable bed, a large bathroom with walk in shower (but no tub), a balcony, a 42 inch plasma TV and DVD player, and good food on site. I stayed here one night for a local business meeting and was very pleased with the ocean views, the room service food, and the quality of the furnishings. My biggest problem was that water in the walk-in shower liked to run along the ledge and out into the bathroom - which required the use of two towels to soak up. Loved the Molton Brown bath accessories. Overall a great value and likely the most luxurious choice in the Daytona vicinity.

Reviews.Title: “AWESOME stay”
Reviews.Author: ga2rgirl65
Reviews.Content: Me and my husband celebrated our anniversary at the Shores Resort over the weekend of Sept.6. We only live an hour away so it was an easy get away for us. All I can say is "WOW"!!!. We were given an upgraded room which was totally unexpected. This seems to happen to other people all the time, but never to us! We had a fabulous dinner at Bubba Gumps, and attended a show at the band shell.Upon returning to our hotel room, we were greeted with a beautiful plate of chocolate covered strawberries and a bottle of champagne compliments of the hotel! We were stunned at the thoughtfulness! All of the staff we encountered were very friendly. In fact, the last time we stayed at a hotel with such friendly staff was in Charleston S.C.! The hotel was absolutely beautiful and looked much nicer than anything else we saw in the area. The rooms were different from standard hotel rooms in that they displayed a beach theme. The bed was very comfortable, as well. Many thanks to the Shores staff for making our stay so wonderful!!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Service”
Reviews.Author: hhaywood
Reviews.Content: Stayed two nights here on our way from Georgia to Miami. Called the hotel directly and got a much better rate than that listed on their own website. Loved the resort!! From the friendly valet attendant, to the friendly check-in attendant to the friendly cleaning staff, to the friendly room service staff....all the staff were charming, professional and friendly!! The hotel has a charming lobby and a restaurant with a great view of the beach 5 feet away. On the patio there is a fire pit they light at night so you can have a drink by the fire and watch the sun set over the Atlantic. The room was decorated attractively, the huge high king bed was extremely comfortable, the shower was great! Flat screen TV, wifi service, great ocean views. I had a facial in the spa that was absolutely the best one I've ever had....even in much pricier establishments!! I cannot say enough good things about the Shores Resort and I can't wait till my next trip to Florida because I certainly will stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Very first class..”
Reviews.Author: PitBullLover
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous property! I could compare it to some of the best that I have stayed. Now I will say reading the reviews, I probably should have gotten a rate under $100 like the rest on hotwire/priceline etc. I just compared hotels.com to their own website, both were $111 per night, so I booked on the Shore's website. With taxes and resort fee it came to about $140 a night, which I dont mind paying, but if some people dont pay this resort fee, I feel that is unfair. I used the towels, parking and internet which the resort fee covers. We ate at Azure the restaurant 2 times. We actually never sat in the Azure 'secton' . The first night off the plane we grabbed a bite to eat outside while a guy played the guitar. He was great and he played a great selection of music. He was very courteous and let my boyfriend hook up his computer to send a report for work. The food was a touch pricey, but only by $2-3 per entree. What you expect in a tourist area. The next time we at at Azure we had breakfast and it was WONDERFUL. We had the scrambled eggs with bacon and cheese in them!! Delicious and again only about $2 more than normal.
