I actually got ice water from the Tiki Bar several times and the staff was super-nice and gave me the water without any qualms since it was Free. The rooms were wonderful. Great size, great comfy bed, nice view on the intercoastal, didnt want to pay the $60 upgrade for oceanfront. Nice flatscreen TV. Great toiletries..nice high end products. Nicely decorated, very classy-beachy, not cheesy-beachy. Pool Deck was great. Tons of little kids in the pool, but we could sit on the other side of the the Tiki Bar and enjoy peace and quiet. Now the music they played was horrible. It was like Adult Contemporary/Motivational/Inspiration Music. They claim they are doing the 'south beach' feeling, but if so the music needed to be updated to house, instrumental or even beachy music. I had to use my IPod to keep my sanity it was that bad. Towels were ample and the spa (hot-tub) was very nice. We never used the fire pits, but if we had time we would have used them. Never went to the Spa, WAY overpriced, about $150 for mani-pedi, that I pay $35 for at home, maybe $80 in a spa. But not a problem, bc I didnt come down to FL for that... Service was beyond excellent, extremely friendly staff!!! Cant say one single bad thing from the check in staff, to valet guys, to wait staff...perfect! Oh and the pictures on the website are exactly what it looks like, not misleading at all!!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it! Top Notch!”
Reviews.Author: Gracetanner
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the shores for 4 days this last week. This is a gorgeous property, and I was extremely happy with our stay. Being the critical traveler that I am, I consciously looked for things that weren't up to par for a 4 star resort. I found none. This was top notch in my book. I booked our stay through hotwire, and got a wonderful rate of $74 dollars a night. After reading other positive reviews, and also noting that the Shores is the only 4 diamond resort in Daytona, I was sure I got a great deal,and now, I am positive we did. Also, I have to note, we were not charged the $15 resort fee noted in some other reviews. We parked in the free parking across the street, and received coffee and the paper for no additional charge. The resort is located conveniently in Daytona Beach Shores, right on the A1A. The area surrounding the resort is less seedy than some other areas in Daytona. The hotel itself was very attractive on the outside and as we pulled up to the front, I was already impressed with the drive under. It was very elegant. Immediately, the service was excellent, as our doors were opened for us, and we were helped out of the car by 2 very attentive bell hops. As we entered the lobby, I continued to be impressed with the beautiful decor, and elegant fountains. As other reviewers have stated, the check in process is a little different, as there is no "front desk", but rather podiums that the service "ambassadors" stand at. Our "ambassador" was very helpful and polite. I told her that since I booked on hotwire I was sure we didn't have beach front or ocean view. I asked if she could check on upgrade prices. She checked for me, and the difference was $60 a night. She assured me however that the view from the 9th floor of the intercoastal waterway was breathtaking at sunset, so we opted to stay where we were. I asked her if there was a balcony on our room, and there was not. She quickly did a search and changed us to a room with a private balcony. I was happy with that. The room itself was huge. We had a king bed, one of the most comfortable beds I have ever slept on, ever. We also had a pull out sofa and really, the mattress on that wasn't shabby. Much better than some I've seen. The view was great, though it made me nervous being up that high. The girls that cleaned our rooms were very nice and prompt. One morning we ordered breakfast in.The gentleman that delivered it was a delight. Our kids loved the shores, although I do agree with the previous reviewer that stated that this would be a very nice resort for a couple and I thought it would be nice for a girlfriend getaway as well. The pool area was really beautiful. The water was always warm and the pool wasn't overly crowded. I liked the atmosphere of the pool area. Very tropical. On the last night we were there, there was a live band. If we were sans children, it would have made an enjoyable night, relaxing by the ocean and listening to the band. The beach right in front of the shores was quiet. I had many reservations about the beach being "drivable", since my children are young. I was worried about having to watch them in the water, and also worry about them running into traffic. Where I can see this actually being a problem further down the beach where the traffic lanes are closer to the water, it really shouldn't be a concern on the area of beach where the Shores is located. The traffic lanes are far up and there is a degree of separation between where you play and where the traffic is. A note about the service at the shores: we felt they went above and beyond for us, more than once. We bought a stroller at a local wal-mart because we left home without one, and it needed assembly. One of the bell boys and a service ambassador helped us quickly with some tools we needed to get the job done. Every employee we encountered spoke to my children, and that wins me over in a heart beat. The only negative I can speak of is the same thing you get with any 4 star resort. The price of the food, the mini bar, the drinks were high. But not more than expected. We went to wal-mart and stocked up on snacks, waters, and juice boxes for the kids. Oh, and one other thing-- I felt room service menu, the one they offer for late nights was kind of skimpy. And expensive. All in all, we loved our stay at the Shores. It was great. And if we go back to Daytona, we will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay on a priceline room”
Reviews.Author: familytraveler013
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel by bidding on a priceline auction for $76--for that price, even with the $15 resort free, it was terrific! The pool is a little small but lots of kids which was good for us--since we had two little ones--they have a splash area and a tiny kids pool. We made smores in the evening near the fire pits--the room was very nice, queen sleeper, king canopy, and pack and play all fit nicely--we ate at azure the first night --$140 bill, good food, but wish the hotel had a casual restaurant as well. The kids menu was a little expensive--$15 for some entrees on the kids menu. We ate at the top of daytona which is next door--and the kids enjoyed seeing the view from the 28th floor--they have a happy hour and early birds specials 4-6 pm. We also went to downtown daytona for lunch-the beach here was nice but we spent most of the time by the pool. Very good value for priceline rooms!

Reviews.Title: “Book this hotel on hotwire.com. It is beautiful hotel. Great post-cruise hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Momdemac
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores for two nights on July 24 and July 25. I booked this hotel on hotwire. It was listed as a four star in Daytona Shores. We paid $89 a night. Hotwire quoted $206. We were notified that there may be resort fees. The Shores charged an additional $15 a night for "resort fees." When I asked what was included in the resort fee, I was told the parking, the newspaper, the coffee in my room, and access to the fitness room. It seemed like a flimsy fee. So please factor that into your consideration when booking this hotel. We just left Port Canaveral that morning from a cruise. It is about an hour away. The hotel room was huge. We were thrilled with the size. My husband and I thought the beds were full size. They were large canopy beds. They were extremely comfortable with great thread count. We had 2 adults and 2 children. When we entered the room there were two stuffed bears on the bed. There is a little paragraph written in the hotel manual ( who reads these things) that said if you take the bear you will be charged afterward. When my children asked the bell boy about whether or not they could keep the bear, he said he wasn't sure but he thinks we need to purchase it in the gift shop. I felt this was wrong to put this in a room with kids and then tell us to pay for them. There were no price tags on the two bears in our room. I felt it was deceiving. The hotel itself is beautiful. It has great access to the beach and a nice pool. We were able to sit by the pool and let the kids run around the beach. The rooms are very large. This was great after being on a cruise for 4 days. There is a DVD player in the room which was great for the kids. The restaurant was scenic being located outside. Although we did not use the spa, there seemed to be a lot of choices in services. We did not eat at the restaurant. The prices were ridiculous for a family to eat. They recommended a great pizza place called Genovese. We did have a pitcher of margaritas and it was $48. There are no prices posted or anything. The bar service was slow. We ordered virgin drinks for the kids and it took a long time for the kids to get their drinks. Within a couple of miles there is an IHOP, Denny's, Burger King, and grocery store if you are looking for Breakfast food. The parking for the hotel was located across the street. That was included in the resort fee. They try to push the valet parking for $7 a day in addition to the $15 that you are already paying. The location of the hotel is in between the activity. Daytona is North of the Shores. The Hilton seemed to be the place to be there if you have a family. They had a Johnny Rockets and a Bubba Gump attached to the hotel and a Dunkin Donuts across the street. Everything is in walking distance in case you don't have a car. South of the hotel are a variety of newer and older hotels. We found ourselves driving to get food. We did get miss-billed the last day. We were at a friend's house all day and got charged and additional $60 for a turkey club and a drink. Somehow it was billed to our room. I called down to the front desk and they said they would send me an adjusted bill. I finished packing the room and by the time I got downstairs they still had not adjusted my bill and sent me the new copy. They said they could not find the signed receipts from the meal. I said that is because we never ate there. They did adjust it and printed out a new copy with the new final price. Things I like about this hotel: -location on the beach...it seemed very isolated -quietness ( but we did have loud neighbors our last night) -beauty of the hotel -the huge rooms Things I am not sure about this hotel: -additional resort fees. Hampton Inn gives you your paper for free and doesn't say the fees are to pay for your coffee in your room. -the bear scam with the children -distance to other restaurants -turn down service ( she came by the first night, but didn't come by the second?...if she did we didn't notice) I would recommend this hotel for an adult getaway. If two adults don't want to leave the place and really relax, this is the place. You can enjoy gourmet food ( my local friend says that the buzz on the restaurant is that it is fantastic), my spa services and options, and relaxing by the pool or beach with a great beverage. If you have kids, it can be a bit more challenging. The size of the room is great for 4 people. It is way larger than a standard hotel room. There is the DVD player in the room. The food is very expensive and we didn't want to waste the money on the children. We were able to let the kids run around on beach while we watched for the pool deck. We didn't spend a lot of time in our room. We visited with our friends. I would consider this for a post-cruise hotel. Large room and very relaxing. If we lived closer, I would look at this place for some adult time with my husband.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Shores and Daytona.”
Reviews.Author: fordescape11
Reviews.Content: First time to Daytona Beach and had a great relaxing time. The Shores was absolutely beautiful. We arrived a few hours early to the hotel but they let us check in anyways and were very quick and friendly about it. After a 14 hour drive all we wanted was a bed and some sleep. Check-in went smooth. I was impressed with the lobby also. Very classy and very clean. The room was absolutely gorgeous. We had a non smoking room with a king size bed and a balcony overlooking the ocean. It was very clean and very comfortable. The room was also furnished with a 40+in. LCD screen t.v. which gave the room a modern look and feel. The bathroom was also beautiful. Shower was amazing. The view from our balcony was amazing. Overlooked the pool and ocean. Room also had mini bar and snacks which we didnt purchase. But we did order breakfast in bed a couple mornings and it was very delicious. Only spent a couple days at the pool but it was very nice and clean. There were some little kids around but no trouble at all and we were able to relax around the pool. There was also a fire pit next to the pool that was very nice and warm. Didnt purchase anything from the tiki bar but it was nice to have out there if we did decide to have a drink. 1 thing I didnt like was the parking. You have to park across the street or pay $15 a day in the valet lot. Overall we loved the hotel and our stay at The Shores Resort and Spa. If I were to go back to Daytona we would definitely stay here again. Cant go wrong at the shores.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value at a Oceanfront Resort”
Reviews.Author: JKStacy
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for an extra couple of days following at trip to Daytona for the races. LOVED this hotel. From the personal service as you walk in the door to the comfort and style of our room, everything was great. The bed was incredibly comfortable. The twice daily housekeeping was a nice touch. Loved the showerhead! And I could have slept like a baby cuddled up with my hubby next to the fire pit listening to the ocean waves crashing - so relaxing. Only one minor complaint - the mini-bar coordinator came knocking both mornings while we still had our Do No Distrub sign hanging on the door. When I'm on vacation, I love to just lounge of a morning and not have to rush to get dressed just to answer the door. I would definitely stay here again (in fact, my girlfriend and I are talking about a return trip to try out the spa).

Reviews.Title: “The BEST resort in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: flnativegrl
Reviews.Content: This is my 5th stay at the Shores Resort and Spa. My husband and I stayed recently from 7/7/08-7/8/09. Since we live in central FL it is easy to get away for a night or two for a mini vacation. We were there to celebrate my husbands birthday with friends. The rooms are nicely appointed, and the beds are very comfortable. This is by far the best hotel in all of Daytona Beach, and it is located on the more quiet end of Daytona. Not a lot of screaming kids everywhere. The service at the pool has been lacking in prior visits, however it was perfection this last visit thanks to Emily. We always rent a cabana (highly recommended) and although you should receive the same great service no matter what, we always felt like we should have at least received good service. The lunch and drinks by the pool are great. The cabanas are very comfortable with pillows and all. Service in the restaurant Azure is outstanding. Although it's a bit rediculous to charge $30.00 for a piece of chicken, the food is excelent!! My favorite is breakfast, many choices and of course the same great service. The Azure staff was kind enough to help me embarass my husband for his birthday in singing happy birthday to him, thanks to Stephanie for all of her hard work and attention to detail. All in all I would recommend this hotel to anyone visting the Daytona Beach area, it will change your mind in what you typically think of the area!!

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mcnr
Reviews.Content: We just had a wonderful weekend at the Shores Spa and Resort. (6/20/08 -6/22/08) . The room was better than expected. Nice and clean and the most comfortable beds. The service exceeded our expectations. When we arrived we mentioned that we would need to use the sleeper sofa and they sent someone up right away to make the sofa bed. We had a King size ocean front room. The view was wonderful. The kids had a great time at the pool and the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “The Shores saved our vacation”
Reviews.Author: floridajo
Reviews.Content: We were in Daytona for a family reunion. We are from the Gulf side of Florida, which tends to be a little more low-key with lovely hotels, quieter beaches and an atmosphere that caters to just about every interest. We started out on the north edge of the beach strip at The Plaza Hotel. It was dirty and grimy with an unsavory bunch of vacationers. There was actually a fight in the parking garage while we were there. When we realized what sort of element we were surrounded by, I immediately pulled out my laptop and logged in to Trip Advisor. One reviewer seemed to have the same experience and wrote they had gone over to The Shores. We phoned The Shores and fortunately they had openings. We packed up and checked out and couldn't have been more thankful. The difference in hotels was like night and day. The Shores was a dream. The rooms were well-appointed with an incredibly comfy canopied bed with Egyptian cotton sheets. We kept the sliding doors open at all times for the lulling sound of the waves. The marble bathrooms were roomy with a great shower. The pool was fabulous with canopied cabanas and fountains for the kids to play in and a Tiki bar with a friendly and accommodating staff. Because, we checked in that day, they did have to put us on a smoking floor with a promise to move us when anything opened. When you got off the elevator to our floor, you could definitely smell smoke, but I was pleasantly surprised when we got into our room. Unbelievably, there was not even a trace of smoke smell in the room and I have an incredibly oversensitive nose. I don't know how they do it, but we didn't even feel the need to change rooms. Our view and room were so lovely. We were only able to book a room for 3 days even though we wanted 5, because the hotel was full on the weekend. They told us, they would let us know if there were any cancellations and by our second night, they had informed us they had the availability. The fires on the pool deck at night were fun. My kids got S'More packs from the restaurant and had a blast making their favorite treat. Like I said, at the beginning, we were nervous coming into our vacation, due to Daytona's reputation for attracting a hard-partying crowd, but our stay was so wonderful, we booked an additional 2 nights. That side of the beach was great. We rented a golf cart one day and we were shocked at the difference on the beach, the further north you go. It was much more populated, I'd say three to four times more congested with a ton more cars and utter chaos. The Shores is situated in what seems to be a quieter area. Our girls rented bikes several times and had no problem navigating around on that side of the beach. One note, if you're looking for fine dining, there's not a lot in the Daytona area. The hotel restaurant was good, but even better was The Chart House. We've been to a Chart House in other parts of the country and once again, it did not disappoint. The views of the water are lovely and the food is fabulous. Our last day at the Shores, there was a sailboat regatta in the water right in front of our hotel. It was a beautiful, sunny day and between the view of the sailboats from our room, the attentive staff and the luxurious room and hotel, we didn't want to leave. A big thumbs up to The Shores Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Poor staff”
Reviews.Author: Weddingparty08
Reviews.Content: Service was so sub-standard for such an expensive hotel($314 per night). We asked for a courier service to return tuxedo's and were turned down without explanation. Wait staff in the restaurant and bars had no sense of urgency except for one woman on one day outside. The inside bar was several times not stocked with menu items. A special request for a room makeup late in the day instead of early, was received with a tongue lashing from the maid and a poor job. Pool closes at 10pm and a call at 11:00pm to say that there was lots of noise outside our window only received an excuse that it's ok to use it if it's kept quiet. The noise never stopped. I would never stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “The Shores was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: An0nym0us70
Reviews.Content: The Shores Hotel and Spa stands out among the run down and generally depressing selection of cheap motels and shoddy hotels on Daytona Beach. At the Shores, one feels that one could be on one of Florida’s more upscale beach venues - Miami or Palm Beach perhaps. The Shores offered outstanding meals and customer service. Free parking across the South Atlantic Avenue (connected to the hotel by a skywalk) was an added benefit. The only small glitch in our wonderful stay was the fact that we had to call housekeeping twice to have the bathtub unblocked (but it was done efficiently and immediately the second time we called down to reception) and that housekeeping was stingy with those wonderful Molton Brown bath products (our stock was replenished only once in a 4 night stay).The other hitch, not a fault of the Shores, was with our reservation via Skoosh.com (made close to a month before our stay). We were delighted with the excellent rate we obtained, but calling to confirm our reservation a couple nights before our arrival, we found the hotel had no record of it. The local Skoosh agents had neglected to fax it over. Thankfully the problem was sorted out in minutes and the hotel happily accommodated our 1:00 am check-in.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Property”
Reviews.Author: SPQR711
Reviews.Content: We felt extremely fortunate to have received a reservation to this property via Price line bid. Just wanted to spend a night on the beach during a visit to the NASCAR experience but after arriving we found the atmosphere and scenery so overwhelming we decided to stay another two nights. Gave my 12 yr old son the option of returning to Orlando & a water park or remaining at The Shores and he choose to stay and play on the marvelous pool deck, relax in the large Jacuzzi, sit fireside at one of the two pool deck fire pits & splash in the surf of the adjacent ocean. Front desk receptionist, Courtney, was very friendly & helpful and valet, Arnold, was extremely accommodating and went above & beyond to assure we had great customer service. Found the hotel to be a first class, though pricey, experience with a couple of exceptions. They allow smoking on the pool deck and it seemed we repeatedly had to relocate to avoid inhaling cigarette fumes. The other complaint is in regards to the director of operations who I found to be the most conceited, arrogant and un-apologetic hospitality manager I've ever had the misfortune to deal with. Mr. David Smiley is the main reason I didn't rate this property as excellent and he would be the only reason I would consider not returning to this property.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in Daytona Beach”
Reviews.Author: jbsss
Reviews.Content: Daytona Beach has a up to date luxury hotel. We completely enjoyed The Shores. Room was modern, nice size. Hotel lobby, bar area and restaurant very nice. Pool area was a little small but nicely done. Outdoor Tiki bar & service was good. Evenings by the fire pits and/or the outdoor music was great. Thought the food & drinks were a little pricey compared to the room prices. This is not like any of the old Daytona Beach hotels. We'll return.

Reviews.Title: “Classy & Value”
Reviews.Author: peachesdad
Reviews.Content: Much of my travel is professional. Thus, my hotel is paid for by sponsoring organizations & I am glad someone else is picking up the tab for places I usually regard as overpriced. While my stay was underwritten, the Shores is someplace I’d gladly return paying out of pocket. Fairly pricey but definitely value for money. Clean, quiet, good gym, free internet. Great pool & beach resort. Free parking & covered bridge across five-lane avenue (only hotel around with same). Very attentive service. Minor drawback-requested wakeup call, not received; room coffee pot did not work coffee cup was dirty. Minor flaws, would not preclude an enthusiastic return.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in Daytona!”
Reviews.Author: 2parisigo
Reviews.Content: My 2nd visit better than the 1st (and that was near perfect). Wonderful hotel, spa and pool. But what sets it aside from the rest of the best is their management team and staff. Beautiful, well planned rooms with ooh la la baths.. Smokers are welcome, but as a non, I never knew it. Pets are welcome too! The gym is like everything else..topnotch..Extras like evening visits from housekeeping, to pool service ... all adds up to outstanding service and value..Can't wait to return!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: DianneWashingtonDC
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a lovely beachfront property! The staff is professional and friendly. The food at Azure was amazing! The firepits and cabanas are a unexpected surprise. What a great getaway adventure. I can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: lolo1827
Reviews.Content: This hotel was wonderful! The rooms were clean and very nice. The atmosphere was relaxing and romantic. The pool and beach area were beautiful, with firepits at night. We loved our stay here. Although I do not think we will ever go back to Daytona for vacation, if we do this will be where we stay!

Reviews.Title: “what was to be enjoyable was a NIGHTMARE!”
Reviews.Author: DebSaskCanada
Reviews.Content: We planned a winter getaway from the -50 degrees and blowing snow so booked an ocean front room so we could leave the door open and enjoy the sound of the ocean and the fresh air smell.WRONG!All we "enjoyed' was the smell of non-stop smoking from the next door client,if it wasn't him then it was her so needless to say,our door to fresh air and the sun was CLOSED.This hotel seems to cater to the smokers I see,anyone who suffers from allergies STAY AWAY!The restaurant is slow,maids clean room even if DO NOT DISTURB sign was up,and hotel is extremely noisey-you hear every door slam and water running in the middle of nite when someone decides to shower.This was NO HOLIDAY!!!I do not recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: smiley0820
Reviews.Content: Not sure when I stayed at the hotel. The hotel was great, I didn't like the balcony rooms were only king bed (something like that). I would have rather liked a room with a balcony. Windows opened so that was cool. Hotel restruant was kind of expensive. They had a little fire area by the pool and bar, that was nice to sit at. The pool was alright, liked the beach better. Stairs to get down to the beach. I didn't like parking, it was across the street, but how there is a overpass above the road, made it safer to get to your car, although the overpass was hot in there. If you stay at the hotel, you should ride on the beach with the golf carts, they are fun, and you can view different parts of the beach. Loved this hotel & Would return!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Accommodations & Service right on the beach!”
Reviews.Author: JJ2007_1
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at The Shores Resort and Spa for a meeting and found the hotel to be just wonderful! The resort is a contemporary and comfortable venue with first class service! The food and servers at Azure (the restaurant) were both terrific! The pool cabanas were lovely. And of course, the beautiful Atlantic Ocean right out the door, very nice views all around. The guestroom and bathroom were both first rate. Very nice amenities in each. I will definitely recommend family and friends to The Shores!

Reviews.Title: “Recommended”
Reviews.Author: philf2
Reviews.Content: We stayed for four nights and would go back. The hotel and service were first class and the room had a splendid view of the ocean and beach.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel in Daytona Beach!”
Reviews.Author: Reppulc
Reviews.Content: I had stayed at the Shores in the summer of 2006 for a conference and fell in love with it then. I was back this weekend and wasn't disappointed. It's a medium sized hotel that has a small hotel feel. When you walk into the lobby you are greeted with an elegant yet comfortable atmosphere. The front desk is made up of two podiums to your right which makes the check in process seem less of a "process" and more like a greeting from your host. They play beautiful music in the lobby that wafts to the upper floors which all open up to the lobby in an atrium fashion. The rooms are down hallways and closed off, but the elevators and meeting rooms are off of this open area that allows you to enjoy the beauty of the lobby as you come and go. The bar is located at the far end of the lobby and has a cozy, warm feel. Saturday night they had great live music playing. What really completes the ambiance, is when you step out to the pool area. The hotel is right on the beach. The pool area is tastefully decorated with comfortable lounging furniture and even has the "bed" lounges piled with pillows. There is a fire pit area that looked very appealing on a cool December night and the tiki bar looking right out to the beach and ocean. Once you get to your room, the delights continue. They have chair rails and crown moldings and cool comfortable blues and yellows on the wall. The art work is not your typical hotel cheap looking prints. The flat screen TV and DVD player are nice touches. The bathroom makes you stop and wish it was your bathroom at home. There is a Kohler bowl sink sitting on top of the counter and the shower has a wonderful shower head and an open glass look. I didn't like hte closet being in the bathroom, but that is my only criticism. My room had a balcony and faced out to the ocean. I think all the rooms have balconies, but some are on the side of the hotel and don't provide a great view. But the ones on the back are awesome. The sound of the surf is loud and wonderful. I got a great December deal on Hotwire for just $79 but the rate directly with the hotel was just $90. That will change as we get more into the season and when Bike Week and the Daytona 500 are going on. But if you're there at the right time, a rate like that is something you shouldn't miss This hotel is worth $300 a night easily. I am not a huge fan of Daytona Beach though. I was only there because a friend was visiting from out of the country and is taking some classes there. But I was thrilled for an excuse to stay at the Shores. Daytona is lacking in sophisiticated venues, but the beach is beautiful. I highly recommend people come over to the Gulf Coast of FL, especially to the Sarasota area, and enjoy the beauty of the beaches, more cultural options, and many fine dining restaurants to choose from!

Reviews.Title: “loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: lmkpequotlakes
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Shores at the end of our vacationand wish we had spent the whole vacation there. The rooms are big with beds that are to die for. The hotel was very clean and well kept-up. We did not eat at the hotel so I can not comment on that. Nice touch on cool fall evenings is the fire pit outside on the pool deck , it has comfortable chairs and over looks the ocean and for added fun you can buy smore kits at the front desk. We had a great time and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “great place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: guess07
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Shores at the begining of Oct. for a girls weekend and it was wonderful! The lobby was very nice and so were the rooms. We booked a room with a river veiw, but the parking lot was the main view with the river in the distance. The room itself was larger than I thought it would be. We had a little trouble with the TV, but someone came and fixed it as soon as we called. The staff was amazing! While at the pool someone was always checking to see if we needed anything. We ate at Azure one night during our stay. It was a little pricey but worth it. The food was great and so was the service. We also spent some time at the bar at the hotel and had a wonderful time! The bartender was great and very friendly. Overall the trip was amazing! The staff went above and beyond to make the resort very comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Beautifully decorated and furnished”
Reviews.Author: kiwimiss
Reviews.Content: Wonderful lobby and entrance, and very friendly discreet check in desks (we walked right past them). This was booked as a surprise for me and it couldn't have been lovlier. The rooms were beautiful, although riverside view is more like 'carpark view with river in the distance'. No matter, it was still nice. The beds are comfy, but on the small side, we'd have been better off one is each bed, rather than sharing. The rooms are huge and the bathroom is very nicely decorated, with vanity area just outside of it, and complementary bathrooms to use. I had a spa treatment booked, and while the booking of it was frustrating apparently (it was part of my surprise), the treatment itself was heaven. Felt the 20% tip automatically added to the room tab was a bit of a liberty though. Parking is across the road, accessed via overbridge, but you do have to pay whether you park yourself or use the valet. There isn't really a lot in this area, but as we were going into daytona for the Bikerfest it didn't really matter.

Reviews.Title: “Overall -- very nice!”
Reviews.Author: bethy2120
Reviews.Content: We arrived around 6:00pm on Saturday, for a one-night stay, and were checked in immediately. The lobby is beautiful, and very nicely decorated. There were nice candles lit in all of the various seating areas – immediately creating a welcoming environment. I had booked the room via priceline, so knew better than to expect an oceanfront, king room, on a high floor with a balcony. Of course, we got the exact opposite – double room, facing the river. I absolutely could not complain. The room was HUGE (see pics)! The décor was tasteful and stylish -- very “beachy.” The beds were BEYOND comfy – the sheets must have been Egyption cotton, 400-thread count. The bathroom lovely, complete with granite countertops and a wonderful showerhead. There was even a separate vanity outside the bathroom, which is always a plus. There were 2 robes in the room, which I always appreciate in any hotel. Oh – and I must mention the Molten Brown products – loved them. We had drinks at the Tiki Bar outside – the service was great. The bartenders were very attentive… we even wandered over to one of the cabanas to lounge and they came over to take our drink orders. Perhaps they were afraid we were going to drink and dash – no matter, it was nice having service without having to move. We ordered a couple of appetizers from the bar inside the hotel – the Quesadillas, while expensive at $16, were excellent – and the crab dip – a steal at $10 IMHO, was fantastic. Service was very speedy, as well. Breakfast was a bit slow the following morning, but still quite good. We certainly enjoyed dining al fresco by the pool. There is really nothing much within walking distance from the hotel, but honestly, we never felt the need to leave. We enjoyed the grounds, the pool and the atmosphere so much, we decided to stay put during our short stay in Daytona. I highly recommend this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed in Daytona”
Reviews.Author: scsod
Reviews.Content: Stayed here over Labor Day weekend 2007 : conference combined with some lesiure time with my family . The main public areas are very nice however we were disappointed with several other areas. The rooms are nice, the king rooms are better than the double rooms. King rooms are the only ones that have a balcony. If traveling with kids the double bed rooms feel small and no balcony. We asked for upgrade, larger room and after 4 conversations were not compensated. Even though it was labor day weekend, it was noisy in hotel with wedding going on. No room service menu in the room and front desk personnel were rude on different occassions to different people in our party. You have to pay $8 per day for internet access and call down for a code....which most of the time took ahile to answer the phone. We did like the Molton Brown toiletries. The ocean view rooms are the only ones to be had; the "river view" is really a view of a parking lot and busy main road. Lunch via room service for 2 adults + toddler was $65 eacfh day. Food was average. Nothing much to be found in hotel "store". Beach was nice though. We were disappointed overall.

Reviews.Title: “Shores Resort & Spa”
Reviews.Author: ColombiaRiz
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed at the Shores Resort for 1 night and paid $300. I made my reservation online through Expedia and paid extra for an oceanfront room. I was expecting a balcony where I could sit out and enjoy the view. Unfortunately, not all the oceanfront rooms have balconies. I tried to switch, but was told none were available. Despite that incovenience, I enjoyed my stay at the hotel very much. The rooms are in excellent shape. Very clean, well decorated and comfortable. I especially liked the plasma tv, marble/granite bathroom and comfy bed. The only thing that I did not like about the room was the shower was not fully enclosed. The glass partition was missing a door and it made a huge puddle in the bathroom floor. The pool area was nice with poolside bar and towel attendant. Access to the beach/ocean is extremely convenient. We did not eat in the restaurant but did order breakfast from room service. The country egg breakfast was one of the best I have had in recent memory, although pricey. I would definitley return to this hotel but would request a balcony room in advance. I would also wait for an off peak weekend hoping to get a better price.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and maybe too chic”
Reviews.Author: bayblues
Reviews.Content: Stayed for one night on family business. Lovely property, pool and beach are nice, the beds are heaven. You pay for parking-- whether its valet or self-park, didn't know that from the web.Poolside cabanas are availabe for an extra charge. Beach umbrellas, etc. are rented from vendor, not provided by hotel. Also, don't bother paying extra for "Riverside," which is really streetside with a view of the Intracoastal about a quarter mile in the distance. You'd do better with partial view or of course, beachside. Restaurant mucho pricey and there aren't many others within walking distance. My suggestion to The Shores? Turn down the electronica "catwalk" music in the lobby or do without. Lots of comfy sofa areas and no one holding conversations or snuggling with a book because of the loud, high-energy noise. Honey, this is Daytona, not Cannes.

Reviews.Title: “"Heavenly" Absolutely perfect”
Reviews.Author: neata
Reviews.Content: Just returned from The Shores Resort at Daytona. We selected this hotel because we were looking for a "NICE" place to stay on the beach that welcomed our pets. The Shores Resort was absolutely perfect for us in every way! It's a beautiful property and we were more than pleased. We didn't want to leave! We will continue to stay at this property every trip to Daytona as long as they welcome our pets. Dining at Azure was a wonderful experience. Wonderful food, excellent service and so romantic. Can't wait to return......... We loved The Shores at Daytona.

Reviews.Title: “Top drawer for a beach town”
Reviews.Author: Pamgoes
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a wonderful, upscale venue. Formerly a Hilton, the new owners have revamped the place to the nines. It IS expensive for the area, it IS upscale. Many of us locals are wondering if they will make it for the long haul. The rooms are high tech gorgeous. The restaurant is on a par with La Crepe, in Ormond Beach. If you want fried food and beer, go further south to Ponce Inlet. If you want to 'dine' this is the place. Lunch is as good as the dinner..dine inside or out...bar service is available when the restaurants are closed. We love going here for a special occassion. It is definitely a cut above the usual beach venue. Many Europeans find this a delight in season.

Reviews.Title: “Business Trip - expected a lot more”
Reviews.Author: 2getaway2
Reviews.Content: Transportation: I arrived at Daytona Airport. The taxi to the resort was around $30 and the ride took 20 minutes. For those driving, there is a parking lot in front of the hotel. Arrival: I was expecting a front desk and was confused where to check-in. There are two podium-like stands on the right as you come in and that's where you check-in. Check-in was quick and efficient. Room: The room was well decorated and had a comfy/tropical feel to it. The hotel describes a stunning waterview of the ocean or the intracoastal waterway. My view was of the front parking lot and the waterway in the distance and I wasn't impressed. I'd recommend that when you book, ask for the ocean view. The walls were pretty thin and I could here talking and the tv from next door. The plasma tv was large, although I had a few problems with the tv turning on properly and the remote. There was a an overpriced minibar. Bathroom was clean, but a little small. Restaurant: I dined at Baleen for dinner and like other reviewers I felt it was overpriced. My meal was over $70. I dined with a friend and she asked a question regarding an entree and the waiter was rude and arrogant with his response. Afterwards, I felt uncomfortable and just wanted to leave. Needless to say, the next night I ordered room service which was wonderful... quick and friendly service. Next door is the Top of Daytona Restaurant which has a fabulous 360 view of Daytona and more reasonable prices. Pool/Beach Area: Pool deck was crowded and it was hard finding a spot. Pool was small. Beach area was well-kept and beautiful. Gym: Small and equipment was too close to each other. Spa: Did not use. Service: I expected a lot more from this resort. I had problems with the tv in my room and called to have the problem fixed. The person on the other end 'talked me through' resetting the tv. I was attending a conference at the resort and asked for a late check-out (1 hour) and they stated they could not accomodate my request, so I left the early. Location: This was my first time in Daytona. The resort is secluded and if you don't have a car, your options are limited. Around the hotel it's pretty dead and I walked a mile in both directions. Overall: For the value, I definitely expected better service.

Reviews.Title: “OK but Daytona Beach aint great”
Reviews.Author: jtkoo
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Shores Resort while in town on business. Although the outside is not too impressive, the interior is rather nice. The rooms are spacious and bright, decorated in bright, seaside decor. Rooms included comfortable beds with feather tops and large flat-screen TVs. The view was rather disappointing however. I was supposed to have a "water-front" room. However, the room was actually located on the side of the hotel, and overlooked the roof of an adjacent section of the building (and I was subject to the constant wrhrrr of the A/C units) and the parking lot. Off in the distance you could see some of the beach. Oh well. Service was spotty. I had no offers of help when I pulled up to the door, nor when I left. The business center was apparently being renovated during my stay, but they placed a laptop in the lobby for guest use. At night, the staff was particularly helpful, even allowing me to use their own computers to print out my boarding pass. Housekeeping was rather rude, however. I was waiting in my room for some friends when housekeeping knocked to make up the room. I explained that I would be leaving in 10 minutes and would she mind coming back at that time...this did not please the housekeeper at all. She proceeded to glare at me and mumbled something under her breath. Baleen, the hotel restaurant, was OK. It had an ambitious menu that may have been a little beyond its skills and was quite expensive. Room service for breakfast was quite good however. Overall, the hotel was pretty nice. But the town of Daytona Beach really isn't anything to write home about. It looked old and kinda run-down and trashy, and there wasn't a whole lot to do. There was essentially no boardwalk, a few scattered Putt-Putt courses, and a shopping mall. So if you are looking for a nice destination, then this is definitely not the place for you. However, if you are going to be stuck in Daytona Beach anyways, then the Shores is a pretty good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Skip this overpriced looser”
Reviews.Author: Traverl1
Reviews.Content: This hotel bosts a multimillion dollar renovation. I guess that was an expensive coat of paint and a few plants. The resturant is way overpriced, the food terrible and the staff is utterly confused. The constant music from the pool area supplied by the hotel is a constant distraction and nusance that can be heard all the way down to the beach and goes on all day and into the night. The hotel staff refuse to turn it down and have no idea that people do not like to hear the same kind of music. The caliber of person staying there was about what you would expect now that they give everyone credit cards. Every kind of trashy person you can imagine was drunk by noon and combined with their childrens behavior I was thought that a Jerry Springer convention was being held there. Save your money and go elsewhere !!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Shores! Daytona... not so much.”
Reviews.Author: florida57
Reviews.Content: my husband and i stayed here last year for a relaxing weekend trip. we live in florida and were looking for a beautiful getaway spot where we could bring our small dog. the hotel was perfect. the staff was very professional and nice and the service was terrific. there is a parking lot next door with plenty of grassy areas to walk the dog. the rooms are stylish and comfortable. room service food was average. we got a couples hot stone massage at the spa which was nice, but pricey. luckily, we planned to spend the weekend just at the hotel, because there is really nothing around there worth seeing or doing. wonderful spot for a weekend getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Very Stylish yet Not Snobbish”
Reviews.Author: mirlow
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights during Spring Break. We had a river view room and once we got there I tried to upgrade, but they were sold out on Saturday. I didn't book it orginally thinking I would save the $$ instead, but once we saw what the view was like I was so mad at myself. Oh well, live and learn. Plus not all ocean view rooms have a balcony. We were very impressed with the size and style of the room. The beds were sooooooo comfortable. The hotel reminded me of a boutique. Very stylish and comfortable. The grounds were amazing. Everything was very clean. We hung out at the resort every day. The kids loved the ocean as much as the pool area. We were on the beach one day. Another day it was rainy so the kids hung out in the hot tub, which was pretty much all ours. We got a cabana on our last day and enjoyed the comforts of that as well since the pool area got pretty crowded on Saturday. Of course there are your usual pool chair savers. It was nice not to worry about finding a chair since we had a cabana. Lots of nice people staying and working there. The food and drinks were very good. The ambience at night was very romantic with the ocean, fire and live music. We had a nice relaxing getaway and hope to be back!

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: trenary
Reviews.Content: This hotel is wonderful, we where very welcomed by the friendly vallet people, front desk workers were friendly & helpful. The rooms where clean & nice. Would recommend this hotel to friends. Actually we had plans to only stay at this Hotel for two nights then head down to the Ocean Walk~ But after leaving and comparing the two we where back at the shores within hours & stayed here for the remaining of our trip. Not teens drinking, no loud over populated rooms next door. No under age room rentals. Very safe clean pool & hot tub. All arround a great place. Thanks

Reviews.Title: “a great hotel”
Reviews.Author: catmanEngland
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel due to its location - away enough from main street but close enough to enjoy the action of the bike week. I was really pleasantly surprised. The hotel was well furnished and comfortable. The staff were helpful - apart from reception who did not know much about the events of bike week - which i thought was surprising due to the importance of its effect ot the hotels business. They were also unsure about bus/trolley times as well but they did lent me a laptop. The staff were around early to ensure you were well looked after especially round the pool which was heated to bath like temperatures so made a dip at 7.30am in the morning possible even though the weather was a bit cold. Breakfast was good and well served and the staff in the restaurant and bar were very quick and helpful. I would certainly recommend this hotel. Try to get an ocean view with balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Let's get real - not a great experience”
Reviews.Author: DMFG
Reviews.Content: OK, I am here during Bike Week and I'm here for business, not for the beach or the bikes, but let's be realistic about this hotel. Maybe by the standards of Daytona Beach it's good, but it doesn't rate on any international scale. Fine, I arrived at 2 am but there was no welcome - I had to wander around the lobby trying to find someone and when I did they weren't too pleased to see me! Before I got that far, I had had trouble finding somewhere to park - there was clearly no valet service at that hour but also no indication of where one might park oneself - I found myself in a rather sinister underground carpark, clearly not intended for guests! My room was fine, nothing special but clean and quite acceptable - apart from being on the road side - the constant noise of passing Harley Davidsons, even at 4am, became more than irritating but I recognise that I have the misfortune to have to be here at an unusual period. A minor detail - it would be nice to have tea as well as coffee in the room, and to have all the lights working. I think my less-than-total satisfaction with this place is linked to a number of things: I certainly wouldn't describe the decor as cool, trendy, up-to-the minute or anything of the sort. The public areas are dark and gloomy and the signing is poor. Waiting for elavators takes a lifetime. The gym is worse than one finds in a budget hotel. The staff are superficially friendly but the actual service is pretty standard - that is to say, not great. The restaurant is to my mind disgraceful. I knew the moment I saw that the first member of staff to approach me was toting two blue bottles of designer water that I was in for an exercise in form-over-substance. My soup was a tasteless glue and my main course a piece of over-cooked fish with an over-salted crust, a garnish which was like eating hairs and a combination of two gluey sauces. What I wouldn't have given for a piece of fresh, lightly-grilled fish with some vegetables? What can I say about the absolutely disgusting 'monkey bread'? Over-flavored with thyme and rosemary - herbs that should never be partnered - AND cheese (!) and served with not just olive oil but also balsamic vinegar and black pepper - someone needs to tell the chef less can be more and good food doesn't need this kind of overkill. I wouldn't eat breakfast in the hotel either because one should only provide table serivice - as opposed to buffet - if the service is prompt and efficient - which it isn't. The shop is staffed by a delightful lady but didn't cut it as a hotel shop - no books, magazines, sundries, drinks, cigarettes - nor as a resort boutique - too small, not enough merchandise. All in all I was grateful to find a room at this busy time but wouldn't dream of coming back to stay here except for business, and then only in an ocean-front room. And a last word of warning for anyone under 5ft 19ins - the chairs on the restaurant terrace are so low you will almost have your chin on the table!

HotelInfo.Name: Shores Resort and Spa
HotelInfo.Address: 2637 South Atlantic Avenue, Daytona Beach, FL 32118 (Formerly Hilton Daytona Beach Oceanfront Resort)
